content: ['Fabulous food, service and old school live Jazz band serenade over dinner - even on a Tuesday night!']
title: Fabulous ambience and delightful service from Roxanne!

content: ['Boisdale Canary Wharf is part of a coterie of British restaurants in London, the others in Belgravia, Bishopsgate and Mayfair. It is a large old-fashioned clubby sort of place spread over a corner of the first and second floors within the Canada Place skyscraper. There is a space for live music at the darkened end of the upper floor restaurant with views over Canada Square. The walls are covered with prints and pictures including some striking female nudes. As this is a Scottish restaurant the waitress wears a short kilt, fishnet tights and a sporran. It also comes with a lifestyle magazine for sales of gin and whiskey edited by Boisdale’s founder Ranald (sic) McDonald. That Scottish delicacy of hamburgers features heavily on a menu that probably hasn’t changed much from the 1980s when Boisdale first opened. Without a 50% discount on food it’s all quite expensive, solid rather than inspiring British cuisine whilst being far from a fine-dining experience. Think sausages and mash, steak and chips, bubble and squeak. I started with a suitably retro cocktail with saucy shrimps as well as larger prawns with added shards of lobster on a bed of creamy lettuce and slaw. Probably slightly inferior to an equivalent I recently enjoyed in a fish restaurant in Hull. I followed this with the dish du jour calves’ liver and bacon on a bed of creamy mash. The liver was very slightly more cooked than the medium rare I had ordered; clusters of bacon much more so. Best of all was an iced nougat dessert with blobs of apple purée. There are some beers on draught as well as in bottles but not on an extensive wine list with at least one bottle over the £2000 mark suggesting pretensions that the food simply doesn’t match.']
title: Upscale McDonalds

content: ['My first visit to Boisdale. I visited on a Friday night - Soul Night! The bar was busy, but not crowded, with inside and outside space.', "The music was great and the place had a good atmosphere. As you'd probably expect, drinks here aren't cheap - cocktails from £12.50, with a spirit and mixer roughly the same (although available from £10 upwards).", 'The bar staff were professional and all in all a brilliant night out.']
title: Good night out!

content: ["I took advantage of a groupon offer as I was meeting a friend who lives nearby and we wanted to see what the place was like. We've both passed it many times on the way to somewhere else, but because it's above street level it's hard to know what's up there. ", "Anyway, it's a very nice space, upmarket brasserie-style, with some tables overlooking Cabot Square. It looks as if they can cater for private parties and larger groups. ", 'Service was charming and attentive, the wine list goes from low in price (for London), with some interesting bin ends, to pretty high - so something for everyone. Cocktails, aperitifs, dessert wines, whiskies etc etc all look interesting. ', "We asked for our chateaubriand to be served rare and it was beautifully cooked, with large portions. We didn't need to ask for the bottomless chips as our initial serving was generous, and there was good quality bread and butter on the table. Our side of garlic & chili mushrooms was also well above normal quality. ", "The dining room wasn't too full but it had a buzzy atmosphere and I imagine it would be a good place to see live music. It was unfortunate that we didn't have much time to spare otherwise I'd have liked to have stayed to see the blues band that was warming up on stage. The tables that don't have a good view of the stage have screens, so everyone can see. Also, the dining room is so large that the music probably won't be overwhelming if you're not there for that.", "The groupon deal is amazing value; it's a great way to discover a place you've never been before. I arrived early so had time to look at the a la carte menu posted outside which offers a good choice, and the cheese trolley looked varied and interesting. I will definitely be back when I have more time, to try some different things and to see some music."]
title: Very good, will return

content: ['Not very busy when we visited. Service pretty slow and the waiter was over familiar and used language not acceptable to the type of restaurant it is. Food ok but not outstanding for the price.']
title: Boisdale

content: ['I booked this Friday soul night for me and partner for valentines, I had never been before , we parked in Cabot square and it was very near we didn’t know what to expect but it was a pleasant surprise, it was rocking great music we had a 3 course Meal a few cocktails could have gone to the bar and had a boogie if we had the energy , great service can’t fault it , well if I’m being picky the sirloin steak was a bit tough but all in all a really great place to go']
title: A pleasant surprise

content: ['We went for a Sunday brunch a food was okay. Service wasn’t great and our drink order was wrong twice. We had to wait a long time for the biscuits when having the cheese board however. We had a brilliant waitress called Violeta who made the experience enjoyable for the table. Would go again because of her and venue.']
title: Mrs Coakley

content: ['3 of us went for a chilled Sunday lunch whilst staying at the Hilton Double Tree. We have been here many times before and this has become one of our goto places. Excellent music, great food and Sunday lunch is excellent value as well.']
title: Sunday lunch with friends

content: ['Me and my family came here for Sunday brunch today to celebrate my Dad’s birthday with some live music. The music was good but everything else was very disappointing. The waiter struggled to understand what we were saying and really struggled to take our order. They were slow to bring wine / serve us drinks. Our starters were then slow in coming too, luke warm at best and on not the cleanest plates. Having arrived at 1:15pm we were served our mains at 3:30pm! My main was the cod which was rubbery and dry and and missing a key ingredient - chorizo. My dad has the pasta which was tasteless and everyone else had a roast which was okay. They then didn’t have the dessert I ordered which was the chocolate brownie so i ordered ice cream and was served sorbet. All in all a disaster and I can’t believe this place is still going and was as busy as it was, do not waste your money coming here! ']
title: Me and my family came here

content: ['We have visited Boisdales again this week for the second time, the service and food we received was exceptional. We were served throughout the evening by Julien who deserves a special mention for his attentive service.Again we will certainly visit Boisdales in the future, Thankyou again for a truly exceptional experience.', 'Thankyou ']
title: Boisdale Another Visit

content: ['100% bang on the money zero complaints cant wait to come again thank you thank you thank you loved e wry minute of it!!! Dont change a thing']
title: Sunday lunch

content: ['had a table at the Frank and Dean show event on both the 14th and 21st December. Both evenings were fantastic and really set the scene for Xmas for us. Show was great however, the food and service were even better.', 'Well done Boisdale for a great job on packed evenings.']
title: What a start to Christmas

content: ['We expected a lot more from Boisdale but we left feeling underwhelmed and disappointed. Firstly the menu we were given was a reduced menu, we had to ask three waiters before the manager came to explain why the normal December a la carte menu was not available. My partner and I ordered a medium rare ribeye steak each but when it came, it was the wrong order. We then had to wait another 15 minutes for our steaks and when they came, we were disappointed that they were medium rather than medium rare (for steak lovers, this is a big deal!). Our bill was over £200 for two courses and four cocktails. We were expecting a fantastic experience for the price we paid but we were left feeling disappointed.']
title: Disappointing especially given the price paid

content: ['Had the best night at the Frank and Dean xmas show this Christmas. The restaurant was buzzing and the staff were so attentive. They managed to whiz around serving loads of tables and even joining in the dancing! Brilliant. The good was great as always and Frank and Dean were superb - such a great night. ']
title: Had the best night at the Frank & Dean xmas show

content: ['I had to send the dessert back twice as the plate was very dirty and greasy – the second time via the Manager. The first time the waiter (who did not talk at all!) disappeared for a few seconds and brought back exactly the same dirty plate.', 'The wonderful waitress (Roxanna) later told me that the Manager said that I would not be getting a bill for any of the lunch. I explained that I had pre-paid online by charge card and she said that that was not a problem.', 'I checked my charge card account and no refund had been made so I emailed them on 24 December. To date they have not even bothered to reply let alone refund me.', 'This is a regular Sunday lunch spot for a number of us and this is the third time where it has been necessary to complain.']
title: Dirty plate, silent waiter, no refund as promised, no response to email.

content: ['Good standard steak and sides, gets lively on a Thursday when the band come out about 9. Wouldn’t say service is most attentive ']
title: Good standard steak and sides,

content: ['Lovely setting and location. The food was too salty, way beyond health standards. Restaurants should be fully aware that too much salt or sugar causes health problems even if the customer is not diabetic. It is a common knowledge. Was surprised the waiter did not offer to change the dishes for a non-salted one, as other restaurants do. No extra water was offered and only a small percentage was taken off the bill. Usually waiters won’t let you pay for food at all if it does not match customer satisfaction. ', 'Also I requested for the service charge to be removed. Under the Consumer Rights Act, no one has to pay service charge and especially if you aren’t happy with the meal. It is another way of enforcing compulsory tipping. Tipping should always be optional and out of generosity otherwise how else do restaurants get business if they keep adding service charges? They are already paid to serve customers. It is like saying if a customer browses and already purchases clothes in a shop, does he or she need to leave a tip?']
title: Lovely setting, disappointing food

content: ['Visited with a friend tonight. Lovely decor and view. However arrived at 1753 to be told they don’t open until 6pm but we could go downstairs to their other bar. Waiter was pleasant enough but didn’t have the wine we wanted suggested another but no suggestion of reducing the price to the wine we originally ordered that they didn’t have so was charged nearly £50. Food average and totally over-priced. Then as the jazz band came on we asked for bill. We paid was finishing our drinks & waiter came back to say he’d made a mistake & didn’t include charge for music which we obviously said we weren’t paying & left. Not impressed.']
title: Mediocre

content: ['7 of us went for dinner on Wednesday night with a customer. The location and the view was excellent. The service started well but quickly deteriorated. It was a quiet evening in the restaurant so there did not appear to be a rational reason for slowness. The starters were average, the mains were poor. I personally had a steak that was not hot, it was warm as if had been sat waiting to be brought to our table. The customer was unimpressed with her meal and another person on our table had cold mash potato as a side dish. ', 'This was my first and last visit to this restaurant. We were booked to visit on Wednesday night but cancelled the reservation and went to Gaucho in Canary Wharf which was significantly better.', 'If you enjoy steak, you will find better experiences for the same price elsewhere.']
title: Slow service, below average food

content: ['Fantastic place , offers u all . The cigar room was great and the Balcony and Bar was fantastic for winter . The bar service was fast and the service was great in General . ']
title: Fantastic place , offers u

content: ["I had a business lunch here and, all told, it was 'alright'. The location is great, view top class and menu extensive - although the one dish I really wanted the grouse, was off which was disappointing. Service was a touched slow even though the restaurant wasn't busy and prices relatively toppy. My sense is that it was just a bit of an off day and this place will come into its own on an evening."]
title: Mixed...

content: ['Absolutely superb! This is amazing value and top quality food, wine and atmosphere. The staff are attentive and service 5 star. The jazz is great. Such a lovely venue and vibe.']
title: Sunday Jazz Brunch

content: ['Excellent food and service with a great musical performance by Alexander O’Neill. Our waiter was very attentive making sure our glasses were kept topped up and we never had to wait to ask for a drink. The food was excellent and once again the waiter excelled himself with his recommendations. Strongly recommend the Barbary duck if you are visiting on Friday. The entertainment was spot on and was a trip down memory lane listening to Alexander O’Neal belt out all of his hits. A top class venue and thoroughly recommended. I feel I have to mention the complete idiot (the man with the grey hair) who sat a couple of tables away with his friend and their two partners. The way in which he spoke to the waitress was just down right ignorant ... apparently he had to wait 32 minutes for his food. BIG DEAL - doesn’t give him an excuse to belittle a young lady and young man who were trying to appease him. Then the way he treated the manager was just rude - if it was me I’d have told him where to go but Wael the Restaurant Manager went above and beyond to try an resolve the problem. Then to top it all Mr Big and his entourage stood in the aisle dancing and obscured the view. Fortunately the sideshow did not spoil a great evening and they thankfully departed when the 80s music came on afterwards and we continued to have a great night. Thank you Wael for the complimentary drinks - we will definitely be coming back.']
title: 10/10 Excellent

content: ['We booked this restaurant few weeks in advance intended for a birthday with our family, the music and food was very good, service wise I can tell was disappointing, as soon we finished our main courses, we was waiting for the celebration cake that we booked in advance for 4 weeks and our server that I belive was even a manager Alberto he delivered to the table near as. I cannot express our dissatisfaction for the whole experience when I saw this. I wish we could have booked somewhere else...']
title: Dreadful Suday Lunch

content: ['Boisdale, Canary Wharf has been one of my favourite Venues in London since opening. The Food is good, the staff very friendly & efficient, the artistes are very good as is the sound system. Unfortunately after having booked a premium table on the night Alexander O\' Neal was appearing left me rather sad. It was the worse artiste I have ever seen appear at Boisdale, he performed one of the shortest sets, sounded awful, then disappeared off the stage for 10 minutes while the band "played on" ..Really? ...then to see he is also booked for another two gigs? Come on, Boisdale, you can put on better than that..']
title: Re-vamp Artistes!

content: ["So I bought the steak deal for £48 as we were staying in Poplar nearby and shopping in Canary wharf. The food was delicious, we opted out the music and bought a bottle of white wine to go with it. The final bill Inc the money already paid came to £92, the bottle of water was £4.50, wine (cheapest) was £29.50 and service charge £10.25. I like to decide my tip but being English didn't complain.b"]
title: Groupon voucher

content: ["This was in the grill/bar area, on the first floor. We have been to the Sunday jazz lunch before, which was fabulous, but this was different - low key, but first class. Very similar menu (if not the same) - excellent haggis starter and, although we were on a voucher deal, we paid £10 each extra for the fillet, for main course, and it was well worth it - absolutely delicious! The Irish, Bulgarian and Moldovan staff, who looked after us, were delightful and charming. We couldn't have asked for a better lunch experience in Canary Wharf. Definitely will go again."]
title: Lovely lunch, great service

content: ['I booked this restaurant intended for a nice evening with my boyfriend for his birthday. Previously I have been to Boisdale but didn’t realise that their were multiple levels for dinner and music. On this occasion it was the first floor. It wasn’t as I expected. We accepted that the table location wouldn’t be the intimate setting we hoped for. Starters, good. Waiters checked on us thus far, service was flowing nicely again thus far, good. Heard some RnB playing in the background but thought it was a prelude and the artist of the night would be on shortly as my purchase promised. ', 'Mains arrived and it was burnt. We ordered the burger as it was safe. No check backs by waiters kinda told me that, not only they were aware but avoiding what had happened. I didn’t eat it and later told the waiter that finally checked on us later that night. Nothing was done. We advised him to skip desert as it was already going sour in my view. He encouraged us to hang on as we mind change our minds. We didn’t change our minds as the music I hoped for us to enjoy with dinner NEVER came on. ', 'Later I approached the till to ask whether I could at least have my desert money back after explaining the situation and was given an outright NO. The guy became so defensive. I even explained that I understood that I should not have waited so long into my meal NOT HAD to mention me being displeased and he shut me down. It was such an unpleasant, UNWELCOMING feeling. So starter good, burnt mains, no dessert, no compensation and a good bye. My service was no longer needed. Oh, and no promised reggae music DJ person which was included in my £29.99. Apparently they were on from after 10pm and not from 0715pm as stated with my purchase. ', 'I would never hesitate to mention that after I was treated the way I was, I was offered a card for my next visit to Boisdale for some future compensation, shocking!!!! I asked the gentleman to put himself in my shoes, if you had a dining experience with such poor treatment, will you return? Thanks to him for putting the cider and glass of milk with mint leaf (aka pina colada) on the house but I think if customers views, feedbacks and right to get issues rectified aren’t welcome, then please DO NOT TAKE our monies, and especially if you cannot deliver. ', 'Buyers, Boisdale is a beautiful venue for fine dining and fun, lovely music, beautiful ambiance depending on the floor level you select i suppose. I have experienced it previously, 2nd FLOOR ONLY. But unfortunately, this reggae DJ night (which was no where in sight) and Jamaican food situation going on the first floor was delivered poorly. Maybe it was just on our night but the end treatment we were given made us feel so unwelcomed and so ‘whether or not you return, bothers us not’. ']
title: I booked this restaurant intended

content: ['This place has gone to pot. It has come to resemble the worst kind of Soho clip joint', 'from the bad old days.', 'The food came more than an hour late and was of poor quality. The drinks were sharply marked up. The place was mostly empty. no more needs to be said']
title: Nowadays, a sad old clip joint

content: ['I love boisdale dearly i really have a softspot for this place. Boisdale is a place very versátil on way of have a Romantic Between 2 or a lovely gadering time with family and friends. We had amazing 3 courses meal . I definetely enjoyed my stake and sl everyone . The staff are well friendly and very attentive . The singer was superb. What a talent . Thank to the menage Weal that he personaly was making sure our experience should be up to our standart. Once again thank you to everyone who contribute to our best Boisdale Experience. ']
title: David 82rd Birthday

content: ['Loved it here, a little hard to find but we were all wowed once we got inside. Lovely decor and atmosphere with a Jazz band playing In the background. Huge whiskey menu plus a Huge wall full of drinks. Lovely views if you are lucky to get a window seat. Sunday menu not huge but enough to choose from. Squid was very tasty., Beef was very good maybe a little fatty but that didn’t stop it being very tasty. Huge portions with plenty of veg. You had to pay extra for the cheese which I thought was a little unfair as the food isn’t cheap. All in all a great place which is excellent for a special occasion and I will definitely return at some point']
title: Nice relaxing venue

content: ['Fab atmosphere at Alexander O’Neal evening! Plenty of god music, excellent view of the stage and plenty of dancing!', 'Food was fabulous, up there with the best I’ve tasted and oysters were the best I’ve had!', 'Wines a bit pricey but the norm for a restaurant ', 'Will defo be returning ']
title: Fab atmosphere at Alexander

content: ['Open table had 50% off for 7pm slot on a Friday night. Had drink in bar downstairs to restaurant first, it was very busy. Mixed age group.', ' Al A Carte Food choice good. Everything ordered was tasty and hot. starters of Chilli squid was yum. Scottish salmon looked lush. Mains one haggis, burger x 2 , cod loin.', 'Portion sizes good. Waiter was professional and friendly. 12.5% service charge added. If we had stayed seated after 9/30 we would have been charged £15.00 per person in our food bill but this was explained. We chose not to stay. Definitely return. They have Rat Pack Xmas show with dinner which may be of interest.']
title: wonderful ambience

content: ['I had the 2 course set menu, beef steak and it was superb. Thick and succulent all the way through.', 'The set menu was very limited in options and I found it difficult to chose between the options. But I think everything we had was very good, and I wondered if their strategy is present a limited menu but do it well.', " I chose not to have the fries with cheese but soon regretted it: the thrice cooked chips are coated in truffle oil and the simple description on the menu tells you absolutely nothing about the taste or quality. Unbelievable flavour. I'm a middle aged guy , been out to many restaurants in my time, but the favour of these fries is unique and superb.", 'For desert I opted for the Orange sorbet which was of unbelievable quality.', "Whiskey: the whiskey menu is a book over 30 pages long! Where do you start? ! It was dark and very hard to read, and it just wasn't clear if they were selling it by the glass (single or double measures) or only by the bottle. These are top quality malt whiskeys costing a lot of money. One bottle of whiskey in a display cabinet near the entrance was priced at £250! In the end I didn't for a drink."]
title: Superb food : highly recommended.

content: ["heard a lot of good things about The Boisdale & the amazing DJs from Mi Soul. I wasn't disappointed with the music which was made for dancing!!", 'The two course dinner was just above average but very affordable. Service was attentive & friendly.', 'I would definitely go again for the music but I think the full priced menu will be more appetising!!!']
title: MI SOUL TUNES WITH BOISDALE DINNER

content: ['Our kids brought a groupon voucher for us to have champagne dinner for our 25 anniversary - Food was wonderful coupled together with champagne cocktails for me and husband enjoyed various whisky cocktails - had a great evening. Our waiter Nathan eas very attentive which added to our evening. Will definately go back to experience the live band etc']
title: Amazing experience

content: ["I was invited to dinner at this restaurant for a Jamaican Night Theme - the food was very good and the service was excellent. The drinks were a bit expensive, then why go out if you can't afford it. The music was excellent Reggae, Rnb at it's best it was good to see Saxon in this environment. Bless up see you again soon."]
title: Food Drink & Music

content: ['Poor food, poor service, I’ve had better roast dinners in a Toby Carvery for a third of the price, the venue is great food and service just not up to standard.']
title: Sunday Lunch

content: ['Our second visit here, food was great as always, wine I always find a little on the pricey side (but I guess depends how much you drink;) The entertainment was Legend a Bob Marley tribute group, they had the place rocking!! Always happy to come back to Boisdale. ']
title: Good food, great entertainment

content: ['This is a Scottish restaurant located in the same building as the Canary Wharf train station. It is a lovely restaurant with excellent food and service. I was very impressed. It was somewhat complicated to place the reservation.']
title: Excellent food and service

content: ['Went mid week as part of a Groupon deal. Best chateaubriand I have ever had. Opted for a bottle of house red... more than happy. The restaurant is spacious with an upmarket feel without being pretentious. Look for the deal. It’s well worth it.']
title: Great lunch

content: ["Wonderful atmosphere, great people who also happen to be the staff, can't do enough for you. If you're looking for a great time to sit back and have a cigar from a world class cigar list, have your choice of a great range of whisky and any other spirits you can think of, this is most definitely the place. Hungry? Indulge in top shelf food."]
title: Another excellent evening at Boisdale Canary Wharf

content: ['Cannot rate the food but the venue itself had a very smart ‘clubby’ atmosphere and would definitely return if and when have occasion to be in Canary Wharf.']
title: Arrived too late

content: ['I was suggested this restaurant by a colleague who lives in London. I went here for a business dinner and my client was very satisfied.', 'We all took the “probably best steak in the world” and it was really great meat.', 'Very English-style interiors and friendly staff.', 'My Irish coffee was cold though.']
title: Great steak

content: ["Got treated to lunch today. Excellent service by Martin. The meal was lovely and fresh great atmosphere I can't wait to go again."]
title: Great Meal

content: ["We visited as a party of eight on Sunday for a family birthday. So sorry to say that everything was a bit mediocre. The food, by the time it arrived, was lukewarm. Multiple attempts to get (very straight forward) drinks and other simple requests forgotten. The service was just dreadful - so so so slow and it actually spoiled what should have been a lovely family occasion. I'm not sure I'd go back and wouldn't recommend it to anyone else - certainly not at a cost of £450."]
title: Awful service

content: ['The food and music were great. It was only about half full which surprised me for a busy restaurant. But the service was a real disappointment. It took half an hour from being seated to getting our drinks and having the food order taken. At one point we waited half an hour for G&T despite chasing it up three times. Still not as bad as the guy on the other table who had been waiting forty minutes for his drinks and started following the head waiter round - who literally ran away from him.', "Service issues were blamed on a trainee barman - but honestly I don't care. Get another barman. The place wasn't full and the still we had to wait and wait.", "So yeah it was a nice meal, but when I'm dropping £500 on a meal for four I'd like some half reasonable service."]
title: Great music and food, really poor service

content: ['What can I say other than what a great night out.', 'My only complaint was that we were sat right by the bar and when we tried to buy drinks were told we could not be served at the bar and had to order drinks from the waiters, this meant we had to wait for a waiter to come over and take our order to stand at the side of us to give the barman who was 2 feet from us our order to then have to wait for the barman to fill the order that was then put on a tray to be delivered to our table 2 of our seats were actually touching the front of the bar. This took 3 times as long as it would of if the barman had just served us, and then we were charged £4.95 service charge for each round of drinks.', 'This is not on when although a great night is already expensive as there is an entrance fee then meals to buy and of course the drinks and service charge.', 'I ordered a pint of beer, 1 glass of wine 1 coke and a sambucca cost of this round including the £4.95 service charge was £45.95. ', 'So very expensive.']
title: Great night with great music and food but uneccessarily expensive

content: ['The food, including the steaks, was good. The music (Courtney Pine) was very good.', 'The service was unbelievably slow. It took more than 20 mins to order.', 'When we had finished our main course, we had dirty plates on our table for 25 minutes before they were cleared.', 'It was too late to order a pudding because everyone was leaving and tables were being cleared and we did not want to eat a pudding, or drink another glass of wine or a coffee in that melee.', 'The slow service ruined our evening.']
title: Good food, good music, terrible service ...

content: ['My son & I had supper and enjoyed excellent food, wine and beer. The second visit also included a blues band. Would have preferred a female singer.', 'The atmosphere was great with attentive service. Great value.']
title: Visited twice last week.

content: ['We decided to book tickets for Boisdale after it was recommended by a friend, my husband likes Pink Floyd so as they had a tribute band there it was a perfect choice. ', "We arrived early as I'd read you could have drinks on level 1 which we did, the prices are very reasonable which is always a bonus. We sat taking in our surroundings and enjoying the drinks feeling very relaxed, there is a terrace area on level 1 but the seating was full as it was a lovely evening, I noticed people were ordering from a food menu too, we also had no trouble getting served at the bar (I'd seen people had in other reviews).", "We made our way to the main restaurant on level 2 for our meal, I'd prepared using an app called Fever, we had two courses paid and then dessert and drinks to be paid at the end, the service charge was included and was well worth the charge, we had the best service from start to finish, the food was amazing and the band was great, we will definitely be going back. "]
title: 20th Anniversary meal

content: ['Reggae night with delicious Caribbean food. The music was fantastic, atmosphere excellent, great night out in the city of London. ', 'A big thanks to the organisers for putting this event on, look forward to going again. ']
title: Great night out and fantastic music

content: ["Lovely, buzzy atmosphere; great jazz, played by a trio of gentlemen - first class! Just wish the music had gone on a bit longer - it was 1 to 3 p.m. - so two hours, but didn't seem long enough. The food was very good and our waiter, Alberto, wonderful. We will certainly be back."]
title: Fabulous Sunday jazz lunch - SO enjoyed it!

content: ["We booked a table for 8 at this restaurant as a lunch to welcome a new joiner to our team. The service was terrible, the waitress walked off before taking the complete order. After 1hr 15 minute we still hadn't received the main course. When it came we had to send the steak back as it was cold. All in all the food was medioca and several of us were unwell the next day. All in all it was not a very nice experience and we won't be booking again there in a hurry."]
title: Work Lunch

content: ['Love this place, it is classy yet relaxed. We had cocktails outside on the terrace and they were lovely. We then had dinner in the first floor restaurant. The menu was varied and the food delicious, fresh and beautifully prepared and presented. The staff are efficient and friendly. Highly recommended.']
title: Great food and great atmosphere

content: ['The service and atmosphere are excetional. ', 'The place is classy with great food. I will go there again and again!']
title: Great place to wind down

content: ['Incompetant obnoxious waitress the service was very slow I was too embarrass to walk out we were over charge I had 5 visitors from abroad and try to impress them what big mistake I took they for lunch at Boisdale after read review and email the restaurant to if set G&T Menu was available £24.9 per person they answerd Yes when we got there the menu NOT AVAILABLE so we had to pick from the day menu Roase Grouse is on the menu we order and was told is Not available we ordered 1 sea food starter to share price on menu £49.9 for 2 person but we been charge £99.8 we had 2 Aberdeen steak it was tough and served on it own we spent nerlly £300 on lunch. I telephone them no manager able to talk to me sent few emails the just ignore.', ' thought so really']
title: Nice room bad food

content: ['Just got home from a Sunday lunch at Boisdale Canary Wharf. What a great way to spend a Sunday afternoon:', "Food -we all had the roast beef as a main course, and for the first time ever, when my wife offered me the beef she couldn't finish, I had to turn her down as I was full. Superb roast.", 'Service: Andrea our waitress was terrific - we had our 8 month old grandson with us, and nothing was too much trouble.', 'Music - lovely jazz trio playing all the greats, and finished with one of my favourites - C jam blues.', 'Atmosphere - just great.', 'Cost - not cheap, but worth every penny for such a lovely afternoon.', 'Will be back soon', 'PS did I mention the cheese?']
title: Great Sunday lunch

content: ['The Canary Wharf Boisdale has to be one of my favourite restaurants in London. Apart from the great view that you get of the Thames and surrounding area, the food is amazing!', "Boisdale is split into 2 floor; The first floor containing the bar and cigar lounge & balcony and the top floor containing the restaurant. The restaurant serves amazing food whether it's meat or seafood and often have live music which is a bonus. ", "When we've finished our dinner we often go downstairs to the balcony where we have a nice cigar and coffee to wind down our evening."]
title: One of my favourite restaurants

content: ['Visited Boisdale on a Saturday evening. Very odd entrance into the venue And then you have no idea where to head , no signs etc. We were in the bar and a very unwelcoming staff member took my name, said we were upstairs but would we like Drink in the bar. So we had a drink and then went up for the meal. Received our menu which looked good until you see that most things had a supplement. Not impressed, it has cost us £600 for the 6 of us already. With all the supplements we ended up paying an extra £100. If you have an inclusive price you should have a menu we can select from with the odd supplement. Food and service was very nice. The Barry white entertainment was good but would have liked to hear all the old faves didn’t know most of the songs. The set was very short and the night was over before we knew it. ']
title: Husbands 50th birthday

content: ['Variety of dished on the menu, most of which were tasty, as stated by friends. Unfortunately, salt fish fritters too salty. Apart from that everything else was delicious.', 'Great atmosphere and service. The staff were really helpful and polite. Would definitely go again.']
title: Birthday Celebrations

content: ['We had lunch here on a Friday and it was fairly quiet so we got a nice table by the window. However, despite it being quiet the service was really poor to start with. It took 15 minutes for our drinks order to be taken and even then they got it wrong and had to start again, and it was 35 minutes until our food order was taken. When the food did arrive it was very good, though it would be hard to describe it as good value. ', "If you are a cigar smoker you'll enjoy the walk-in humidor and option to smoke inside in the sampling lounge or out on the terrace. There is a quite spectacular range of whiskey to choose from too. ", "Overall we enjoyed out lunch, but it's not good value and the service let us down on the day (were it not for the poor service we would give it 4 out of 5, but we can only judge it on the experience we had on the day."]
title: Tasty, but over-priced and poor service

content: ['I have always found the staff polite and friendly . ', 'However on my most recent visit the Restaurant Manager was extremely rude and abrupt. ', 'Saxon at Boisdale Canary Wharf.... is a yearly even that my friends and I have been attending since last year summer, we’ve always had a fabulous time.. from the atmosphere, to the food cocktails, service, and staff, couldn’t fault it.', 'I booked two free entry tickets on line.. as I have always done,, once there we would find a unreserved table and ordered drinks and a meal from the Jamaican themed set menu.', 'However on my previous visit last week... June 29th...: we were extremely disappointed, the restaurant Manager was extremely rude and abrupt. ', 'Service ', 'We arrived at 5:30pm to find it closed although it opens at 5:30pm... we waited for 10 minutes before the doors opened... as we walked in we didn’t even receive an apology for the wait.... there was a young lady managing the table bookings. She asked my friend and I if we had a table, we told her we had not however would like to order food... as we have always done without the need to book in advance. She smiled at said it wasn’t a problem... The place was empty..however we could see that the majority of the tables inside the restaurant were reserved.. we headed out into the roof terrace where we could see there were quite a few unreserved tables, we were quickly approached by the restaurant manager, he asked if we had a reservation I replied we haven’t,he told us we could only order drinks, I was shocked by this. We’d been on numerous occasions and it wasn’t a problem, I explained this to him ... he then said we could order food but he would need the table in an hour...... by 6:30pm,which I didn’t understand why because there were other empty tables. ', 'At around 9pm we were still sat at the table, we had starter, main and dessert, washed down with two cocktails. We were asked to leave the table by the restaurant manager, while we were drinking our cocktails!. I found him very abrupt and rude!. He didn’t even want us to finish our drinks! He presented us with the bill and stood over us as if to rush us to pay.... our waiter was very pleasant and attentive ... the food was presented to a high standard and tasted superb therefore I would have paid the service charge.... however because of the treatment we received by the new restaurant manager I told him to remove it! ', 'Food 2 course Menu £19:95', 'Slightly changed menu compared to last year. ', 'For starter I had Jerk chicken Caesar salad', 'parmesan, anchovies, croutons. Main; ', 'Char-grilled 6oz Aberdeenshire rib-steak burger, tarragon mayonnaise, dill pickles, red onion, beef tomatoes, Sides: Thrice cooked hand-cut chips. Dessert; White chocolate & nutella truffle 9.50 milk chocolate & hazelnut ganache,white chocolate mousse, caramelised hazelnuts. ', 'It all tasted superb 10 out of 10 ', 'My friend said all her courses tasted delicious. ', 'Our only criticism was the cocktails of reggae rum punch tasted purely of alcohol which was too over powering.... having Jamaican parents and making my own rum rum punch for large family gatherings I would like to think I know what a good rum punch should taste like. ', 'We also had a Vanilla Daiquiri which wasn’t very nice. I noticed all the bar staff were different to when we were last there last September. ', 'Location ', 'Canary Wharf shopping centre. Roof terrace. ', 'Overall the experience with one of the managers was extremely unpleasant and quite off putting, he needs to learn how to greet guests on arrival, and make them feel welcomed instead of coming across very obnoxious! ', 'The three stars are for the food only, it would have been 4 if it wasn’t for his rudeness and not very well made cocktails. ']
title: Saxone at Boisdale

content: ['Made a last minute decision on a Friday to visit somewhere on Canary Wharf. I had heard of Boisdale as a pseudo music and food venue, so thought would give it a go. How lucky were we ! The Luther Vandross inspired show presented by the excellent Fil Straughan was terrific. To call it a tribute denigrates what it was , top draw musicians crafted a great night of live music. Fil is clearly a well rounded singer , he ended with Prince’s Purple Rain ‘ but he can sing anything I reckon. To give some context , all of my spare cash is spent on music events 17 so far this year of various perceived quality , Elton, Billy Joel , to Golf club crooners - so I think I know performance and talent - Fil is right up there. The food was more than adequate service excellent and the pre- dinner cocktail on level 1 was served with a smile and the 80’s decks was great for my age group. These unexpected pleasures are always the best and I can see us being regular visitors looking at the programme of future events - and especially if Fil returns - then I am bringing a crowd !!']
title: ‘ Brucie bonus ‘ !!

content: ['Three old friends were roaming around at Canari Wharf, and we needed a cool place to sit and dine on a very hot day in London. We bumped into this restaurant, by chance. It turned out to be a good choice. Cool atmosphere, with live music, and great food. The service was good, too!']
title: Relaxing and cozy restaurant with live music

content: ['We went for a family meal last night. The service was begrudging and charmless. Our warm starters arrived three minutes after our cocktails. Our mains were poor - glorified fast food - really greasy chunky chips.The bread was perfect, though. The steak was rubbery and cold. The scantily-clad young women on roller-blades give this place a weird and anachronistic feel. To be avoided.']
title: Very disappointing

content: ['My Wife and I went with Friends for Sunday Lunch , never again. We ordered pre lunch drinks one of which was a Campari and Soda , attempt number one arrived at the table the Soda was poured and then mysteriously disappeared. Attempt number two arrived with at least 5 yes 5 dead flies in it , attempt number three arrived all looking well until the waiter knocked the Soda water over with water everywhere. ', 'Starters passed uneventful, the mains were a different story. Every meal bar one was cold. On complaint every meal was taken away and fresh food was presented but the Yorkshire puddings were still cold so they were returned for a second time , I gave up complaining on the third attempt. After the Main course the waiter cleared the table , he managed to spill the vegetables all over my place and seat luckily I wasn’t in it. ', 'Lastly they had sold out of the dessert that we wanted. ', 'The Management were very aware of their short falls and took the service and an additional 20% of the bill although a nice gesture they need to up their game and be mindful of what comes out of the kitchen and what’s served in its glasses.', 'The Jazz though was very good one favourable thing in a very very disappointing lunch. ']
title: Comedy of errors

content: ['Family of four, mature! We all had a great time “Imagine the Beatles” were great. Danced and sang for two hours. Food and service were great. ']
title: Beatles night

content: ["I've been here many times over the last few years and it has always been fairly lively. The food is good, sometimes excellent, but it can also be a bit pricey. The booze is excellent and there's enough bottles of single Malts to kill a rich man's liver. But what a way to go. The decor is plush very Scottish and the food from Scotland Grace's the menu. Live mini haggis starters, salmon, steak and burgers. There's live jazz most nights (Jool Holland is director of music, or something like that). The cigar lounge is where you can taste fine Havanas for as long as you like but cigarettes are a no-no. ", "The downstairs bar is adjacent to a nice smoking terrace. Ranald McDonald who owns the place has been collecting rare vintage photos of famous people for years and they are up on the walls like a photo gallery. It's not cheap to eat and dine and smoke here but it's usually worth it. If you want to enjoy the live music bedt to check it's on before you arrive. Very good place for business groups and City types. Personally I prefer Boisdale Belgravia which is a lot cosier. Worth a punt if you want a special night out. It all depends on the night for it's sometimes quiet. "]
title: Upmarket cigar-friendly venue

content: ['Had the set 2course menu with extras. Had the Haggis as a starter and the Squid both very tasty and a good size. Mains were Roast sirloin of Gloucester Old spot pork, braised peas, bacon & lettuce, Black Truffle rib-steak hamburger', 'watercress, melted Swiss cheese, roast mushrooms and Char-grilled herb marinated free-range chicken breast', 'asparagus, pea & heirloom tomato salad, grain mustard & lemon dressing. Had side of Truffle, rosemary & parmesan chips. All were well presented and tasted great.', 'Now we did have the 2 course set but added two deserts... Baked passionfruit cheesecake and the 5 cheese cheese board - Shorrock’s Lancashire Bomb, Stinking Bishop, Wigmore Small, Harbourne Blue Half and Colston Bassett. Wow a fantastic selection of cheeses all strong and full flavoured.. Lush!', 'The meal was down with Merlot “120” 2017 very acceptable easy drinker.', 'The waiter was first class very friendly and attentive.', 'The show was brilliant. We had seen the Jersey Boyz show a while back and this was a good pracey. So all in all a great night out. ']
title: West End Jersey Boyz

content: ["Celebrated my birthday here with family and friends on the 29th We were warmley welcomed and my birthday was celebrated with the best service. Wael was outstanding from start to finish and made me feel very special. I can't thank him enough. Food was delicious and was West Indian dining with Reggae/Soul music playing curtosey of Saxon Sound!", 'Cocktails were delicious! Great evening. ', ' ', 'Thank you all we will definitely be back!']
title: Amazing!

content: ['A really relaxed place. Nice bar area and a restaurant on the top floor.. The staff here are externally professional and friendly.', 'Brilliant place for private events. Will come back again.', 'Thank you to boisdale team for making it a memorable evening! ']
title: Mémorable !!

answer_text: ['Dear DRT46,', 'I’m sorry to hear that although you enjoyed the venue, location, décor and the ambience, you found the quality of the food to be disappointing. The matter since has been brought to the attention of our Head Chef.', 'Please do get in contact with me at gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk to discuss it further.', 'Kind regards', 'Tony H.']
content: ['We bought VIP show tickets to see a Frank Sinatra tribute. Great venue, great location, good decor and ambience, fabulous wine list (not cheap but a great selection). Reception was warm, friendly and helpful. Table service initially was good too.', 'We had a fab table right by the stage. The ticket price included dinner (£125 pp). It was sold as a specialist seafood restaurant, my favourite. The menu however was very limited. Oysters and Lobster were the only seafood and they were all extra (Lobster was +£15!) All sides are extra too starting at £6. The quality of the food was very disappointing. We had chicken and lobster. Both were over cooked and dry. The lobster was tiny, the chicken was tasteless despite being smothered in herbs. ', 'No one asked how our food was or offered us any accompaniments. It was hard to get the attention of anyone. ', 'Overall we had a great evening as the act was truly world class (Stephen Trevitt is as close to Old Blue Eyes as you’ll ever get).', 'I would return but not for food which was a real let down. If this had simply been a restaurant meal I would have given it a rating of terrible. Extremely poor quality and poor value for money. Watch out for the “discretionary” service charge!!']
title: Great venue, dreadful food

content: ['Having had a not so great time here in January I gave it a second chance & we had a lovely evening at the Fleur East concert. The customer service was great, steaks were good & we were served promptly this time around. Nice that the floor manager remembered us & went out of his way to make us feel welcome. Thank you! ']
title: Was impressed on my second visit

content: ['Fantastic place ', 'Had the haggis starter with a shot of whiskey - yummmy yum ', 'Then followed it up with the steak tartare ', 'Fabulous quality and service ']
title: Ohhhh the haggis

content: ['Great bar hidden away in Canary Wharf.', 'Plenty of beers on tap and a great selection of spirits too. There is even a cigar bar in the back.', 'Well worth a visit']
title: Awesome bar

content: ['Paid a fortunate visit to Boisdale for a drink and we were lucky enough to have been received by manager Wael who generously showed us around. ', 'What a beautiful venue with the most impressive whisky bar I have ever seen! ', 'To be sat on the terrace, looking at the sun setting was a grand experience too, it is a great bar which definitely is worth a visit. ', 'Thank you team for being so welcoming and friendly.']
title: What a venue, superb service

content: ['We visited Boisdale for my husband’s birthday since he loves Scotland. It is a beautifully decorated restaurant and the food was very good. However, the male waiter was arrogant and inefficient. He approached our table asking if we were ready to order prior to asking for a drink order. After the meal several of our table were served dessert while two of us waited and waited for a dram of Scotch. Since it advertises its large selection of Scotch it didn’t seem it would take that long to find. I was appalled as I observed him roughly grab a female waitress by the arm when asking her a question. The female who waited on us was very nice and efficient. We visit Scotland often and always enjoy their waiters. Perhaps Boisdale should recruit one of them to add authenticity to the atmosphere. ']
title: Atmosphere could be more Scottish

content: ['Ordered the special. Had cod. Was very average and extremely salty. 250 quid for 4 people for lunch and only 2 people had a glass of wine... sorry. Won’t rush back ']
title: Disappointing lunch

content: ['Went to Boisdale for the first time 2 weeks ago. Absolutely love this place. When we got there we did not have a reservation and it was very busy. But the lovely staff there really went out of their way to help and gave us a table before the other people arrived. The food was very good. We went on a Saturday night and had West Indian food with Reggae/Soul music playing. Great evening and it finishes late at 1.00am so perfect for us. Everybody loved their food. Drinks a bit pricey but we are in Canary Wharf!! Will definitely be going again.']
title: Beautiful Bar/Restaurant/Live Music

content: ['The Boisdale has always been a favourite choice of ours for business lunches and special occasions so we booked for a birthday meal for 6 people in the bar and grill but as it was quite busy the manager kindly seated us in the restaurant which was a lovely start to the evening. Unfortunately that was the only nice thing about the night. The restaurant was not very busy but we were left waiting for over half an hour to order any drinks. We gave up in the end and ordered at the bar. We were eventually approached by the waiter to take our order. ', "When the food arrived it was with poor service and two of our party have ended up with suspected food poisoning, having both eaten the truffle burger. At one point a member of staff approached our table and said that if we didn't keep the noise down they would call security! We were not being rowdy at all and were just talking amongst ourselves. To say we were gob smacked was an understatement. In all the times we’ve visited the restaurant we’ve never been treated this way. ", 'Then to add insult to injury, they slapped a service charge on the bill when the service and general attitude of the staff had been appalling. ', 'This will be the last time that we ever use the Boisdale and will never recommend.']
title: Gob smacked

content: ['My wife booked this joint as the meal was accompanied by a with a live band,our table booked for 7.30pm got seated ordered wine and champagne bottle of each both were very nice but a bit pricey,we ordered starters Haggis which was wonderful with the whisky,we then had the Chateaubriand for 2 that was enough not stingy with the portions ', '9.30 band started we had finished our mains and deserts by then,band was very good a lot better than the food i must say.', 'would i go back again YES I WOULD.']
title: Mixed feelings

content: ['We went to this restaurant for their Sunday lunch with jazz music. It was a fixed three course menu including a glass of champagne. The food, atmosphere and service was brilliant. Definately worth a visit.']
title: Lovely jazz lunch

content: ['Two family members ordered the sirloin steak and were very disappointed with quality. It was over cooked ( asked for medium rare ) and the meat was very chewy. One ordered chicken casserole, the chicken didn’t taste like it was cooked in the sauce and was bland.']
title: Disappointing steak

content: ['We had for the second time a Groupon voucher for a chateaubriand and a glass of champagne each. Venue was nice with a window seat showing the local square. Service was very good with nice staff. The champagne was good and not a cheap version. Ordered a nice bottle of Argentinian red (although a little expensive).The chateaubriand was great , large portions and terrific flavour. The voucher is very good value. The whole experience was great and look forward to returning.']
title: Great chateaubriand

content: ['Yet again this place has not let us down, amazing meal, the steak was superb, the service excellent. ']
title: Chateaubriand!!!

content: ['Delightful high standard restaurant with landmark posture and great views. The ambiance is enriched by live music, a jazz trio in our case. Steakhouse-like menu, food was very good though not unforgettable, service slightly snobbish but the experience is very worth it. ']
title: Classy night

content: ['The service was exceptional ,attentive, polite considerate and amenable . the staff could not do enough to ensure that we had a wonderful experience. the food was very well presented and was of a very good standard as i would expect. the cool ambiance of the Jazz band added to a wonderful weekend']
title: A party of 10 had Sunday Brunch/Lunch , Amazing service Restaurant Manager Wael fantastic service

content: ['Went for dinner & show option as heard it was a good night out. Started out well, greeted by a lovely Manager who said the 1st show was lively. Had a table near the stage, in the beginning staff were attentative. It went downhill from there. The food was so disappointing, as it was a "special occasion" we had a bottle of special Boisdale pink champagne!!! We\'ve have had better Cava. Bottle of Chablis, would not have been happy if we\'d paid £8-10 in a supermarket for it & we paid a lot more for it!!! The Bohemians were brilliant & encouraged us to join in & dance. 4 "Managers" were milling about, told us to sit down; the lovely staff we started with disappeared (two private parties); it was extremely chaotic we ordered dessert, 5 staff passed us & did everything to avoid eye contact as it was coming up to finishing time, finally got dessert they forgot one, we were trying to finish up and they started stripping the tables around us.... Very unprofessional. So much so we paid up and left and will be in no hurry to return.']
title: Dinner & Show Boisdale Canary Wharf - No rush to go back

content: ["We booked the three course dinner on the Rod Stewart tribute night last Saturday. The meal was delicious with very experienced, professional and friendly waiters. A very good tribute band far exceeding expectations completed a very enjoyable night. Just make sure that when you book the three course meal you get the three course menu on arrival as your confirmation email doesn't specify and you have to provide evidence of your original offer to the resteraunt manager."]
title: Brilliant Food, Brilliant Entertainment

content: ['This was advertised as a Marathon Brunch, we have actually been coming to this place for the last 6 years and there’s always at least 30 of us. We’re all different ages and generations, Mum/Dads, Nans/Grandads and children so not a rowdy bunch or troublesome group in any way! We pay £30 each just for the breakfast plus additionally a whole day of drinking as well so we spend an absolute fortune with these guys year in year out (easily over £1500 in total). I’d expect some kind of service for such loyal customers especially as the place was empty apart from us!!!', 'I’ll admit that £30 is a very expensive breakfast especially as the food has never been great but in previous years it’s worked for us because we could watch the Marathon on the tv, and with so many of us it’s a good base where you can easily get a drink and use the facilities all day so we invest in the whole experience really rather than just the breakfast. ', 'This year was an absolute nightmare, we arrived at 10 o’clock to find out that the “Marathon Brunch” did not have any tv’s that work so we couldn’t actually watch the marathon at all… The staff half heartedly tried to get the tv’s to work but it was clear that they had no clue and they never got them to work. The breakfast arrived in buffet trays and we were all told to help ourselves like school dinners. There was no toast and when I asked they said that they would see if there was any bread upstairs. They got some bread by which time as all of us had finished. I had a hair in my scrambled egg and they made no effort to apologise they just asked me to help myself to another breakfast from the buffet. I actually asked the waiter if he’d pay that kind of money for a breakfast like that and he said no which says it all really. Then I overheard him telling the manager what had happened and the manager said he didn’t want to talk to me. ', 'A bit later on, I ventured out to the road with a glass in my hand which I probably shouldn’t have done really but the TV’s weren’t on and I wanted to see the race considering that it had been such a shambles in Boisdale. I had every intention of coming back up to get another drink and bring the glass back with me too. The manager was in the lift with me and said nothing then as we left the lift he sarcastically barked at me, “Enjoy your glass won’t you!” And walk off the other way. Because of his rude comment, I was rude back to him (perhaps I shouldn’t have but I was just so disappointed that we’d recommended this place to so many people and come back year in year out and spent thousands of pounds here). All he had to do was ask me like normal human being to leave my glass inside and I would have respected his request. No need for him to be sarcastic, very childish behaviour.', "Absolutely gutted and let down but this place which is a real shame. We’ll be finding somewhere else to spend our money next year! Somewhere that actually appreciates us. Absolutely gutted and disgusted with the staff. They made absolutely no effort to help us at all and really didn't care that we're such loyal customers."]
title: “Marathon Brunch” a with no TV’s to watch the marathon... Terrible breakfast for £30, egg had hair in it, rude manager.

content: ['A well know Scottish themed restaurant and cigar bar. The smell of cigars is always in the background not offensively. The restaurant itself is imposing and large, staff friendly. Menu could have been more extensive and food itself fine but not outstanding..']
title: Scottish themed restaurant in Canary Wharf

content: ["My husband and I went to have dinner and watch the Bob Marley tribute band Legend (who were wonderful) last Saturday. Our table was booked for 9:00pm and the band was due on at 9:45. Our table was not ready until 9:25. When we arrived we were told to go for a drink at the bar downstairs (where it was impossible to get served) so we didn't bother and we thought our table would be ready; unfortunately not - we had another wait. No one offered us a drink (complimentary or not) or even suggested we have a look at the menu so we could decide what to eat while we waited. The front of house staff could not have cared less. The delay meant that we were eating (what was very mediocre food) as the band performed and therefore not able to get up and dance. Our waiter, who was Brazilian or Portuguese, was great - helpful and very attentive; the only member of staff we came across who was any good. When the band finished the bass beat from the disco on the first floor could be felt through our chairs and totally drowned out the background music in the restaurant. I mentioned this on the way out but no one was interested. We have been twice before for music events and enjoyed ourselves; this was a big disappointment."]
title: A disappointment

content: ['Fabulous food, Sunday lunch menu was very good! Reasonably priced wine, lovely setting, good service, great entertainment . Would highly recommend!']
title: Sunday lunch with live jazz

content: ['We went along to Boisdales to see the Zombies before their induction into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. I really wanted to score the experience more highly but sadly the woeful service when we arrived led me to drop one star at least. We waited 20mins before any sort of waiter arrived. This meant we were thirsty and agitated from the off. ', 'When it did arrive, the food was very good with the chilli squid and burgers being very tasty. ', 'The gig itself was very good, but sadly that wait for service reduced our satisfaction.']
title: Mixed feelings!

content: ['Booked it though an offer on Groupon Although the food was superb the service left a lot to be desired, chateaubriand tool nearly an hour from order to be plated. Couple next to is orders theirs 10-15 mins after us and for served at almost the same time. Restaurant was half empty and they put a couple next to us which was snug at best, couldn’t have a conversation as it felt like I was at a table for 4 instead of a table for 2. Asked for my bill and waited 15 mins. Saw about 20 serving staff not doing anything and decided to up and leave, knowing I only had the service to pay (which I didn’t have a problem with ) at this moment two different severs approached me about my bill. I explained about my wait and they let me leave without paying it. It’s my belief that they were trying to make us stay so they could incorporate the music charge into our bill.']
title: Mixed bag

content: ['Only good parts: starters and cocktails.', 'The rest.. a disaster: chewy steak, dry gnocchi, slow waiters, horrendous tribute band - was supposed to be all cuban stars, I think they picked them up off the London Bridge, nothing like in the picture advertised; main vocal was more concerned with shouting in the microphone than singing -, no toilet paper in stalls, faulty water tap and hand dryer. All and all, a real carelessness in everything.', 'One would accept this low quality from a 2 stars restaurant, but the prices here...']
title: Disappointed for the “cuban” night

content: ['This was one of the most appalling evenings I have ever experienced. The customer service provided by the waiting staff, restaurant manager and general manager is terrifyingly incompetent. After one waitress knocked my drink all over my food and the table I then asked her if I might have my food and drink replaced, which she did reluctantly with a confused look on her face. ', "You cannot see the stage unless you pay for VIP tickets, and the TV screens they have around the edge are out of time with the music, and you won't be able to move seats closer to the stage even though they are not occupied or booked for later in the evening, so don't bother asking! ", 'The food is extremely poor quality and shockingly over-priced. We finished the evening and left early once I started vomit-burping into my mouth due to the acidity of the red wine. Fun times!']
title: You have been warned!

content: ['I both 2 VIP tickets for the Michael Jackson Tribute show where I paid about £250(terrible decision). On the ticket is written that the performance starts at 9:45 and finishes at 11:45 and I was shocked to see that the band started to pack up at 11:00. I was also late 20 min(my bad) and all I had left to see was 30 min of show and extremely poor dishes. I have told the waiter that I am a bit disappointed as on the ticket is written clearly 11:45 and not 11:00 and he replied that the show before got cancelled and this being the reason. Well!!! I don’t care!!!! I paid to see the show until 11:45 !!! Overall was a waste of money and time as I spend in total around £300 including drinks, drove 2 hours and haven’t got any kind of experience. Don’t waste your money here..']
title: Extremely disappointed

content: ['A very interesting establishment with a not very interesting cuisine in the restaurant based in the second floor. However the live music does help a little bit the restaurant has an interesting ambience very classy with a very high class infrastructure the display on the bar with the entire selection of whiskey is very pretty to look at. However the staff really need to be a bit more confident and interested in the clients. When I went downstairs on the first floor for cigars and whiskey everything changed. A very well educated staff member named Phillip who knows the product the establishment are selling the cigars and the whiskey Philip has a vast knowledge of both of the ski and cigars and recommend which cigars to have with which associated whiskey quite an extraordinary gentlemen who takes attention to detail very seriously excellent customer service provided by Philip I will definitely come again maybe not for dinner but for sure to see and visit Phillip again and to indulge in another cigar and under his recommendation perhaps another whiskey.']
title: After dinner you can have cigars and whisky

content: ['Fantastic food + really good atmosphere. Service was excellent. We really enjoyed the music + had a really good view of the stage. Would recommend for a special occasion.']
title: Jazz lunch

content: ['Went for the 50% off anniversary prices on the steak and lobster. Food was tasty and the service was good also. Portion sizes do not justify the price however, in particular the gratin potato for £9 and the dessert was also priced at £9 and both plates were so incredibly small! Was excessively dark also, dimmed lights yes and but it was too much and could barely see the menu. Temperature was uncomfortably warm inside. The inside and the view is very and food was tasty but not as good as it can be.']
title: Nice visit

content: ['I went to this restaurant tonight and have to say I was a little disappointed. The food was nice but not stunning. However, the little things let it down. Steak delivered but no steak knife. It was a comment on the medium rare that you simply couldn’t proceed without asking for a different knife. We ordered spinach as an extra but got chips! ', 'None of this is crazy bad but for the cost of the meal probably not really good enough.']
title: Ok nice but pricey for the experience.

content: ["If you are in Canary Wharf and looking for a place to have a drink, look no further. Step in and you are taken back in time. The ambience is cozy, 1960's and classy. If you are looking to have dinner, reservation is recommended.", "If you are there just for a drink, head to the bar to read through one of the biggest scotch and whisky collections, if you want to keep it frugal, there's beer on tap too. ", "Head over to the cigar rooms if you do fancy a cigar. On occasional days, there's live music!! (blues/soul/jazz)"]
title: a definite place to grab a drink when in Canary Wharf...

content: ["I and my sister went to the Boisdales on 23rd February it was a set menu with Queen tribute band so payment was made in advance. I spoke to a member of staff at Boisdales prior to the 23rd informing them of my sister's food intolerances I asked them if they can cater for my sister I.e. make gluten free chips.", "On the night of the 23rd there was nothing in the menu the my sister could have apart from steak because everything was pre-prepared. Not even gluten free chips. My sister hardly had a choice apart from steak and the chefs couldn't cater because we were told they are too busy and the manager only apologised when it ruined my sister's evening. ", "I'm very disappointed"]
title: Very disappointed with promise regarding Food Intolerance

content: ['Visited for a business lunch. Venue is tastefully decorated inside with warm, attentive staff.', 'Menu is fine as was the food however for the price I was expecting to be blown away...I wasn’t so based on overall experience & value for money 3/5 is fair.']
title: Nice enough

content: ['I took my husband for his birthday we did one of the special offers so dinner and show were included, the food was lovely, the entertainment was great, we both thoroughly enjoyed it! My husband also loved the humidor and selections of whiskey! If you like cigars, whiskeys, good food, cocktails and great entertainment then you won’t be disappointed ']
title: A great night out

content: ['Place looks nice and when you enter it does seem very promising. ', 'Service is very good, they brought me cheesecake with candle and happy birthday signage on the plate. Waiter even sang me a little song. it was very sweet. But I only had one spoon of cheesecake as it is too awful to eat. Main was ok, but too small and definitely not worth money. Very poor presentation of food too. BAD BAD FOOD and inst it most important thing in the restaurant. Overpriced as well. Well perhaps you pay for interior, service and silver cutlery :DDD']
title: place looks amazing, but food just a huge disappointment

content: ['We were a group of 10 who went to Boisdale for a farewell lunch for a colleague. The restaurant itself is lovely but overall, the experience was very disappointing.', "the food was very mediocre. My starter was described as scallops but there was only one scallop! That is surely contrary to trading standards and I thought it was outrageous. As it was a group lunch with colleagues, I did not complain but a number of my colleagues also mentioned it afterwards. For my mains, I had the confit duck leg, which I found to be quite dry and very salty. I didn't fancy anything from the dessert menu but wanted a coffee. Unfortunately, the restaurant did not offer milk alternatives such as soya which I thought was surprising as milk alternatives are very common these days.", "I found the service below par as well. Our waitress was lovely enough, but quite why she did not write down everyone's orders against where we were seated is a mystery. We were reduced to putting our hand up whenever the waitress called out the drinks or food as they were served. Surely in a restaurant of this standard, the waiting staff should be trained to write down the orders against the relevant patron so that drinks and food can be served seamlessly.", 'All in all, a very disappointing meal for a restaurant of this standard. I am just glad that I was not the one who paid the bill! Boisdale, you really must do better!']
title: Disappointing experience

content: ['Boo, hiss, fake news!! Food was pleasant namely the starter and dessert. ', 'Saxon Sound System!?! Nope.... definitely not the Saxon I grew up with. Absolutely dire!!! The reggae and soul alike were as though I were listening to Heart FM. DJ ? Disgraceful.... Left 2hrs early .smdh. ']
title: Dinner & Saxon Sound System

content: ['I come here pretty often for different occasions. Been here for lunch, dinner or just couple drinks - and pretty satisfied every single visit. ', 'Food is quite good and definitely amazing for the price. ', 'During summer, grabbing few drinks at the cigar balcony is relaxing. ', 'Service can be a bit slow during peak lunch and dinner hours though - so you may need to wait for quite a long time to get your food served. But food is delicious.']
title: I really enjoy this place

content: ['Nice, but interesting fillet steak! It was thin and flat.. Nice food though and quick service. The prices are quite high though, obviously aiming at business customers.']
title: Great food, served quickly and a convenient location

content: ['Just waited 40 mins to be served, apparently the menus are ‘out of date’ and no longer serve the only sparkling Rose they have listed ! The. Had to wait for our cocktail as they had run out of glasses !! Once glasses were available, got a cocktail that didn’t even fill the glass for £11.50 each ! Don’t bother wasting your time coming here, v. poor service & over priced ']
title: Don’t bother wasting your time

content: ["This was our second visit to Boisdale. I took hubby and our kids for Jazz, Sunday lunch for hubby's birthday. The beef was more or less raw and very fatty, potatoes hard, no bread rolls (waiter forgot). TBH I have had better cavery at a fraction of the cost. It is a stunning restaurant with a great atmosphere. But on this occasion food was below the standard you would expect for the price."]
title: Disappointed

content: ['Was told at the door was very busy & would be a long wait for food , which would of been fine if this specialty steak house had any decent chefs ! 2x medium & 1 well done . All came 2 hours after being there pissing blood , sent back, 10 minutes later, they actually made the cardinal sin, and sent the same, (yes they did ) back out, cooked a little more, 2 were still rare & the well done was creamated & tough as leather now , host & waitress were very apologising and genuinely looked embarrassed. Poor poor poor poor show ']
title: Awful

content: ['Our friends took us for dinner and show at the Boisdale Canary Wharf. For me it was reminiscent of a larger Ronnie Scott’s. The show was a fantastic Queen tribute band, great muscians who really had the audience involved. The food and atmosphere was amazing and our waiting staff were impeccable. Will definitely have a return visit in the near future, maybe even to book one of the private dining rooms.']
title: Such a fantastic evening

content: ["2nd time at Boisdales. Queen tribute band which were amazing. Table for 4 people booked for 8:45pm. Did not see sight nor sound of table staff until 9:30 when she took our drink order, which eventually arrived at 10pm. Food orders taken at 10pm - starter served at 10:15, however main course did not arrive until 10:50! Who wants to eat dinner not far short of midnight then to be presented with a bill that includes £30 service charge?? I think not!!!! Could elaborate more, but to be honest I really don't think this place is worth any review at all. Shocking and most definitely won't be going back there"]
title: The worst service - ever!!

content: ['Love this bar great location in Canary Wharf ', 'Great atmosphere for drinks and dinner ', 'Nice outside balcony ... my husband also loves the cigar room ']
title: Great bar and restaurant

content: ["We went to a trubute act for Barry White with dinner. Let's start by saying that the food was truly excellent. It was spoiled by poor service - we had pre-paid and booked a table but although they knew this they still presented a bill for the things we had paid for - nearly everything and took ages to put it right. After the music show had finished they still kept different music blaring so much so that conversation was difficult. When I asked to speak to the manager I had to shout to make myself heard. He had the cheek to tell me that I didn't need to shout at him. I REALLY DID HE WOULD NOT HAVE HEARD ANYTHING OVER THE MUSIC."]
title: Dinner and show

content: ['This was a poor customer experience from beginning to end occasionally descending into farce. Firstly, it was almost impossible to book, not because they were busy, this was purely due to incompetence. I initially tried to book in November 2018. I called several times leaving my number and a message requesting a table and no one called me back. If I hadn’t already purchased a voucher I would have given up. Instead, I tried again in January. Assuming that the phone wouldn’t work I contacted the email provided and requested a reservation. Again I got no response. So I tried to call and almost fell off my chair when someone answered. They could not find my email but made my reservation saying I would have to send a copy of my voucher. So I sent a copy of my voucher. The next thing I received was an email thanking me for my cancellation (!!!). I quickly responded saying I didn’t wish to cancel. I was then asked to fill in a short questionnaire regarding my booking and providing more details of my voucher. On querying this I was told they had no details of my booking.', 'The evening of the booking arrived and my partner and I were very much looking forward to our chateaubriand for two. We were encouraged to choose a starter and shared a calamari dish. The first alarm bell rang when it arrived a few moments later. Most likely preprepared and kept warm, it was just warm and a bit soggy. Most calamari dishes I’ve eaten in pubs in recent years at almost half the price have been several times better.', 'The chateaubriand came and was warm and not very big. The meat tasted slightly over. The sauces were tasteless. The spinach was dry and old. The chips were good as was the wine.', 'Paying the bill. After waving at the staff for more than 5 minutes I had to get up and go over to them. They then had the cheek to stick a significant service charge on the bill.', 'I used to enjoy the Boisdale in Victoria. Becoming a chain has cheapened the whole experience. After this last experience I won’t be going to any Boisdale again.']
title: Poor service, poor food and poor value

content: ['YES. This place is truly one of my better experiences, absolutely enjoyed my evening on Friday with the live music and the food was excellent. I thought that the service was very good they changed our table to be nearer the stage at a moments notice and I will definitely be going back. After the dinner and show I then went downstairs to the bar and tried to work off some of the calories on the dance floor enjoying the music from their resident Friday night DJ Aitch B. The décor and the old photographs of people in the entertainment business is just fantastic. Loved it.']
title: Live Music & Good Food?

content: ['Probably the best Whisky bar in London with an added extra, cigar smoking room. Also Wine list is good.', 'Place has a nice menu too and for summers a terrace.']
title: For Whisky and Cigars
