content: ["Had a lovely evening at Boisdale. Our second visit and was very impressed again. Live music from a great Barry White tribute and band. The view overlooking Cabot Square and it's fountain was nice, the food was excellent. Their table service is first class too. Would highly recommend. "]
title: Valentines night

content: ['Had a fantastic three course meal here while watching an excellent live performance. The service was spectacular and the whiskey range was to die for. I can’t wait to visit again soon. ']
title: Amazing

content: ["I've never had Haggis before but loved it very tasty. A filling starter though. They forgot to serve the whiskey with it (it came afterwards) but I didn't think it necessary anyway. ", ' The rib eye steak was large and juicy and very very good. A very enjoyable meal with good entertainment. Signs around the venue could be improved.']
title: Haggis

content: ['First time visiting Boisdale last night, we had purchased Groupon vouchers for Chateaubriand meal for 2 and then paid extra for the Madness tribute night. Dinner was really really good, wasn’t sure what to expect as I’ve visited restaurants using groupon deals before and found that you got a cheap version of their usual food, this was not the case at Boisdale. Chateaubriand was melt in the mouth and we were absolutely stuffed. Restaurant has a great atmosphere and vibe, tribute band was really good and we all had a really enjoyable night. It’s a great place for Whiskey and Cigar fans too. ']
title: Brilliant night!

content: ['My friend & I booked a package to see Rebecca Ferguson who was amazing - shame the dinner wasn’t! It was actually a farce. It took 45 minutes to even get a drink order in let alone order our food which by the way was £45 per head for a set menu excluding drinks. Around 2 hours after being seated my squid starter turned up - solid as a rock but I hate to say better than the main of calves liver which was cold & full of sinew. We struggled to get drinks all evening including water, the waiters did not know what veg were on that evening & frankly I would never go back & eat there - I might go for a gig but that is it! Very poor to be honest & a shame as was looking forward to it. ']
title: Really so not worth the money

content: ["Good place, the music was not on for that long. The way the staff move around is cool, in dark clothes they certainly aren't intrusive although service was a bit slow at times. ", 'Food menu is relatively limited but we all enjoyed. Haggis for starters is filling, so be warned! ']
title: Music and dinner

content: ['Our seats for Rebecca Ferguson with a meal were £195.00 for 2. Ok - London, 3 course meal and an artist I enjoy. What I actually got for my money was a table near the waiters computer so every time a drink or item of food was ordered. Waiting staff walked in front of my view to enter onto the computer! Also during her performance a customer complained so we heard all about it, rather than hearing Rebecca. To make matters worse customers who hadn’t paid for a table were allowed to come and stand next to our table (by the computer area) to watch the performance. This was not a good experience and vastly overpriced for the awful table. I have written a complaint email but they haven’t even bothered to reply.']
title: RIP off seats

content: ['They let you book with small dates excluded and then when you call to book they have spaces! Until you ask to use a groupon and they say they are too busy for vouchers....', 'Very poor show and won’t even let you speak to a manager as they are too busy!']
title: Groupon scam

content: ['Rebecca Ferguson was amazing. She’s better live than recorded even. Gave me goosebumps. ', 'I thought the food was average, at best. The “cheeseboard” was awful. Service was dreadful. Only positive about food and drinks was the extensive wine menu, that we eventually got.', 'We had a fantastic view of Rebecca, which you wouldn’t get without food though.']
title: Fab Rebecca Ferguson. Can’t say same about food.

content: ["I attended the venue for Sunday lunch with my family. We were unsure what to expect given we went with a 'voucher deal', but we're impressed from start to finish. The ambience and setting were lovely, the food was of a great standard and very good value, the wine supplement was a bargain and the service was attentive and personable...thoroughly enjoyable and recommended whether on a deal or not!"]
title: Great Sunday lunch

content: ['Six of us have been here 5 times over the last 3 years some of those times for my husbands birthday and had great times , lovely food , good service and great entertainment but this year OMG it was a shambles!', 'First the food was very late getting to us and when it did it was cold .. the people on the next table got their deserts at 23.45 ! ', 'Trying to get a drink was near on impossible ,one took the wine order one took the beer order and one took the spirits order ! ', 'Then when it came to the dancing on the dance floor there was no dance floor they had put tables on it craming everyone in so no one could dance except where they sat and the poor staff had a nightmare trying to get round everyone so we gave up and sat down . . ', 'Such a shame I think it is down to just being greedy with no customer service . I also wrote a letter of complaint with a nice reply from a lady on reception assuring me someone would be in touch and of course no one did ! ', 'So don’t waste your time or money going here it no longer is worth it .']
title: GO SOMEWHERE ELSE !

content: ['Great evening with a friend - for a few drinks and lite bite to eat.', 'For me the Bar takes up way too much space yet for members a retreat to the balcony is an alfresco escape.', 'The drinks are good and varied and the Burger I had was first rate; and my friend enjoyed his cigars.', 'Overall a win win of a location.']
title: Great location - Great Burgers, Cigars if you please

content: ['We came for my fiancé Christmas dinner with he’s work colleagues. Our table of 10 people was crammed onto the dance floor. So if you actually wanted to dance. There was only room for 2 people to dance at a time. This is a shame as you could see people did want to get on the none existence dance floor. The entertainment was very good. The band and singers where top quality! It’s a real shame that this restaurant got greedy and crammed in too many tables. They would have been wiser keeping the dance floor free. So people would have stayed longer.. spending more on drinks, leaving with memories of a good night. ', 'Instead I left remembering the very average food. Our table ordered a mixture of starters and mains. Everyone agreed that the food was very average. Not one person enjoyed anything they ate! Food is best described as mums cooking, comforting and plenty of left over to feed the family dog. ', 'My rating is 2 star on food. 4 star for entertainment. So overall 3 stars. Unfortunately I will not be coming back. ']
title: Great entertainment but average food

content: ['Table of 3, we ordered the scallops, squid and bisque. The bisque really stood out. Wonderfully intense flavour and texture. ', 'We all ended up having burgers for mains. The quality of the meat was compatible to a supermarket and the truffle flavour I was so looking forward to was absent. I’ve had better at GBK for a fraction of the cost. Chips were average too. ', 'They do offer a good cheese selection and their wines are really good too. ', 'Overall, this was a highly overpriced experience for what it is. £250 for 3 people seems excessive. Average service. ']
title: Average food, overpriced.

content: ['Just had a meal and seen Rebecca Ferguson perform. Outstanding voice! The food was not too bad quite ok actually. Highly recommend']
title: Great Night!!

content: ["Came here yesterday evening for the Frank and Dean Vegas show and honestly couldn't fault it at all. Excellent food, excellent cocktails, superb food, great service and some really fun entertainment. A great evening out."]
title: No faults at all

content: ['Loved it, great evening. Never been to that venue before and it’s pleasantly different. Relaxing & luxurious. Polite & attentive staff . Would go again , and have meal next time as the food looked good . We went for the show, and enjoyed a bottle of wine. ', 'Adore Rebecca, massive fan . This venue good for her as it’s intimate & welcoming. Thank you , good work.']
title: Rebecca Ferguson Boisdale Canary Wharf

content: ['We attended this restaurant for a Christmas meal with business associates. We had a private room booked and the service for drinks was slow. The restaurant seemed half empty - it was a Wednesday and during the Frank and Dean show there was no audience interaction. We visited the same restaurant for the same show last year and the atmosphere was amazing with dancing and a party feeling. The food is ok, I had shell in my crab starter but did not want to offend our host by making a fuss. I would advise if you are booking a show night for a party atmosphere, don’t book midweek.']
title: No atmosphere

content: ['An absolutely fabulous steak meal accompanied by an equally fabulous performance by Fleur East and both coupled with truly professional & obviously well trained team made our night very very enjoyable.']
title: Boisdales is a MUST -- Add a touch of Fleur East & the night was brilliant

content: ["This was a lunchtime visit. Nice spacious restaurant with live jazz played while you eat. We were shown to our table which was good except a limited view of the stage where the live band played, a column was in the way. Otherwise the live jazz made a nice atmosphere with a good view over Cabot square. We chose from the 3 course set lunch which is £37.50. For the first course I chose the Dunkeld Scottish oak smoked salmon. This was well presented and tasted nice. For the main course I chose the Roast rib of aged Tee Valley Charolais beef,Yorkshire pudding and horseradish. All roasts are served with duck fat roast potatoes, bunch carrots, wilted greens & red wine gravy. This was well presented and the meat was nice and the Yorkshire was massive taking up most of the plate. Unfortunately the roast potatoes were rock hard and tasted like they had definetly been reheated and not freshly done which spoilt the dish. Don't think this is good enough as it's not cheap here. For desert I chose the Dark chocolate & cherry torte", '70% Valrhona chocolate mousse, poached cherries, honeycomb. This was well presented and tasted very nice. We chose a bottle of the Navaldar Joven 2016/17 £23.00', 'Rioja, Spain. This young Rioja has very intense aromas of licorice & ripe forest fruits. Long & intense wine, with red & dark fruit on the palate & spices on the finish. This compliment ed the meal nicely. When we asked for the bill a 12.5% service charge is automatically added. The service on this occasion was good but feel that tipping should be discretionary.']
title: Nice spacious restaurant with live jazz

content: ['Well.. for my first time we have been to this place and from the welcoming to the end was actually really good.', 'But what made us super happy was the taste and the quality of their drinks. We had few from the menu, and WOW.']
title: What a drinks

content: ['First time visit to Boisdale, Canary Wharf for sunday lunch accompanied by a live,3 piece jazz band, playing all the classics. Be warned this is not a low cost experience, but where in London is? (Wetherspoons. maybe!) This scottish restaurant is well designed and we were seated one table back from the stage. There are other tables away from the stage in the huge windows, with fab views over Canary Wharf. The set menu is £47.50 each with 3/4 bottle of spanish house wine. I must say the Dunkeld Scottish Oak smoked salmon starter was outstanding with a simple creme fresh and horseradish dressing sprinkled in grated lemon zest! My main of rib of charolais beef was sadly cold where it had been on the pass too long but the accompanying veggies were fine. With buttermilk pancakes and ice cream to finish the whole experience was excellent.']
title: Great Sunday Lunch with Live jazz

content: ["My husband booked this venue as we had been to the one in belgravia so he thought we would try this one too, and it was such a good night just as the belgravia one can't wait to book again the service is second to none very attentive staff in all areas of the evening"]
title: Excellent

content: ['We arrived at the Resturant and were shown our table. Then after waiting sometime we had to try a get a waiters attention, finally someone came over. Drink orders were taken then we waited a while then waited some more only to then figure out our waiter had disappeared. Finally got someone else to collect our drinks only to then spot the first waiter coming back into the Resturant we asked where he had been and just laugh, we think he had gone for a break or call his girlfriend. Went to order food and a number of items on the menu was not available? Food arrives but only 3 main dishes turn up, mines not there, I ask the waiter as by then he busy talking to his mate that I have not got my food and he says ( I KNOW!) with gritted teeth. Order second round of drinks , doesn’t turn up, by this point we ask to speak to the manger who’s comes over and say I’m sorry I’ll keep an eye on your table. I think what he meant was he wanted to have a argument. Plates getting slammed down and constant eye rolling. By this time we chose to ignore and started getting up and pouring our own wine as was quicker. We had also noticed that the two tables either side of us were waiting for food and drinks, seemed like there was just not enough staff and apart from one none of them gave a crap and thought it was funny. A little while later the manager came over and kneeled down next to my wife and started whispering in her ear I thought he was saying sorry but in fact he decided to come over and start on her saying what is your problem, if I had known I would have told him to do one. The cocky waiter started being nice when the bill arrived obviously sniffing around for a tip - jog on. We paid the bill minus the service charge as we had no service. On a positive note the Jersey Boys were really good. Shame about the aggressive staff! ']
title: No service and plenty of attitude!

content: ['My boyfriend and I had a lovely evening at the Boisdale for a Michael Jackson tribute. It’s a beautiful large, grand room and the lighting is quite dim. I was impressed by the 800 whiskies and there was a good wine selection too. Staff were knowledgeable and attentive. We paid £60 each for dinner and the show. Dinner was excellent, everything was delicious and great quality. I was especially pleased with my haggis, neeps and tatties! Such a lovely way for a couple to spend an evening with dinner and a show at Boisdale. I do enjoy the atmosphere around Canary Wharf on a Saturday evening and I highly recommend!']
title: impressive show & dinner

content: ['Came here on my anniversary with my partner after having an awful experience with doubletree Hilton hotel. We originally missed our dinner reservations elsewhere because of the awful hotel we were at and ended up at Boisdale. This place is nothing short of amazing! My partner bought a cigar from their huge collection whilst we had some wine and then of course...dinner. I had a steak with the amazing triple cooked chips (honestly I will be coming back here just for the chips ) wanted to order another portion but unfortunately the kitchen had closed and my partner had a burger which he was thoroughly happy with. If you’re looking for a restaurant with a chill but lively atmosphere with AMAZING food...you need to come here! Thank you to the staff at Boisdale for an amazing ending to an awful day!! ']
title: Beautiful end to a stressful day!

content: ['Great food! Great staff! A bit pricey and extremely slow service considering the place was almost empty! Maybe because it was middle of the day.']
title: Dine out.

content: ['Have been a few times and the food has always been ok. Last night the meal was disappointing and the more I think about it we should not have paid for it. Starters were ok main courses should all have been sent back - it was an evening out (8 of us) to enjoy the lovely Orli Nyles who was as always excellent. It spoils the evening if you have to keep complaining - we did complain but with hindsight not enough! Two of us ordered the Hamburger (I’ve had this before and it was very nice) last night it was half the thickness of previous burger shrivelled up burnt and dry - I couldn’t eat it - the mushroom and bread was ok but £18.75 is a lot to pay for a burger bun a mushroom and a few chips - the message I received was that the Chef agreed it was burnt !! The steaks (ordered 3 rib eyes with a £9 supplement) were thin, very tough difficult to cut and I noticed watching the two men opposite me eating them rather chewy! My other friend sent hers back as she just gave up trying to cut it . After complaining they said they would cancel the supplement and gave us some cheese and biscuits! Desserts eventually arrived - myself and a friend decided on the chocolate brownie, was looking forward to this - well it was not a brownie it was chocolate (sickly) mousse on a layer of chocolate sponge which was about 7mm thick neither of us ate it. I would also add we waited a very long time in between courses, when the ‘complimentary cheese’ arrived our dessert menus were taken from us but our dessert order wasn’t taken? Eventually we had to ask for the menus to be returned so we could order our dessert? The red wine Vina Amate Rioja not recommended - I have never tasted a bad Rioja until I tasted this one. The venue was quite packed - it seemed they couldn’t cope.']
title: Overpriced and overcooked

content: ['We visited Boisdale on Friday evening, for a VIP dinner and show. I had visited Boisdale several times before and always enjoyed it. I expected the musical entertainment to be good, and the soul band were fantastic. But we found the service at the table really wasn’t on top of it. I had to ask three times for more water , and there was an overriding feeling that the restaurant was struggling to keep up on a busy night. Given the cost, very disappointing. The steaks were ok but not particularly tender.']
title: Dinner and music at Boisdales

content: ['Great night great table right on the stage Aleksandar Oneill’ was very good considering he been around the block. Only complaint was the service 30 mins on arrival before we got a drink waited so long for our meal I had the crab bit disappointed very dry we ended up eating wile the show was on and we did arrive in plenty of time they wanted a £80 service charge bit cheeky they put the service charge on the ticket price as well they advertise meet and greet when we ask when was this happening we were told that was and extra £150 ffs good night tho ']
title: Birthday

content: ['The show was really good, food was very nice, 3 courses, starter, main meal, dessert, this was at Canary Wharf, the wine per bottle started around £23 ', 'We had the 12oz ribeye steak, but watch out, they slap a £9 supplement on each steak meal and the steak burger. This is not stated on the menu, so make sure you ask about any extra charges.']
title: Birthday present to see Alexander O’niel and dinner

content: ['Having visited one of their sister restaurants, decided to give Boisdale Canary Wharf a try, just for a change. Never had any problems with the restaurant near Victoria station, over many years, so expected the same. How wrong was I. ', "Don't know where to start really. Travelled down from Suffolk. Arrived at Canary Wharf tube station. Took us 15 minutes to find. My husband actually called the restaurant only to be told they didn't know how we should get to them. Won't go into what happened next, but Canary Wharf nobody seems to know where anything is.", "Hooray, arrived at 12.45pm. Our pre dinner drinks arrived 35mins later and wrong. Had to call a waiter over to place our order. Got our starters wrong. Had to call another waiter over who then went to find someone else it went on and on. Eventually the right starter arrived think they must have run out of Burrata mozzarella, 3 slithers is what I got. This took over half an hour. It is now 2.10pm. We have to leave at 3pm. This was meant to be a relaxing catch up with dear friends all we seemed to talk about was the service. We were given free wine, but the whole experience was horrendous and they lost out on £150. Service! There isn't any. 2 hours for 2 courses?Didn't have time for desert. They did have a large party come into the restaurant around 1pm. This was not our problem. You should get the staff. Cannot believe Jools Holland is part of this establishment. A shambles. Will not be going back or recommending."]
title: Shambles! Save your money.

content: ['Entertained by talented Jermain Jackman and a brilliant band. Food and service excellent.', 'Looking forward to our next visit.']
title: Great evening in a fantastic venue

content: ['Nice atmosphere. Friendly staff. Food is overpriced and very, very average at best. Expected more for the amount of money spent. ']
title: Birthday

content: ['We came here on a Thursday afternoon for a drink ,..and the Bar on 1st floor was appealing! Lovely terrace where you can have a cigar, jazz music and the drinks menu with a large selection of whiskey made our night ! ', 'Definitely recommend !!!']
title: Lovely atmosphere

content: ['We’ve been to Boisdale a couple of times before - once excellent the other not so, in fact the last time was so disappointing that this visit took a lot of convincing for me to go.', 'However this time we had a voucher for a Chateaubriand experience, which made the price point substantially lower.', 'The staff were very attentive, the food exceedingly enjoyable, and live music itself was reason to return.', 'Despite the voucher it was still an expensive evening, however one that I would happily repeat in the future maybe after some time for the bank balance to recover.', 'Would I return? Yes, however as I have learnt before, I would not return on Burns night but any other time of the year could potentially be an excellent evening.', 'One question though does still remain - how does one pronounce Boisdale? We say it using the French pronunciation on Bois (bwah) but the staff use an anglicised form of “boys” sounding like something from New Jersey.']
title: Redemption

content: ['Had a great business dinner here, good food, drink, ambience and attentive service.', "would highly recommend, however, don't forget there is live music which isn't necessarily conducive to having a conversation at a normal sound level. Just bear that in mind. However, on the whole a great experience and would return."]
title: Excellent venue for business until the music starts

content: ['I live in CW, and always planned to visit this place. We booked it for the last night in London for some guests, and all day planned towards this. Arrived in the evening where they told us how they don’t cooperate with Openable app since that very morning and they didn’t keep a table for us. In the most rude manner, they literary didnt care even though it was a mistake from their end that they didnt make sure to pick up all the reservations on time. At least they should have helped us in this situation not just let us go.', 'Definitely dont recommend this place, if you want a good view with amazing food in CW just stop by down the street to the main square or even go to Bokan on 38th floor near by. They never disrespect and disappoint their guests that is 100% guaranteed.']
title: Really Rude staff, they don’t keep your booked table

content: ["We came to celebrate my partner's birthday and use the opportunity to see the wonderful Si Cranston, who I first saw singing on the streets 12 years before, so all credit to him for a fabulous show. We came for the early show, where you are immediately advised you only have the dinner \xa0table for two hours! On further investigation you find they basically only mean for the first show, I will add however we were never rushed. We had seats overlooking Cabot Sq., on the website it would be beneficial to say you'll have a limited view of the stage area. Whilst a TV is fitted, our view was blocked by a column and decorative plants for a clear view of the stage area, perhaps it's written in the small print?", "As for the decor of the restaurant it is both spectacular and extremely comfortable too, the restaurant has a wonderful ambiance from the moment you arrive. The staff were exceptional and could not have done more to make our visit feel special. On finding it was my partner's birthday, after our meal they brought a small birthday greeting cake, this was a lovely touch. There is a wide selection of choices for all tastes on the menu and an immense wine list too. The food was of ample portions and well cooked and presented, again I add you are made to feel important and that as an individual the occasion is for you, fantastic friendly and attentive service.", "I will add & it's not just here, adding the service charge (12.5%) in advance is a pet peeve. I only hope it's only the staff that receive it! It does subconsciously make you consider that every penny spent is added to the impending service charge.", 'Overall, we very much enjoyed our visit, the staff lift the restaurant to another level, well worth a visit but before booking your table ensure you can find where your location will be relative to how you want the evening to be for you.']
title: Great evening

content: ['Considering how much it costs for cocktails and ', 'Food it was actually very mediocre. The burgers were quite dry and the toilets had no toilet paper. You pay all that money then go to the toilet and there’s no toilet paper !! MacDonalds is better and costs a fiver. At least check your toilets during the evening!!! ', 'Very Poor']
title: Carol

content: ["Food was sort of ok but won't be returning. Service was really slow. There are much better restaurants."]
title: Dinner

content: ['Fact Boisdale Canary Wharf is being run by horrendous managment, what an embarrassment this place is, awful service doesn’t describe it enough!']
title: Do not eat here!!

content: ['Let me first start by saying the music and the band were fantastic!!', 'We have been here several times and always had a good meal, but what the heck happened last night!! Food was awful, and very expensive awful come to that.', "Wait staff seemed rushed off their feet (not enough staff, especially as I over heard one saying on the way out that they had not had a break the whole time they worked, and never do when they work a shift there.) A waiter delivered our main course to a side table next to us and stood next to it, telling us he wasn't allowed to serve and had to wait for a main waiter, who took at least 5 minutes to appear (busy serving other tables) whilst our food slowly congealed and went cold, we then saw the same waiter who wasn't allowed to actually allowed to put the food on our table, putting someone else food down in front of them!!! It was a complete shambles, and for a supper club that has music nights on a more than regular basis this is simply not acceptable.", 'We paid a lot of hard earned money for this, and believe me we were not the only ones complaining last night!!!']
title: Amy Winehouse Tribute Night

content: ['Came here for drinks after work, had one of those Time Out vouchers. None of the staff seemed to know what to do with it. Booked a table for 5pm but apparently they don’t open until 6pm (even though the voucher said valid 5pm - 7pm) so waited at the bar. Cocktails were nice but they didn’t have all the ones listed on the Time Out menu so limited choice. Terrible service - they were more interested in people ordering food. Nice place but wouldn’t go back for drinks.']
title: Disappointing

content: ["We were seated by the window and enjoyed lovely views over Cabot Square. The atmosphere was warm and friendly and the live jazz band were a treat (and not too loud!). We had the 3 course Sunday lunch chosen from a set menu which came with a glass of prosecco and we opted to have the 3/4 bottle of wine too. Very generous portions but the food itself was average with roast potatoes that were so rock hard they were inedible. That said the atmosphere and surroundings were so enchanting we'll definitely return!"]
title: Birthday lunch

content: ['Wonderful time at Lulu show and meal on Friday night 4 of us travelled down from Glasgow all good friends great night ...food was incredible scallops amazing show fabulous loved loved loved it we will be back at another venue staff were friendly too would highly recommend beautiful club ']
title: Morag C

content: ['Only stayed for a little but loved the live music and atmosphere. Drinks were really good too. Staff were pleasant.']
title: Very nice

content: ['Visited Boisdale with my Dad, his girlfriend and my boyfriend for my birthday lunch on Sunday. It was absolutely fabulous. Great service by the waitresses and glorious decor in the restaurant itself. The jazz band was playing and it was just a beautiful atmosphere. The food was incredible. We had the three courses. For starters i had the chilli squid, my boyfriend had the smoked salmon and my dad and his girlfriend had the avocado and poached egg on toast. All superb. For mains, i went for the salmon, my boyfriend had the aubergine parmigiana burger, my dad had the smokehouse burger and his girlfriend opted for the pork roast which was that huge her veg and potatoes came seperately. Portions were sized generously and were so tasty. For desserts my boyfriend had the buttermilk pancakes and my dad and his girlfriend had the chocolate tortes. For me they brought out my cheesecake with candles and “Happy Birthday” written in chocolate sauce. Really lovely and such a thoughtful touch! Wine was flowing and I had a wonderful “Summer Rose” cocktail which was to die for. Thank you for making it so special, we will be back. ']
title: Birthday Lunch!

content: ['We had lunch there on a Sunday. There was Jazz Music included which was quite nice I must admit. Not to loud and easy listening. The views are quite nice from that restaurant. Unfortunately the Bar on the first floor was closed. They seemed to be a bit understaffed but the staff members who were there have been very friendly. We chose the lunch menu with wine included. It included a glass of sparkling wine for the start plus 3/4 of a bottle of white and red wine depending on your food per person. Price wise absolutely alright. I had Salmon for a starter which was really nice. The beef and the pie for the main course was alright and desert was good again (cheese cake). All in all a very good lunch with entertainment and not too pricey. Unfortunately a certain wow factor was missing to vote for 5 stars.']
title: Good Food - relaxing atmosphere

content: ['Very nice setting, very friendly and helpful service.', "The Sunday Lunch is a set menu with choices that isn't the best value I've ever had but this is the City - although they won't get their regular clients on a Sunday - and it makes a nice change.", 'The food was good and we all enjoyed the experience.']
title: Sunday Lunch

content: ['Fantastic place to have a meal and enjoy a show if you fancy.', 'Have been twice in the part, one to see a Santana tribute and another time to see The Stones. Both times have been equally enjoyable, steak was cooked to perfection, waiters and bar staff were courteous and friendly.', 'Would most certainly recommend. Careful when booking a table for a show as you may get a table right up the front and be slightly deafened :)']
title: Fantastic Restaurant, one of the best in London

content: ["Visited with 3 friends on Sat 4th Aug. Canary Wharf shopping mall is a bit of a maze so it took a while to find it, especially exiting the tube from the Jubilee line. It's apparently easier to find if you use the DLR. ", 'Once you get to the elevators that take you up to the restaurant, it takes a while to figure out that not all of the 4 lifts actually take you up to that floor. ', "Once inside, staff very welcoming and friendly. On this occasion there was an old school reggae sound system Saxon on the bill, which is what we were really looking forward to. They didn't disappoint - which is more that I can say for the menu. We booked a ticket online for £19.95 which was a 2-course meal and the dance to follow.", " An eclectic mix of dishes on the menu ranging from haggis to jerk chicken (not 'jerked' very well, ie not much taste and non-fish tasting fishcakes. I also had the spicy jerk chicken wings for my starter - again, where is the jerk?? Many people ordered the platter for their main as we did, and the corn wraps that came with it (naan bread which I presume was made with corn somewhere in the recipe) were dry.", 'We later learnt that during the week the restaurant served as a scottish based one and the organiser of this particular event - lovely Paula who introduced herself to everyone table by table - has taken it over for the summer on weekends. Hence the scottish-west indian combination of meals on the menu.', 'We luckily met happy hour 2 for 1 cocktails between 6-7pm (usual price would have been £9.95 per drink). ', "We joined the dancers in the long balcony-like area outside once we had finished eating. The area where the music was playing was very narrow and not really conducive to too many people dancing to be honest, it got very crowded and you couldn't move, so we stayed inside but the vibe wasn't the same.", "An ok place but I wouldn't run back in too much of a hurry for the food. Just go early for the dance so you can grab your spot before it gets too busy!"]
title: Music excellent, food bit boring

content: ['Just returned from a fantastic meal at Boisdale. A great experience , food was really good, staff attentive and service excellent. Thoroughly recommend the deal and the place.']
title: Groupon deal - çhateaubriand

content: ['We had the most amazing time. Great location, wonderful staff and fantastic food. We will definitely be returning and it’s all thanks to the service we received from Roland. He was attentive, polite and honest about the reason our food was slightly delayed. Needless to say the extra wait was definitely worth it and we could not be happier.']
title: How wonderful

content: ['Good ambiance et nice cocktail. I will come back for sure. The service is really nice and quick. Next time I will test the food ']
title: Nice cocktail

content: ['I went to the Boisdale to watch a musical act play and had pre-booked to sit in the green seats at the back by the entrance. I think we sat under a air conditioning unit as it was freezing. We ordered 2 drinks from the waiter when we were seated and they seemed to take ages to arrive. When it came time to pay I had to run around the venue to find a waiter who then brought us over two more drinks instead of the bill. A 12 % tip was automatically placed on the bill for 2 drinks which I asked to be removed. The musical act was fantastic but I don’t think I would rush back to the venue. ']
title: Expensive drinks and slow service

content: ['Very good food, very good reception. Always can pin point areas of improvement on service as I work in a restaurant myself but generally good and easy fix. I will visit again soon. ']
title: Very Good Atmosphere

content: ["Had dinner here with colleagues on a weekday. Took about 20 minutes to get a waiter's attention and then paying at the end was another long wait. Food was good though and general ambience is also nice."]
title: Good restaurant but long wait times for everything

content: ['Love love love this place !! Great food, great music, great atmosphere, great staff ..sumptuous decor, a wee Scottish home away from home though I recommend getting more unusual Scottish gins in like Tyree and Harris and adding fever tree tonics to the menu..also add Mac & cheese to the menu, its a staple offering on menus in Glasgow and would go down a treat :-) ive taken 2 groups of colleagues along already and i only found it last week !! im looking forward to my next visit to london already..']
title: A wee treasure throve

content: ['Saw a special offer for all you can eat barbecue, £15 per person', "We sat on the terrace on a gorgeous summer's days. ", 'Staff were very friendly and food was fantastic, great value. Selection of chicken, sirloin burgers, sausages and lamb kofte, rolls including garlic bread and salads.', 'Would definatly go again']
title: Barbecue lunch

content: ['Really enjoyed the atmosphere of boisdale and the dancing roof terrace is a wonderful experience in Canary Wharf.', 'Sadly the food wasn’t great, went for aCaribbean evening. My salt fish fritters were nice but everyone’s chicken wings were very dry. Then sadly my partner found a hair in his mains.', 'Overall good night.']
title: Great atmosphere food not so great

content: ['Had a lovely lunch here, sitting in the large curved window area of the restaurant overlooking the square', 'Staff & food superb, would really love to try one of their jazz evenings as can well imagine it would be great!', 'Highly recommend for couples, friends or business entertaining']
title: Unexpected treasure

content: ['Visited here with a group of friends', ' Lovely terrace area. Staff were welcoming. ', 'The set up for the BBQ could have been a bit better. ', 'The salads breads along with chicken skewers,lamb - didnt really like but worth the £15.95 I guess. ', 'Also,I must point out not everyone eats Pork so this does need to be separated from Chicken and Lamb in consideration.', 'The chef did go out his way to grill fresh chicken which my friend was happy with.', 'I must say a fruit salad or something of a sort light dessert could have been added to the buffet that would have been nice. ', 'Will return maybe try the Cajun BBQ too .', 'Thanks for a great service.']
title: BBQ LUNCH SATURDAY

content: ['Visited the venue for a few quiet drinks. Some colleagues joined us who kindly offered to pick up the tab. The waitress proceeded to shout at us insisting that the balance had not been paid.', 'When it transpired that this was a mistake, the waitress offered no apology.']
title: Ignorant staff

content: ['Picked this place out some weeks before the visit, because we liked the look of it. Surroundings and live music all good. However food doesn’t offer best value for money and is only average. Service was poor waiter not smiling once through out the meal. Had to wait an about an hour for the bill and when it arrived they had the cheek to charge us the £22 service charge. I got the impression that they weren’t bothered if we had any intentions of revisiting as we left. (Not very friendly. )And the place was hardly at capacity, not that surprising really if this is the way they treat customers.']
title: Wedding anniversary

content: ['Excellent dinner here with some lovely wine plus a great Musical Performance as well. Able to take Food a leisurely pace']
title: Great dinner and superb music

content: ['Visited with friends to see ex-Sex Pistols guitarist, Glen Matlock and his band. Atmosphere really good and music was a blast from the past! Steaks fantastic as always. Drinks are very expensive here but it is what it is as they say!']
title: Boisdales never disappoints!

content: ['We were booked to for a table at Canary Wharf on Monday 30th July ', 'I had visitors from overseas and thought it would be a great experience to see a great British Restaurant.', 'I’ve attended Boisdale City and Mayfair on several occasions and had drinks in The Wharf - always a great experience. ', 'Unfortunately the gentleman who was serving downstairs at 9:00pm on Monday was unnecessarily rude.', '1) It was clear from the start that we were not welcome. His meet and greet highlighted that we had 9 people not six - this was not acceptable. When we went up to the lovely lady on the 2nd floor - she had no issues and simply changed the booking. She informed that downstairs was empty. Upstairs was going to be loud with a rock band. So we decided to sit down stairs. ', '2) One person in group was diabetic and needed a quick snack. When one of the group picked up a bowl of nuts, the same gentleman snapped at him - stating that people spit into these. Not necessary to be that graphic regardless of the hygiene implications.', '3) Even after we complained to the manager, he continued with unnecessary curtness such as stating at 920pm that we must order immediately as kitchen shut at 10pm. ', 'We settled the UKP70 bar bill and moved on somewhere else for dinner. ', 'This is in contrast to the two barmen who were exemplary and in contrast to what I have experienced and expect from Boisdale.']
title: One petulant person spoilt it for all

content: ['Visited Boisdale for the first time a couple of weeks ago. ', 'Food was really excellent and the staff and service were professional, friendly and on the ball during a busy lunchtime. Was a very nice atmosphere in the restaurant and I look forward to going back to try out the dinner menu. It also has a lovely terrace bar below the main restaurant.']
title: Lovely lunch with a great atmosphere

content: ['We chose to combine a late (ish) meal with the live music offering. Have to say that both were very well done. The food was great, with a small but interesting menu, cocktails also v good. Will definitely be back.']
title: Late meal and music

content: ['Boisdale is situated in a great location in Canary Wharf, with great views.', 'The menu had a great choice for all of us, and was absolutely lovely.', 'Venue also caters for all types people with a good mixture of Couples, Business, Solo and families, giving the place a great atmosphere.', 'On leaving the restaurant there was music just starting to softly play, giving it the extra WOW.', 'Great place fully recommend.']
title: Stunning food, Atmosphere and Service

content: ["This was an impromptu visit after spotting a 50% off a la carte offer. I've lost count of the amount of times I have eaten here.", "On this occasion i felt compelled to review because the food was excellent. To be fair it's usually very good but this time i was very happy!", "I maintain their ribeye is the best I've had in London (and I've eaten A LOT). The triple cooked chips send me to heaven every time.", "On this occasion i tried going vegetarian. I must admit I wasn't exactly overwhelmed with options but what i ate was delicious. Started with the asparagus and egg which i did not expect to be impressed by; the flavours and quality of cooking were perfect. Then onto the pumpkin tortellini for main. Again excellent flavours and a touch on the stodgy side (which i like but may not be to everyone's taste). Sprinkled with some crispy cheesy seedy things which made it a 10/10 for me!", 'We got one of the great tables by the window (go early) with the lovely view of cabot square fountain. ', 'Only disappointment was service is slow (which has been the case every time) and on this occasion just not very pleasant from our main waiter e.g. "what do you want?" were the first words we got and the tone was much the same thereafter.', "It's also not cheap and without the offer it would not have been my first choice but after that meal I'm hooked! I'd definitely recommend it if you are not in a hurry, not starving (the wait will seem longer) and not a delicate flower."]
title: Love the food

content: ['We went here for Christmas lunch, wine was off, staff unhelpful, additional candle for dark table proved to be a real problem for them. Food nothing special and overpriced. Bill was totally inaccurate, charged twice for all food. Enormous service charge added automatically to bill. On the plus side the music was good. Won’t be returning and don’t recommend.']
title: Exceptionally disappointing

content: ['Food is average and service is average. Waiters kept getting orders wrong or very slow/slightly rude. Atmosphere is nice though and jazz band awesome! Hence the 3 stars otherwise would have given 2']
title: Average

content: ['Food was good, but the service was terrible it was an exceptionally busy night. Live music but it was so difficult to get any attention to order drinks there were lots of management walking around in suits. We would lo e to have had more drinks as it was a long night. Really need to get their act together.']
title: Night out

content: ['We wanted to experience a little bit of the London Jazz scene and were not disappointed, we combined dinner and a live show and loved every minute of it. As it was a once off we didn’t mind the extra money spent on drinks and desserts. The staff were fantastic, very attentive and service was quick. As for the show, Nicole Emmanuelle: The Ella Fitzgerald Songbook was simply breathtaking and the closest I have seen that sounds like the First Lady of jazz herself. ']
title: Fantastic night, entertainment was amazing.

content: ["I visited this bar and restaurant for a work social evening and I can't recommend it highly enough.", 'With only a small party of four we had a few drinks in the bar before heading upstairs for a meal. The food was amazing and we could not fault the service.Each of us had a starter, main and dessert and no one was disappointed. ', 'There was a good selection of dishes on the menu, with standard options covered but also some more unusual dishes, which we tried.', 'The food was matched by the service. from the bar staff downstairs to the waiter upstairs everyone was friendly, polite and professional.', 'Definitely recommend it for almost any occasion as the environment is lovely and can cater for everyone.']
title: Amazing food and service

content: ['We want there last Saturday evening, having booked a 8.15pm table on level 2 to enjoy the second part of the stage entertainment in the restaurant. This was booked some months before and changes once although, I was told, they do not normally change appointments. Paid £190 for 4 people which included the given menu.', 'Wine list relatively affordable but other drink are expensive.', 'On the 1st floor bar area there is however nowhere to sit outside, one either has to pre-book a terrace table or be a member to sit in that area. Otherwise it is very limited outside and the bar inside can get very busy.', 'Restaurant menu and service was great and I can strongly recommend the haggis (although maybe as starter only) as very strong and spicy but brilliant (irrespective what it is made out of!). ', 'I would go again but for a special event only as can get expensive.']
title: A Special Experience

content: ['This year we decided as a company to have a night at Boisdales and with the bonus of Having Alexander O’Neil playing that night ', 'The show was very good as was also the band with Alex', 'Everyone enjoyed the food and the atmosphere ', 'The staff were also very good ']
title: Great Night

content: ['9/10 was really quick and delicious, wonderful terrace and customer services 10/10!! ', 'Friday 8:30 get table quickly, wonderful bar and nice cocktails, good music. ']
title: Oyster bar “classic burger” and pint

content: ['Just returned from having dinner there. I had an amazing time and cannot fault any of the evening. The atmosphere, service, food and entertainment (Mel C) was fantastic. Well worth the price and we will be going again. ']
title: Anniversary Meal

content: ['Thank you so much to the team for a great celebration brunch. The atmosphere and food were fab. The prosecco flowed. All five of us were so pleased and the event and it exceeded our expectations.']
title: Royal wedding celebration

content: ["Had dinner reserved for 1st Floor, but Live Music was heard from 2nd Floor show, which was nice. Chateuabriand had run out but our Waiter SHAH from 1st Floor was absolutely lovely, the Scallops had also ran out, but we really didn't mind as he was so kind and polite about it. We ordered the other Fillet & Ribeye Steaks and they were amazing. Shah was so kind, despite Fasting for Ramadan, he stayed beyond his Iftar time to help his colleagues on the floor. He was delightful. Had a lovely evening :-) "]
title: Dinner Fri Floor

content: ['We loved the intimate closeness of our front seats, The venue is perfect for a special occasion, however the set menu in my opinion was not up to the usual standards, my chicken pie was way to over seasoned with fennel, not very palatable.', 'The win and our service was excellent and the bill was as anticipated for 4 dinners.', 'However a 12% service charge "£140" was automatically applied to our total bill which included our show ticket cost, this charge is discretionary and I therefor ask for it to be removed, Which our waiter quite understood, showing his own disapproval, I then tipped in the old conventional way for our meal and wine.', 'I consider this bad practice unless Mel C got a 12% cut ?']
title: VIP Mel C Ticket

content: ['Made a reservation here for a business lunch and arranged all details with client. Then they cancelled my reservation with short notice because they took a private booking. Not impressed by their way of doing business.']
title: Unreliable

content: ['A great day to visit is on a Monday. It is a quiet day even with someone as famous as Rita Coolidge. We had an excellent table and view of the stage. The venue exudes quality. Boisdale staff were efficient and pleasant, the food was very good but all was surpassed by the music. The band were accomplished as you would expect and Rita sings as well as ever but the overriding impression is how generous they all were with their time to chat and how genuine they all were. It is a credit to Boisdale they can attract such stars and a credit to Rita Coolidge and her band they are willing to play at Boisdale. A wonderful evening that will be long remembered.']
title: Rita Coolidge and her band are a delight

content: ['Have been to Boisdales twice before and each time it was exceptional.', 'Booked a Frank Sinatra night on Saturday for 4 of us for my husbands birthday. The service was literally non existent. Our waitress was very slow on bringing the wine menu over and taking food orders. The food too ages to arrive and the steaks were not of the best quality. No one checked on us throughout the meal to see if everything was OK - ended up retrieving our wine from the ice bucket they put it in as no one was topping up the wine glasses. ', 'Most disappointing of all was that the music from the Reggae Festival below in the bar was over powering the music upstairs - I did complain to the reception - and they did say they would sort it out - but at that point the night had already been spoiled.', 'Very disheartened that they seemed to value £20 a head buffet customers more than those of us who had paid £200 plus for a table.']
title: Very Disappointing

content: ['I visited Boisdale in May 2018 with some friends to attend the Melanie C residency.', 'I booked a table for five people more than two months in advance, buying the most expensive option (the so-called \'VIP ticket\', 175 £), in order to be as close as possible to the stage. The restaurant\'s website advertises the seats as being - I quote - "within 5 metres from stage (full closest view)", and I when I placed my order, the person on the phone kindly confirmed that the table was going to be "literally in front of the stage". I insisted on this point during the booking, because I knew I would have guests flying from overseas just to see the gig and I wanted it to be perfect - otherwise I would have opted for non-VIP seats. In order to remind the personnel about this aspect, I even wrote an e-mail the day before the event, to ensure our immediate proximity to the stage. ', 'When we arrived, we were seated on a table which was way behind the VIP sector. In fact, we were sitting among other Melanie C fans who had bought cheaper tickets. We immediately reported this to the reception staff and we were told that we could stand up and move close to the stage during the performance. Of course, we were not happy at all with this compromise, because WE WERE NOT GIVEN WHAT WE HAD PAID FOR, but we did not want to let this spoil our mood. ', 'When the performance started, we got closer to the stage, as we had been told. This was not the most enjoyable experience, and certainly not what we were promised when we bought our tickets, but we thought that it was better than sitting behind three rows of tables and not having a proper view of the concert. (By the way: other fans sitting behind us did the same, so we thought that we could have spent much less money and still see the concert close to the stage!).', 'This is where the most upsetting part of the evening began: we were repeatedly told off in quite a rude way by the restaurant staff because we were standing. This impoliteness was absolutely not acceptable. Not only did it collide with the instructions we had received when we were seated, but it had a negative impact on the rest of the evening. We could not enjoy the concert because of the bitterness this whole situation had caused.', 'The cherry on top arrived at the end of the dinner, when a waitress came to our table with the bill of another guest who had left the restaurant without paying. We knew him from previous concerts, but this did not mean we had to pay for him! This was not just embarrassing - it was shameless.', 'I have written an e-mail to complain about the service and the organisation of the evening and the restaurant manager refused to offer any sort of compensation or even a refund of the price difference between VIP tickets and the seats we were actually given. I believe that a restaurant which aspire to excellence like Boisdale should look after its customers in a more sensible and professional way and take their complaints more seriously.', 'The food was good, but on the whole our experience was VERY frustrating.']
title: Fraudulent misselling of VIP tickets

content: ['Boisdale never disappoints and I haven’t been for a few years.', 'There last night to see some great musicians, food, staff was amazing, Ranald runs a great ship there it has to be said..', 'Defo a place not to miss out on, even if just pop into the bar for a drink and not the second floor for the music..']
title: Amazing wvening

content: ['We visited this restaurant on Tuesday 17th for a family meal, the service and food we received was extremely enjoyable and well presented.The waiter Jose served us exceptionally well throughout the evening, we all thoroughly enjoyed our our evening here and will certainly return again in the future.']
title: Excellent Restaurant

content: ['Went with my daughter last night, early dinner and the restaurant was fairly empty but was quite busy by the time we left. Used a Groupon voucher - £55 for 2 Chateaubriand and glass of champagne very good value. Our server - Krzystof Toda (had to copy that from our bill) was very knowledgeable with his wines and recommendation and attentive. Had a table by the window overlooking the square and fountain. ', 'Was here at Christmas for a Sinatra tribute which was excellent and am about to book for an Ella Fitzgerald tribute in June.']
title: Birthday Treat

content: ['Went on a Groupon Chateaubriand meal deal on a Wednesday April 11th for 6pm. Had a great table with a nice view. However they had to be reminded about the champagne that was included in the deal. And they plain forgot our "unlimited" fries. And we had a long wait for our meal, and it had only just opened. Not once we\'re we asked about our food during the main. In their defence they knocked the starters and tip off the bill, but I will sadly not be returning. ']
title: Food good, but....

content: ['Despite indifferent service, I would have been prepared to award more stars had the food been up to the high standards we expect when paying these prices. ', 'The prawn cocktail starters were good quality but the mains of roast chicken no better than we would get at a local pub. Not bad but decidedly average and really not worth the price paid despite the attractive surroundings. I’m also becoming increasingly annoyed at the number of restaurants that insist that you have (or at least pay for) dessert. I wouldn’t choose to have dessert, indeed none of our party did but there was only a three course option which I find odd. There’s a sugar tax for a good reason and we’re trying to cut back so why not offer two course options - well I think we all know why..', 'Despite being a little underwhelmed I would probably have given this restaurant another try but my wife has spoken and we won’t return.']
title: Could Do Better...

content: ['We had a table in the bar and terrace area rather than the main restaurant because we weren’t staying long enough for the jazz (starts at 915 on a weekday and you had to pay extra to buy ‘tickets’). Food was as expected - good quality if a little over priced. The smoked salmon starter is my favourite as it comes with a number of options to ‘dress’. The calamari and sausage tapas starters are smaller portions but still good. For mains we had the chicken mushroom pie (creamy, good) and two fillet steaks (7oz right size). Wouldn’t recommend the Bloody Mary Sauce but the peppercorn was fine. All in all a safe choice for a meal. ']
title: Safe choice

content: ["It was my girlfriend's birthday and I'd booked a table at Gaucho in Piccadilly for us to have a nice meal in a rather swanky restaurant. ", 'I met up with a friend that day and he convinced me to go to Boisdale as the steak is supposedly amazing, with that in mind I took his advice and booked a table. ', "When I called the restaurant I was told there weren't any tables available at 20.00 however there was a table available 45 minutes later, i was also informed that there would be an additional £12.50 per person added to the bill if we are still at the restaurant after 21.45 as their entertainment starts. I found this a tad annoying as I wasn't interested in seeing the entertainment but I agreed as it was a special occasion.", 'When we arrived we were seated at a rather small square table and I asked if we could move to the larger circular tables. The waiter was very helpful and dresed the new table and after 10 minutes we were seated.', 'The waiter gave us our menus, took our drink orders, house wine & a tonic water, then went about his business. Another couple arrived five or so minutes later and sat at the table infront of ours. They wait five minutes and also ordered their drinks. We waited another 10 minutes before we started thinking the wait was exorbitant when we saw the couple that can after us get their drinks, all in all we waited about 20 minutes from our to receipt of our drinks', 'The starter was good, we had peppered squid and for main we had the large steak which was amazing. However our waiter forgot our drinks order, we had to ask him twice, we asked for water and that too was forgotten. When paying for a meal for two which is due to cost between £100-£200 You expect good service.', "By the time we asked for the bill (£143) I was ready to go home and decided to pay £150 instead of the £163 which included the service. I thought rather than pay no service at all I'll pay some.", "I was not ready for the waiter's response when I told him what I was paying. ", "He abruptly and in a very curt manner asked me why u was was not paying the service and that the meal costs £163 And that's what I should pay.", "This left an extremely bitter taste in my mouth. You see, I'm happy to pay a service charge even when the service isn't the best but when I'm paying such a large sum of money for a meal i expect a good level of service and don't expect to be barked at by a waiter because I decided to pay less. ", "The restaurant states if you aren't happy with the service in any way don't pay. I didn't expect that reaction and won't be going back there regardless of how good the food is."]
title: Good food, bad experience

content: ['Took clients out for lunch, there were 7 of us and we were located slightly away from all the other diners (upon request) however we didn’t received ANY service. We had to ask for drinks, then to order food and then finally the bill (I don’t think I’ve ever had such poor service - as it’s not as if these people haven’t been trained)', 'We all went for a famous burger.', 'Half the burgers appeared to be fine, but some of them were over cook (nuked) and the buns were burnt) again no-one bothered to ask how our food was until collecting the plates ... and even upon providing feedback, no attempt to rectify the problem.', 'However I enjoyed my diverted g&t but the rest of the experience / meal was poor. Left disappointed and will not go back or recommend to anyone I like.', 'Unfortunately too many places in London providing poor service / food and very high prices, of which this place appears to be one of them.']
title: Important business lunch which lacked services

content: ['A delightful oasis of country house charm with jazz, blues and live music often tinkling in the background. Reasonably varied Menu coupled with sure footed cooking makes for a pleasant experience. Lovers of a dram will be in whisky heaven. Attentive but not intrusive staff. Well worth the visit but do book ahead.']
title: Country House in town

content: ["Great way to spend a Saturday night! I initially had a problem with my booking as I thought I had booked the set menu deal inc Jazz via Open table but it turned out to be the First floor grill . However once the maitre'd ( Kate ) realised we were celebrating birthdays she very kindly arranged for us to be moved upstairs. The food was lovely , the music was excellent and the service delivered by Kate and our waiter made the night very special. Thank you for a really memorable night!"]
title: Birthday celebration

content: ["Had a fabulous afternoon at Boisdale Canary Wharf . I haven't been here before but will defiantly be going again .", "I brought tickets on line for Guinness and a burger for St Patrick's day , not knowing what to expect , but was very pleasantly surprised. On arrival we were shown to our table and had fantastic waiter service all afternoon . The burgers were delicious . ", 'The staff here were so nice , we stayed for the evening entertainment which was a lovely little Irish band . ', 'Highly recommended']
title: St Patrick's Day fun

content: ['Atmosphere dark and mysterious a little bit disappointing', 'I would say stepping back into time. we were showed to our seats and the view was pleasant. The food was ok. I had the full English without the black pudding. There was a older gentleman playing the piano which was nice and the only lively thing. Not one of my best but for meeting friends it was ok']
title: Brunch with Friends

content: ['Food was nice, but there were two staff members who were particularly unpleasant. I spoke to a couple of other visitors on the dancefloor and they spoke about how one waiter had shoved them out of the way and stood on their toes!']
title: Horrible Staff

content: ['I recently went here for dinner, booking a deal from another website. The venue is very elegant and beautiful and we got offered a great table near the stage where the band would play later on.', 'We waited quite a bit before ordering and did not receive the glass of bubbly that was part of the offer we booked. It was later rectified and arranged for the desert, so no big deal. But later on, the service was just very long between each dish and we had to remind the waiter of the glass of bubbly.', 'The show was great, the food was good but we had to wait again a long time to get our bill. When we paid, the waiter did not even thank us or said goodbye. So it did not feel as special as we would have liked, such a pity!']
title: Good dinner and evening but poor service

content: ['Food was ok, music brilliant, completely spoiled by over zealous staff who tried to stop dancing (at a Motown night! Lol). Appalling lack of judgement, they did all they could to ruin atmosphere which seems bizarre. Take care spending your money here.']
title: No dancing!!!!

content: ['Visited Boisdale for the second time last night to see Legend, the Bob Marley tribute band. The band were faultless, the food was great and the service improved since my last visit. Best gin n tonic ever! Atmosphere fabulous with the whole place on their feet dancing, wonderful night, will return soon.', 'Honor W.']
title: Birthday celebration

content: ['We went to Boisdale with another couple for dinner on a week night, and this place was buzzing! The restaurant itself is charming - cosy, subtly lit, and well furnished. We had delicious scallop and prawn starters, followed by on the bone steaks, all recommended by our wonderfully attentive waiter, Trevor. ', 'One of the attractions of the restaurant was the live music which started during dinner. We enjoyed the music very much, but our only criticism would be that it was a fraction too loud. ', "I would very much recommend this restaurant to those that enjoy live music and lovely in lively surroundings. If you're a whisky lover, I would imagine it's a must as it has the biggest whisky bar I've ever seen - around 300 bottles we were told! All in all a very positive experience, and we wouldn't hesitate to return. "]
title: Atmospheric and delicious

content: ["It was quite difficult to get to venue due to train closures but we we're looking forward to Sunday Lunch and Jazz. Warm welcome,great table for two. Waiter was lovely but the food was not good. Masses of beef but not of good quality and everything else was rather amateur. Jazz hardly featured. In hindsight I wouldn't have made the effort ."]
title: Pleasant atmosphere

content: ['This place was amazing. Live music was great and the food was excellent. The waiter service was on point couldn’t fault them either. Has an indoor cigar shop where not only can you purchase a cigar but also smoke it. Great night 10 out of 10']
title: Birthday meal

content: ['We went for the Easter Sunday roast and jazz experience. They sat us by a window table as requested and there was no trouble with the telephone booking as people have complained. They answered first ring and I received a confirmation email before the call ended!', 'We had the 3 course set menu. The food was generous, good options and more importantly tasted fantastic.', 'The jazz music was really good too and we weren’t rushed to leave.', 'The only negative is that we had to keep asking for our water to be refilled when other diner had this done without asking. We felt a bit excluded.']
title: Lovely afternoon

content: ['Scottish style, nice location in the heart of Canary Wharf, huge Whiskey bar, live Jazz music and good food make this place a nice experience. However, pricing is at the higher end.']
title: Food‘n Jazz

content: ['My husband surprised me for an anniversary lunch! We have been to the Boisdale before with friends so i was excited! We were seated by the circular window which was a great view of the whole restaurant. Our waiter i believe was called José and he was great, he explained the menu perfectly(this was also Mothers day -so was a little different), he knew all about the dishes and helped us choose! The starters, my husband had the squid and i had the egg Benedict, both starters were incredible, such great quality. This was followed by the amazing roast beef and i had the roast chicken this was amazing, great size portions accompanied by carrots, greens and potatoes! Both white and red wine and prosecco we had were lovely too. We had the Pineapple carpaccio dessert and the Dark chocolate marquise, honeycomb', "& salted caramel, both were incredible but the marquise won! Rich, full of flavour and i recommend to anyone if it's on the normal menu! Both dessert plates had 'Happy Anniversary' written in chocolate on them which made our experience even more special.", 'The live jazz band were good but unfortunately seemed pretty quiet! José(waiter) really is a credit to Boisdale! We will recommend this to all our friends!']
title: Anniversary Lunch

content: ["What a stunning place ! I can nearly admit it's kind of my one of the favourite places now ! Service ( by Alexandra / Alex ) - our waitress was lovely . Her knowledge was very good , done some good recommendations . Spot on service ! Always was there for us ! ", 'Food was amazing ! We are returning guests ! ', 'Ambiance , live music , views - perfect !']
title: Perfect !

content: ['Boisdale is one of my favourite eating places in the Wharf area - in the summer there is a veranda - narrow but with table and chairs overlooking Cabot Square below. I’ve always had great food and service and regularly meet friends for evening drinks and dinner. Access is from within the main concourse down from the DLR towards Cabot Sq and up in a lift.']
title: Scottish Beef in Canary Wharf

content: ['Came here for the Sunday lunch & jazz, very good value for money. Took a while to book, no one took any notice of the emails I sent for a while and I got a lot of help from the Mayfair restaurant, so thanks to them, but on the day everything was perfect, massive food portions, and really nice staff, particularly ours who was Meli.']
title: Food & Jazz

content: ['Very disappointed. Paid £42.50 per person for a night out plus entertainment and found out I had wasted my money. The band was very good but that is the best I can say about the place. The food was mundane to say the least. I ordered the smoked salmon for starter and got a plate with smoked salmon covering it and a small wedge of lemon. I, at least, expected some sales to accompany it. For the main course I ordered the special burger but would have been better off in Burger King. My wife ordered the steak and it was so small it was untrue, plus it came it’s chips and nothing else. All very were extra outside the Prince we paid. The drinks cost a fortune.']
title: Overrated and expensive.

content: ["Always great food and the views are pretty decent. Have only been for business lunches beat it's a lot better when full....not much atmosphere at lunchtime."]
title: Good food, good views

content: ['My wife made a late booking based on hotel recommendation. No problem getting in on a Thursday. We had starter and main plus bottle of wine and a couple of single malts. Music starts at 2115 each night and if you are still at table there is a small service charge if you are still at the table. Steak was perfect and my wife had cod which was excellent. Wine list is extensive as is the whisky list. Would recommend. Cost £175']
title: Great night

content: ['Not a Kilt in Sight Unfortunatley.', 'This is a small chain made popular by ', "It's Live Jazz music and cover artists,Wedding Singer Standard.", 'They have a fumador which is fun and a good selection of Whiskey, Bit like a Hotel feel Lodged in a Time Zone of its own.', 'The Walled gallery make the Place look Clutered with already Tartan every where:)', '2 floors for Diners and More casual diners lower floor, with lots of Oysters! Yuuum.', 'Some interesting characters about the place, every area has a Story, so you will fit in.', 'The Menu is really good with Basic Steak,Chips,Mushrooms,Yeay', "I've been in with friends and had a Fab time!", 'The Staff are always changing and still never smile, which is a shame really because the tips and service charge for waiters is quite generous.', 'There is No TGI feel here or T.V Screen although it maybe a cool idea for the Bar on lower level.', "It's a Sort of Prohibition meets Tartan with Cigar Smoking Number Crunchers and Friends in a Surreal Tardis Dr Who Scene, With everyone piling in and having a Fab time.", 'Where people are dressed Smart Casual.', 'The Food is Incomplicated and Simple British.', "The Wines aren't anything Special as they get their Suppliers from same as Their Competitors???", 'So as a Serious Foodie I would go for a Selection of Beers, Ask if they have a Taster Menu for Beers/Food and stock any beers from Scotland???', 'For sure the Whiskey is a Must try!!', 'Advanced Bookings for upstairs restaurant Advised as it gets Busy when Music is On!', 'I think they should put on an Open Mic night!! It would be Fab!', 'Best Part of the Restaurant is the Terrace!', 'Enjoy:)']
title: Fumador, Dinner,Dance and Tartan!

content: ['Really Really looked forward to this... ', 'Lover of fine whiskies... one of the widest range of whiskies I’ve come across. However, quite heavily priced! ', 'But what really upsets me, is the service. Bartender was in no way knowledgeable, brought me the WRONG whiskey twice before pouring. And when I asked again for the right one, I was huffed / puffed at, before he walked away looking for it... ', 'Only eye contact was to roll eyes away... quite upsetting really...', 'At nearly £30 for two whiskeys, I frankly expect more from the staff who are essentially the flagship and front of house for their product...', 'BUT.... best choice of whiskey if that’s your thing ']
title: Great whiskies...that’s about it 😕

content: ['I was purchasing a box of cigars for my partner and Filipe provided excellent customer service. He is extremely knowledgeable, trustworthy and helpful.']
title: Excellent, knowledgeable service by Filipe at the cigar library!

content: ["I have been to Boisdale on several occasions, with friends. my other half and for family meals. Yes it is pricey but the food is exquisite and the menu has something for everyone. I'm usually not a huge fan of haggis but the haggis they serve is delicious. ", 'The staff are very good and attentive, the shows they put on are definitely worth seeing! so far we have seen a Ray Charles Tribute and also the rat pack! both excellent. ', 'I look forward to my next visit!']
title: Legendary Place

content: ['Very nice Haggis dish, reasonably priced and served by friendly and attentive staff.', "The venue wasn't that busy but the drinks service was slow-ish. Can imagine what it would be like on a busy evening.", "The cigar lounge is nice, it's not that big.", "The cigars are priced for the location, more than retail, but that's to be expected.", "Drinks can't be served in the lounge, but you can purchase at the bar."]
title: Meal and a Cigar

content: ['Boisdale is welcoming and relaxed. My family and I went for Sunday lunch today for my parent’s 50th anniversary. The food was excellent, and the service is friendly and attentive. They made my parents feel very special and I am grateful for the extra effort that the staff went to, to make their visit memorable. ', "As mentioned, the food was really lovely, and they give you a very good portion. I can't bare it when you are presented with a plate with hardly anything on it, which doesn’t happen here. We were all pleasantly full after the 3 course lunch, and I would not hesitate to recommend it to everyone."]
title: Highly recommended

content: ['We came here in November for my husbands birthday and returned with friends for Sunday Jazz lunch. Both visits were equally good- very good service, well presented tasty food - roast was excellent, crispy potatoes and well cooked vegetables. We upgraded to the half bottle of wine each and both times our glasses were refilled above and beyond the said half bottle!! Relaxing atmosphere and great to have the music playing throughout lunch.']
title: Super Sunday lunch

content: ['I came here with a group of friends. Firstly, the band were great. Very entertaining and had many people from the audience up and dancing. The food was good though very overpriced. The service was alright although I had to fill my water myself as the waiters avoided the table.']
title: Expensive meal

content: ['I dined here on Saturday night with friends. The service was impeccable. We had the 3 courses and glass of bubbly offer for £27 and it was well worth it. We also ordered a lovely bottle of Portuguese wine that was value for money. The food was delicious and piping hot. Great menu choices. The staff were very professional and friendly. The live jazz started around 10 and the jive aces were brilliant. There are not many venues in London with live music so this added to a special evening. I would highly recommend and go back.']
title: Fantastic restaurant with live music

content: ['We were lucky enough to be given a voucher by relatives for a bottomless brunch here and we had a wonderful experience!', 'Though initial booking proved a little tricky (had to be done by email but it took several emails and phone calls to actually get booked in), the lovely lady I eventually spoke with who made our booking was extremely friendly and even recommended a later brunch so as to benefit from the live music.', 'On the day we were wowed by the venue itself, it felt strangely surreal to have the huge restaurant and bar on one side of us and a fab view of Cabot square and the river beyond on the other. ', 'The menu was an interesting mix, not entirely what I was expecting from a brunch menu but some delicious sounding dishes nonetheless, I chose the squid and it was delicious. I forget now what my other half had, the dangers of not writing a review straight away, but I seem to think it involved roast beef.', 'Most importantly, the waiters were not stingy with the prosecco! Bottomless is a slight misnomer, as with so many venues offering this there is a time limit so I was on a slight mission to ensure I benefited from my fair share before time was called (hic!) but our glasses were never empty which was great.', 'It was fairly quiet when we arrived, with more people arriving as we approached lunchtime. I can imagine when that dining room is full and the music is playing the atmosphere must be incredible. ', 'We both thoroughly enjoyed it and would like to go back for dinner.']
title: Bottomless prosecco brunch heaven

content: ['We booked a night here when Rebecca Ferguson was singing for my husbands birthday . It was the best birthday hes ever had ! Rebecca was fantastic , the food was beautiful and the atmosphere was great . We would definately go again . They even upgraded our table and wrote happy birthday with a candle in my husbands cheesecake . ']
title: Great night , lovely food , excellent entertainment

content: ['went for a team dinner. had Oyster, Haggis and 7oz Tournedous fillet. Live music was good - someone was playing the cello and another was playing the piano. Brilliant!. The steak was oh so good, so tender!']
title: Food connoisseurs - you will love this place

content: ['What a great night, we booked to see Elvis with VIP table right at the front and it was fantastic, from the moment we walked in the staff were great , service was first class, prices I thought were very fair and the food was very nice ,Elvis was fantastic and put on a great show, my only little grumble is the cost of the VIP table £45 per person was expensive I thought , but we were on the best table, would highly recommend going here for a great night out, will be back soon']
title: Oh What Night

content: ['Visited Boisdale with the same group of friends last year and we went back for more this year because we enjoyed our first visit. ']
title: So good we went back for more
