content: ['Normally when you go to these type of places you can’t get both , here you get great entertainment and fantastic menu to choose from with great fresh food .', 'We all enjoyed the food the service and the entertainment fantastic night all round it won’t be forgotten .']
title: Great food and Elvis show

content: ['Having been a regular visitor at Boisdales in Belgravia we thought we would try their restaurant at Canary Wharf. ', 'Having arrived early we had a couple of cocktails in the bar and they were superb. We made are way upstairs and were shown to our table and from here is where it all went wrong. There were 3 table for two persons and you could barely walk between then. ', 'Next we were given the wrong menus!', 'We ordered some wine and sparkling water The wine arrived promptly but we had to ask a further 3 times for the water!!', 'The starters arrived as ordered and were both very good indeed. ', 'We both chose rib eye steak for main and we ordered two extra side dishes. The steak arrived and were very good, but no side dishes. We just kept being told they were coming!! They did eventually arrive once I had finished my steak so we refused them. The waitress then arrived and asked my wife why we had refused something that we ordered!!!', 'We had coffee that was Luke warm and a liquor whilst watching the band. ', 'I asked to see the Manager but he never showed his face. Over all a terrible experience and one I will not be repeating.']
title: Unexpectedly Disappointing

content: ['What a great night!', 'To celebrate the growth of our business with a couple of our business partners in 2017 we all decieded to take the two teams out and celebrate in style in an evening of good food and drink with the added bonus of the soulfull, husky voice of Rebecca Ferguson singing to us.', 'Rebecca was amazing, she sung a repoitoir of some popular Blues covers and some tracks from her recent 3rd Album “The Lady Sings The Blues”. She sang for about 90 mins. ', 'After the show, I thought it was a nice touch that Rebecca came down through the audience and was happy to have photo’s taken chat and interact with us. I think she hung around for at least 30-45 mins after the show. ', 'Amazing.', 'I have concentrated in my review on the many positive sides of the evening as I didnt want the terrible service we recieved from our table waiter to cloud what was an excellent show.', 'We have visited Biosdales Canary Wharf loads of times before and I want to make it known the service here has been very good.If are served by a waiter called Trevor- please ask for someone else as this will seriously improve your chances of being served promptly. I will be taking this issue up futher with Biosdales to enable them to look into this.', 'Trevor was all over the place.', 'Thank you Biosdales and Rebecca for a great evening.']
title: Rebecca Ferguson Sings The Blues In E14

content: ['Great evening spent at Boisdale on Friday 19th January. Rebecca Ferguson has the most amazing voice and her choice of songs and the brilliant backing group just made the whole evening special. ', 'Food and service was first class. Will definitely be back again.']
title: Fantastic Evening

content: ['We went out for our anniversary. Nice music. Food not like we expected(too expensive, not worth it) and not even anniversary plate.. quite disappointed.']
title: Nothing special

content: ['We booked to have dinner and listen to Si Cranstoun. The service was good as usual, although we did wait quite a while for our starter to arrive. The food was excellent, haggis starter particularly good, main courses were good too and very substantial. Desserts weren’t part of the package but were offered as extra, however we couldn’t manage one! The music was brilliant as well!']
title: Excellent dinner concert package

content: ['We had tickets to see Rebecca Ferguson who was performing at the club for 2 weeks only. Fabulous show and nice intimate atmosphere. ', 'Drinks and food expensive but the location above Cabot Square is superb with really good facilities and easy to park downstairs. Will definitely go again. ']
title: Cool bar in unique location

content: ['Visited Boisdale on 17/1 to see Rebecca Ferguson. Had best table, right by stage, meal good,drinks good, fabulous show with Rebecca and band at their best. Great night out only marred by other ignorant guests talking loudly all through the show. Will b going back soon. ']
title: Super night out

content: ['Service - poor', 'Food - poor', 'Entertainment brilliant', 'Great location, brilliant jazz music, 2 people in our group of 10 sent back their starter and then their main the main was inedible for some not being able to put your fork in a Potatoe is extremely bad, we waited over and hour for drinks and then only half the table got drinks our server told us to send an email as there was no managers available, we ended up get the services and 3 bottles of wine knocked off the bill, I would have rather had great food and better service.']
title: Birthday treat

content: ['We have visited two of the other Boisdale venues before and did really enjoy them so was basically really looking forward to visiting this one.', 'IT TURNED OUT TO BE MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT!', 'We had booked a VIP table and sat down at 8.20 and this is when the ongoing wait started and which then kept on happening. ', 'We waited about 20 minutes for the menus to arrive, a further 20 odd minutes for some one to ask if we wanted drinks which then took a further 20 mins. At this time, no one had asked if we were ready to order or whether we wanted the wine list so we had to ask for both. Once this was done and the wine had been ordered and delivered, we then faced another 30 minutes or so wait for the starters, then at least another 30 odd minutes for the main course by which time our patience was wearing thin so we demanded why there was so much delay. The answer was ambiguous at best and the apology muted. ', "By the time the main course arrived, our wine had been drunk so I requested a glass of the same wine to accompany the dinner. What arrived was 'plonk' at which time I asked to see the head waiter. He apologised and arranged for a replacement glass of wine which did arrive and which was correct this time.", 'On finishing our dinner, believe it or not, there was yet another wait with the cheese platters arriving past 11pm by which time our appetite and patience had disappeared. ', 'It also meant that due to our depressed mood, given the wait, we did not enjoy the music as much as we would have hoped especially given this was part of the reason we went.', 'That was it, I demanded to see the manager to whom I relayed our thoughts on the whole evening and stated that we would seek compensation and that we would never return to the venue. We also expressed that the experience had clouded our overall impression of the Boisdale group.', 'OK, all drinks were wiped from the bill but in our minds, this did not make up for what was by far the worst dining experience we have ever had.', 'AVOID!']
title: ATROCIOUS!!

content: ["The title gives you an indication that I was not impressed. Maybe it's a personal thing but giving a poor review is unusual for me so when I mean it I mean it. ", "Everyone and the tables are so packed in that there is little space to move but possibly this is to maximise business in December. To be fair the food was mass catering quality, poor school dinners at best. The table service was excellent at ensuring wine bottles were emptied so that more could be opened and charged for, definitely good for business. The entertainment was shades of grey literally! I am unsure if the band actually wanted to play and even waited until 9.30 to start - I'm just not sure if that was such a great idea.", "I know that I am being generous giving a 'poor' rating but it is the season of good will and giving less than that would be just terrible!!"]
title: London club style decor looking as tired as the food and the entertainment

content: ['Absolutely fabulous New Years Eve with the west end Jersey Boys. Great table (premium, by the bar), excellent food and service. Entertainment was the best we have seen here (having seen Soul sisters last year, and numerous Frank & dean tributes). Disappointed with management decision not to allow dancing at the front, as cramped dancing was always a feature. Someone complained, and not entering into the spirit of the occasion. Jersey boys was so good, really lovely evening in an intimate location. Only negative for us was to have 12.5% service charge added to already expensive (pre paid) dinner and music ticket. A bit strong.']
title: Fabulous New Years Eve

content: ['Me and my colleagues attended Boisdales for our Christmas party. We had the best time. The food was delicious and hot, very well presented too. The Ratpack Christmas party was AMAZING, the whole restaurant was up dancing. Fab. ', 'I thoroughly enjoyed it.']
title: Best Christmas party

content: ['Visited for New Years Eve and as expected it was a great evening. Good food, good service and fabulous entertainment.', 'The only disappointing thing was the managers decision to stop us dancing in front of the stage because of one woman’s complaint she could not see the stage properly. ', 'Anyone who has been to Boisdale previously knows that is the place to dance, the squashed packed dance floor just adds to the atmosphere.', 'It was just such a shame one person could be so selfish.']
title: New Years Eve

content: ['Absolutely super night with fine food and wine followed by a frank Sinatra and Dean Martin tribute act. You have to see these guys as they were dynamite.', ' ']
title: Outstanding event

content: ['Service very good, no complaints about the food either - belly pork was very good. The cabaret was a tribute to Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin - they were pretty good. It was a shame we had to leave early. Really enjoyed it.']
title: Lovely to have live music

content: ['We booked this as our Christmas present to ourselves and we were not disappointed. I have never eaten in such a well run restaurant, The staff could not do enough for you and the food was out of this world.', 'We watched The Dean Martin & Frank Sinatra Vegas show and they were fantastic performers and entertainers.', 'To sum my review up...... Boisdale = AMAZING and i would go back in a flash.']
title: Best Night Out Ever

content: ['Booked the set menu for the Frank and Dean show at Xmas, and it was absolutely brilliant.', 'The place itself extrudes ambiance, and the food was top quality.', 'Highly recommended ']
title: Superb Spot

content: ['Had dinner at Boisdale Canary Wharf on Saturday evening. The service was first class and really attentive. The food was amazing and the Frank and Dean show was fantastic. The whole experience was near perfect and reminded me why this restaurant is my personal favourite and still possibly the best restaurant in London.']
title: Frank and Dean night

content: ['Feels like you’re in a private members club! Deep rich reds and tartan, stag heads etc on the wall and a huge whiskey bar. Brilliant live music, and a very nice menu. ', 'Certainly a different evening out with a lovely view over Canary Wharf.']
title: Very cool jazz bar/Restaurant

content: ['Having lunched at the Boisdale in Belgravia restaurant in the past, this was my first visit to its Canary Wharf restaurant.', 'A traditional Sunday lunch accompanied by live jazz entertainment.', 'The restaurant staff could have been better coordinated.', 'On the whole, an enjoyable lunchtime interlude']
title: Sunday lunch at the Boisdale, Canary Wharf

content: ['So last night 4 of us came to Boisdales for a Xmas get-together. Our waitress Kate was fantastic...friendly and on the ball. My husband ordered 2 large vodka/sodas for us and i can honestly say all we could taste was water. Same thing on our 2nd order...water. We decided to buy a bottle of vodka for £108.00 thinking it would be cheaper....it was a 75cl bottle what u can buy in a supermarket for £12.00! Moving on....i ordered advacado as a starter....i found 3 small pieces in total amongst a load of green salad! For my main course i ordered Cod....it turned up raw...really unacceptable considering what we were paying for the meal. My husbands rib eye steak was bland and chewy as well. Our 2 friends meals were nothing special either. On the bright side...the Vegas Night was great...but we wont be rushing back for below average food at above average prices and ridiculously priced drinks.']
title: FOOD AND DRINKS OVER-PRICED...GREAT ENTERTAINMENT.

content: ['We went to the frank sinatra tribute which was good ', 'We all ordered steaks which I may add took ages to arrive ', 'When they did they was going to walk away still like jelly in the middle and undercooked and we all asked for medium -rare ', 'We all 5 of us couldn’t eat it .. ', 'the management was very apologetic and asked if we wanted 5 more ', 'We really had enough by then ', 'So we got a complimentary bottle of wine ', 'Still had a good night and it was very busy .. ', 'would I return .. ermmm prob yes but I wish they had they had all them silly things in order for a 10/10 ']
title: Birthdays

content: ['Dear Sirs,', ' ', 'We visited your restaurant on Friday 1st December for our family Christmas meal, of which there were 9 of us, some of whom had travelled over from Ireland to see family and enjoy a Christmas meal altogether.', ' ', 'We were booked in for 8:15 and were showed to our tables and left with the menus, after around 20 minutes we were still waiting for a waiter to come and ask if we would like any drinks or wine, so we took it upon ourselves to ask for the wine list, which was duly bought over.', ' ', 'We then waited another 20 minutes for someone to come and take our drinks order, which included 5 cocktails and 2 bottles of wine. Only the 2 bottles of wine and 2 of the cocktails were brought over. We then waited until 9:15pm and we had to go and speak to the manager to complain that our order had not been taken and that we were still waiting for the other 3 cocktails.', ' ', 'At around 9:30 our food order was taken, a full hour and 15 minutes after we had sat down.', ' ', 'When the starters arrived 2 of our table had ordered the rocket watercress and parmesan salad, but instead were given beetroot and goats cheese, something that was not on the menu, and two of our table ordered the avocado salad which had about 2 pieces of avocado in it, but after having to wait for so long we did not want to complain and wait even longer to start eating.', ' ', 'Once finished we waited a while for the table to be cleared and we did complain to the manager about the starters being incorrect and he did mention he would bring out the correct starters but we said no could we just have our mains. The mains arrived, 3 of us ordered the rib eye steak, from having a rib eye before I would expect to see a bit of fat around the edge to enhance the flavour, but the steaks we were given were half meat and half fat, I will attach a picture to show what we left as it was just fat and gristle. The problem was the steak was tasty just a shame we couldn’t have enjoyed it more.', ' ', 'We then waited again until about half 11 for our plates to be cleared a full 3 hours and 15 minutes after we had sat down, we were then given the main dessert menu rather then the set menu which we had paid for.', ' ', 'When the waitress came to take our order I asked for the cheese plate and she said which one so I said there is only one on the set menu and you have given us the incorrect menus which she apologised for and bought over the correct menus for the rest of the table.', ' ', 'We were finally served our desserts at 5 past Midnight, at which point we had had enough of waiting and didn’t really enjoy them, because it felt like we were eating them for the sake of it as we had already pre-paid for them.', ' ', 'This is the first time I have been to dinner and had my main one day and my dessert on another day.', ' ', 'I had been looking forward to visiting your restaurant because I enjoy my whiskey and cigars, so I wanted to try some whiskeys, a couple of weeks ago I tried a Cherry Bourbon and had read on your website you had a vast choice of whiskeys, I asked the maître de if you had a cherry bourbon and he said he was not sure but he would find out, he never came back and told me which I thought was extremely poor form.', ' ', 'After we had ordered our desserts which was about 11:45pm, myself and another member of our party headed down to the cigar room, which we would have done a lot earlier if we hadn’t of waited nearly 3 hours to finish our mains, when we got to the cigar room they said they were no longer serving, and we could not buy one, so again one of the things I had been looking forward to, I could not enjoy because of the terribly poor service.', ' ', 'To add to the overall bad service, we had two tables next to us, who appeared to think they were at a football match rather then a good restaurant and it took us to complain 3 or 4 times before anything was actually done with them, even though we were told by one of your waitresses you were trying to get rid of them, but 5 minutes later more drinks and shots were being bought to them. Our table was abused with disgusting language from the table next to us - which I wont repeat on here. After numerous complaints nothing was done till the end of the night when the police removed these people.', ' ', 'When it came to paying the bill, we had a long conversation with the manager and expressed all of our disappointments throughout the evening and she was kind enough to take off some of the bottles of wine we had ordered and we eventually paid approx. £187 for our drinks.', ' ', 'We had previously paid £60 each for the set menu, which for that I would expect good food and good service, I could have had better food and service going to my local Wimpy.', ' ', 'If you are going to portray yourselves as a high end restaurant at least have the staff and produce to back this up.', ' ', 'Due to the long delays we had encountered we did not leave the restaurant until 12:30am by which point we had missed our last train home, so we had to order Uber’s to take us home, one of which was £45 and the other was about £30 so this was an extra £75 we had to pay out as a group due to your poor service.', ' ', 'We really expected more from this night, and if we had not already pre-paid for the meal we would have walked out before ordering our starters because of the length of time it took to order, I appreciate if it was a busy night, but you do these music evenings fairly often so you should be used to dealing with a full cover of tables.', ' ', 'Also, we could not enjoy the music on offer, as were having to eat our starters and mains as the entertainment reached its pinnacle due to the long delays we encountered throughout the evening', ' ', 'Both myself and my partner would not visit your restaurant again and I think I speak for the remainder of the party as well.', ' ', 'I also work in the City and am quite near your Bishopsgate restaurant and previously I have considered using your restaurant for a business lunch or dinner, but I definitely would not be doing that now as I would not want to be embarrassed in front of any clients who I would have taken.', ' ', 'I await your response to our numerous concerns.', ' ', 'Regards']
title: Worst experience - will not return

content: ['Impressive venue..very theatrical like an old gentleman’s club... blood red walls and plaid wallpaper..a huge wall of whisky …!!naked lady paintings very tasteful. ', ' Certainly up there with places to go...not cheap! But hey you don’t do it every week....?', ' Very good service very good food expensive wine....(geez be careful......) and watch out for the additional service charge which is discretionary.....?!!', ' Haggis n Neeps Belly of Pork and a Panna cotta plus an excellent tribute act Frank and Dean The Vegas Show ....', 'Scottish oak smoked salmon, wild venison carpaccio, crispy Szechuan pepper and chilli squid.....mains rib eye steak, turkey wrapped in parma ham and a crab salmon and haddock fishcake.... cheeseboard,sticky toffee chocolate cup and Christmas pudding...a bit of dancing ....excellent time was had by all…what an evening...unforgettable. Thank you Boisdale…. (A bottle of chocolate block red from SA.....£80!!!!! In Waitrose £21.99!! )of course you don’t have to buy it......please try it it’s an experience.... ']
title: Family Christmas dinner and show.

content: ['Boisdale was recommended by a friend and it lived up to expectations. We ate in the bar, and there is restaurant with live music on the floor above. The bar has an extensive menu with something for everyone. Even though a Saturday night, the service was excellent, with a full house. The food is well presented and the meals were excellent. Their steaks are superb and the duck was wonderful. ', 'Boisdale has one the most comprehensive single malt whisky menus I have every found. They also have an outside terrace with heaters, serving food, drink and cigars, and they have a walk-in cigar humidor with a wide selection of cigars. I will certainly return to this restaurant.']
title: A Touch of Scotland in Canary Wharf

content: ["The atmosphere and location is worth it, the restaurant has an amazing view of Cabot Square and with the Christmas tree lights provide a very pleasant view for the evening. However having made an effort to get there on time we did find the service sporadic, pretty hit and miss. There were issues with the wine and the times between the starter and main over 40 minutes - they were busy but it was surprising. I'd go again but only for the location and live music - the service was very unfortunate. I expect the waiters to be more attentive and circumspect - this was a company treat."]
title: Christmas party for the team.

content: ['Had a lovely evening at the Frank and Dean Vegas show. Food was delicious and entertainment great. All in all a fabulous evening until we got the bill and had a bogus amount of £79.50 added for a bottle of wine. Was taken off as soon as we queried it but left a sour taste in our mouths. How many people have been had over by not checking their bill properly. Will go again but will definitely be on red alert when the bill come. Others should be too!']
title: Frank and Dean night

content: ['My favorite were choice of whiskeys and side dishes. The last ones are in small portions so it’s nice to take many and share! On the ground floor there is the cigar bar where you choose one from huge variety and smoke! With another !! ']
title: Very Good!

content: ['My partner booked this as a surprise for my birthday, we had an amazing evening. The food was great, the staff extremely attentive and loving the Cigar room :)', 'It was Sinatra night which was fantastic and the whole atmosphere in the restaurant was great.']
title: What an evening :)

content: ['Although a very nice ambience & menu- u can feel the attitude.', "Plus it looks like they're looking for an opportunity to overcharge.", 'I wish the management would look into what is becoming of this excellent place.']
title: Overpriced & infuriating attitude

content: ["Third time we've been and we love the place, Food id good for what it is and our waitress was supper on a busy Friday night. The bar service downstairs is slow and the tree guys on duty were almost surly. Sort it out please Boisdale!"]
title: Great venue, good music and food, awful bar service.

content: ['Just recently visited for the Friday music night. We have been to one of these evenings before so thought that we knew what to expect. However, as good as the music was the food on the set menu was very over priced as there were supplements on most of it and the main course did not come with any side dishes. The food choices were limited and food was very disappointing. The music finished much earlier than expected which was again disappointing. Sad to say we will not be returning which is a shame as the venue is lovely and music brilliant but food lets it down.']
title: Very overpriced

content: ["Four of us went here for a Friday night two course Travel Zoo offer costing £80 for 2 courses and a glass of Fizz. The place looks amazing and the singer was great though he did come on a bit late for me and I suspect does multiple gigs in a night as he was off a bit early. Service and food great but the itemised bill was not presented to me and I ended up paying £200 in extras. I was a bit tiddly and had guests so did not query it. I hounded Boisdale on email and challenged the bill via Amex. All my money has been refunded but it's such a shame this place is plastered all over discount sites and has some of the adverse comments below. Just reprice so as not to try and rip off unsuspecting tourist and City types/sort out your consistency and you have a winner Boisdale."]
title: Blinking costly extras Boisdale

content: ['Attended a private event at The Boisdale in Canary Wharfe during a trade event at Excel (6th November) and although I’d previously really enjoyed the Belgravia restuarant I was uncertain as to what I’d find..', 'I needn’t have been, it was a fantastic evening, great decor (full of conversation starting images), really friendly staff, great drinks and a stage to rival any decent club...', ' The night I attended was a ‘Cuban night’ with great starters and a cracking buffet of delicacies reminiscent of our previous trip to Havana and Cuba....', 'The whole evening was a huge success and I will certainly be going back...']
title: Cracking place to have fun!

content: ['Love this place. Feels classy. And Friday night is soul night! The dinner and show ticket is very good value. We had a table with a great view of the stage. Food was good. Service was great even though it was an exceptionally busy evening. We saw The Black Hat Band who were excellent and got everyone up dancing really early. They were fronted by a charismatic talented singer. We had a wonderful night out. ']
title: Second visit won't be my last

content: ['+ scotch egg was lovely.', '+ Service is professional and our young waitress was really on the ball.', '+ the burgers are really good here and the atmosphere and quality of food is worth the price. ', '- it was really quiet service and on entering downstairs we were sent upstairs only to be sent back downstairs again. I was with a pregnant lady so that wasn’t well handled. ']
title: Decent lunch

content: ['Went as group of 8, booked in advance for Frank Sinatra tribute plus 2 course meal £45 ..... ', 'The menu was good but 2 out of the 4 choices per course had a supplement. Most of us went for the squid (extra £3) and the steak (extra £8) ..... must point out the food was very good but we had to wait over 2 hours for our main course.....', 'The place closed at 12 and we where served our main at 11.10. ....', 'We complained and the manager was very apologetic and discounted our drinks bill..... even before that the waiter... (who was excellent) had bought us a bottle of wine on the house for the delay in our food.', 'We did have a good time ... but it was expensive and felt a bit ripped off....why bother with a set meal if you are then going to charge so much for supplements...', 'I did want to give this a 4 star mark but because of the delay in food and the supplements I felt I couldnt.', 'Great venue , food very good, friendly waiters, packed out but they could do much better.']
title: Mixed feelings

content: ['Great venue, great location but boy does the bar, restaurant and service disappoint ', 'Been to this place for lunch, drinks, dinner for business and social occasions for years now but finally decided I really can’t say I care if it’s there or not', 'Bar service on a busy day / night is always poor, especially if you’re smaller than average build person - there was a time I waited for over 10 minutes the bar man didn’t even acknowledge my existence until another customer he signalled to serve shouted at him to say hey this customer was here before me. This happened not just once - quite a few times', 'Food - hit and miss. Did like the miniature Scotch eggs but standard not consistent - sometimes soggy, sometime salty, sometime spot on. Recent visit (not my choice) for lunch- I’d rather forget and never return . The fish cake - apart from being too salty and couldn’t really taste much else, didn’t find much fish there either. The steak was ok but for the surcharge on top of the set lunch price ... day light robbery ']
title: This place infuriates me

content: ['We reserved a table for 4 for 28/09/17, 2 of us arrived a bit early and were shown to the bar. The bar staff was VERY busy and not once in the 15 minutes we stood there did anyone even acknowledge our presence despite me actually staring them down. This is basic customer service. We decided out of desperation to sit at our table as we waited for the other two to arrive. Funnily got our drink order taken and drinks in less time than we stood at the bar, made by the very bar tenders that were ignoring us. Go figure...', "The special New Orleans menu was good and I can't complain about the food quality. The prices were breathtaking, but sadly the service one would expect with breathtaking prices was lacking. Again, BASIC customer service skills lacking. Never once did our waitress check back to see that everything was ok. I had to hunt down a fork is it was not replaced after the starter. I literally could no find a waiter or waitress to flag down so I walked to an empty table to get a fork. It seemed the restaurant was understaffed for a Thursday night and everyone seemed rushed off their feet, however this is not an excuse to not get the basics right. Had we not been with special guests I would have asked for the service to be removed from the bill.", 'This was our first time at Boisdale and most certainly our last. The whole approach to service was not customer lead and quite frankly if I am paying £80 a head I could have easily had a fine dining experience in London with the service to match.', 'You brought NOLA to London but you forgot the key ingredient!']
title: New Orleans themed night, shocking service

content: ["I have been to Boisdale many times over the last two years but on my last 3 visits 2 have been very poor. The food is generally great but the last two times I have been in a group of 5 people. Two guests on both occasions have not received what they expected, Lamb shank that was pure fat and over cooked steak. The restaraunt were good and swapped them over but it means that you end up eating in two groups which isn't great.", "To top it off this week we were presented with the bill that we paid including the service charge. 10 minutes later we were leaving and a lady came over saying we hadn't paid the bill presenting us with a new £100 higher bill as they had forgotten some wine on the previous bill. We paid as its the right thing to do but no apology was offered.", 'I found the lady who could have been the manager to be transactional with no interest in her customers. It felt like an expensive canteen and we were just part of the process.', "I guess we all learn, my feedback is that it can be a lottery at Boisdale and if something does go wrong the service isn't great."]
title: Two out of three is bad

content: ['Booked a table there to have a nice meal on a recent visit to London after seeing it on Celebrity Masterchef. Originally planned to have the set meal but ended up choosing from the main menu. It was all fabulous! There was live music too which was an added bonus and the jazz was right up our street. Overall quite expensive but worth every penny. My husband had the lamb and said it was the best he’d ever tasted! Would definitely go back as we usually stay in Docklands and it is just across the river.']
title: Fabulous food!

content: ['First visit to this restaurant and highly recommend. Great menu choice. Food was fantastic and first class service. ']
title: Fabulous food

content: ['A friend booked a table for 3 at Boisdale on Saturday night, and we had a fantabulous evening. The meal was very delicious and enjoyable, lovely potion too. Very highly recommended, oh let’s not forget the jazz band, the lead singer was very entertaining. 8/10 if you ask me ']
title: Nice and calm

content: ["Very disappointed and very sad, I was really looking forward to take my best friend there as a treat. The waiters did not seem to know what was going on but that's neither here or there in the scheme of things. The royal seafood platter was a horror of frozen clapped out prawns and some sad old half lobster. But wait for this, the shallot and vinegar to accompany oysters was awful, shallots and vinegar? How can you get that wrong? The steak to follow was tougher than shoe soles, I could not even cut it with a steak knife, let alone chew it. There is something wrong there, they cut corners for profit. And we won't notice?"]
title: Very disappointed and very sad, I was really looking forward to take my best friend there as a treat.

content: ['I took my parents and husband for lunch while my parents were over from Australia. It was a set menu with three courses for an acceptable price (around £37) considering the live music. It was fantastic from start to finish and the experience was made even better by our fantastic waiter, Jose. He ensured absolutely no detail was missed and should be commended for making our time there so memorable. My husband and I will definitely be coming back.']
title: Sunday jazz was a real treat

content: ['We visited Boisdale on Friday night and used a Travelzoo Voucher. It was very easy to book via email. When we arrived we had a lovely table for two quite near the front and were greeted with our glass of prosecco. Jeremy Sassoon was playing with his band and the music was absolutely first rate, very professional and polished. Service was very friendly and we had enough time between courses to really enjoy the wonderful ambiance and the music. Food was good and I would definitely recommend this place if you fancy something romantic and just a bit different - I will definitely be back!']
title: Fantastic Evening

content: ['We went here for a birthday treat to my husband as he likes jazz, blues soul. Great place, the decor was in a tartan theme, and the show we went to see was a Cuban show. The 2course meal that came with the show was fantastic.,and it wasn’t expensive either. The only downfall was the prices of the drinks, atmosphere was alive, and the waiters were very polite']
title: Birthday gift

content: ['Having just made a purchase at David M Robinson and wanting to complete our visit to Canary Wharf with lunch the sales person at DMR, Mel highly recommended this restaurant and was kind enough to phone ahead on I and my elderly mothers behalf.', 'How glad I was I took her advise. The set lunch menu is excellent with the main course dish of the beef being exceptional. The staff are attentive without being over bearing and made the visit a real treat for my mother. I would without doubt recommend this restaurant for Sunday lunch with the staff and food being absolute top draw.']
title: Excellent Lunch, Excellent Service - a great afternoon

content: ["We went in with no reservation and got a table immediately. Great restaurant with amazing cocktails. Service is great and wine selection top notch. This is the 5th time we're having dinner at this place and service , food qualityMr ambiance absolutely amazing. Highly recommended! "]
title: Always exceeding expectations

content: ['Came here for the three course, fixed price, lunch menu. Half of the menu options required a supplement to be paid. Food was lovely, though the steak looked a bit lost and naked on the plate with only a cup of chips for company.', 'Service was slow, seats were well wobbly and interior looked shabby. We could see wine splatters on the backs of other seats.', 'I expected better of the place.', 'But do remember - the food was good.']
title: Loonnnggg lunch

content: ["Went for Sunday lunch , had live jazz music which was great , the food was very good had starter main course and dessert which was all very good can't wait to go back ."]
title: Sunday lunch

content: ["We wait 25 minute before someone came to take the order and then 15 minute more for the drinks, at that point we paid and left. We explain everything to the waitress she didn't even apologize, she just told us that she was busy."]
title: first and last time

content: ['This was my first visit to the Boisdale and I really enjoyed the decor with its lovely photograph of visitors to the restaurant over the years. The food was ok. I had a quinoa salad with sweet potato fries. The salad had good ingredients but was tasteless as it had no dressing what so ever. The fries were delicious. The wine menu looked fab but I am concerned the food simply would live up to calibre of wine on offer!! ']
title: Good

content: ['What a fabulous night of music and food, Boisdale Canary Wharf is a great venue for jazz and soul and for the awards night the kitchen surpassed itself, catering for a full restaurant of this size with no dip in quality is a remarkable achievement, this was matched by the wine list and the quality of the serving team, great night, great staff and great food, will be back for many more nights !']
title: AwardsNight

content: ["Another visit to Boisdale's and yet again it didn't disappoint.", 'Great food, great entertainment and cracking cocktails.', 'Besides the food my favourite is the cigar room!', "We'll be back again soon."]
title: Great night and great food

content: ['The main difficulty we had was choosing which dishes to order because we all fancied most of them. We were all really pleased with our choices, and we enjoyed our afternoon at Boisdale. ', "We opted to include 3/4 bottle of wine each, and all enjoyed our meals. Pudding choices were not our cup of tea, so we ordered the cheese board and weren't disappointed. ", 'Met the American waiters who were here for the American football. All in all would definitely recommend Sunday lunch']
title: Great Sunday lunch with live jazz

content: ['Excellent Sunday roast with great music and service from Denis our waiter.', 'Great ambiance and a fantastic location.']
title: Sunday lunch

content: ['All 11 of us girls had a fabulous night at the Boisdale Canary Wharf on Friday. We had a 2 course set menu for only £19.95 with a glass of Pressco via opentable.com. A much varied choice of food on the set menu than our previous visit which was nice. Food was delicious and hot and service was good. A special thank you to Agne for assisting us with the group booking and giving us a great table near the dance floor, as we had requested. We danced non stop to a fanatstic soul live band and had a another great night. For some of us it was a third visit and once again we were not disappointed. Will definitely be returning again soon . Thank you to the Boisdale team']
title: Great venue, food, service and music

content: ['I have been a couple of times and it can be quite noisy on a busy Friday night, but fun and for Canary Wharf not bad value. I am sure we will be back soon, enjoyable food and good wines make for a good evening.']
title: Great for after work meal and drinks

content: ["Really nice place with good food and drink, made all the more special by our wonderful waiter Chris, who didn't let a second pass with an empty glass and was superbly friendly and polite. Chris rocks."]
title: lovely evening

content: ["Went here on Friday night as a group of 5 ladies. We had prebooked a table for dinner and the music at £39.50 a head and booked ahead for free flowing prosecco for 2 hours at £15 (each although the waiter wasn't aware of the prosecco booking) ", "When you walk in there is a distinct smell of vomit which does disappear thank goodness in the actual venue. Staff were great if a little slow to begin with. 4 choices of starter, 2 of which had a supplement. Choice of 4 mains, burger a £4 supplement, steak an £8 supplement !!!! Guys that's too much. Food was good, music was good, lose the supplements"]
title: Too many supplements

content: ['If there is then it must apply to our experience tonight. ', 'We came here previously to see Mud Morganfield and It was a great evening. We mistakenly thought that was the norm and came back with some VIP and international guests tonight. The Jive Aces were performing. ', "The service was dreadful. I ordered a Jeroboam of champagne, a bottle of white and a bottle of red. The waitress disappeared for no less than 40 minutes before coming back with nothing and telling me the Jeroboam was out of stock as was the bottle of white. The red was available but they didn't bring that whilst we tried to resolve the other missing bottles. An hour and a quarter after we had been seated we got a drink. ", 'Then there was the food, or lack thereof. Most of us (9 people) ordered steaks. Pretty simple to do. Except the meals were served peace meal with one of our guests getting his main course 30 minutes after everyone else. ', 'It took so long to get our drinks and food we ran out of time to even consider dessert. ', 'Coffees, teas? Not even offered. ', 'The band - the Jive Aces - just not anywhere near the same league as Ginger Baker (#3 drummer in Rolling Stone magazines top 100 drummers of all time). Poor. Repetitive. Desperate. ', "I don't say these things idly. It's my job. I travel the world eating at decent restaurants and signing iconic people. Boisdale makes a big thing about Jools Holland running their music. I know Jools and have many him many times through a mutual friend. I cannot believe Jools was involved in tonight's booking. ", 'We made the mistake of taking a good, Australian singer to Boisdale tonight based on our very good experience with Mud Morganfield. It was a mistake and we will never, ever put out foot in there again. ', "We complained to the management and they were totally disinterested. I was so cross I had the 'optional' £350 service charge taken off my bill. ", 'This is obviously for tourists who have no idea what London, decent food, good service or entertainment is about. ', 'Appalling is a favourable comment.']
title: Is there anything worse than appalling?

content: ["Service impeccable food excellent, music just right great menu great cocktails and a really nice relaxing Sunday lunch can't fault it would have been better with more customers maybe would have created more atmosphere, but no complaints about anything super will definitely return."]
title: Fabulous Sunday lunch

content: ["Met friends after work in Canary Wharf bad robot or is giant robot and Mrs C came down from Suffolk for the evening , anyway it was busy and drink ££££ at bad robot so we decided on food - Boisdale was suggested by other friend - what a surprise !! It's tucked away in what appears an unassuming office building, if that exists on the Wharf ! turn out of the lift wow - great decor and atmosphere jazz after 9:45 , sadly we didn't stay for the jazz - needed to be in the office Saturday for a bit , food was really good best steak I have had for a long time other meals also great - good wine selection lots of different choices When we left around. 9:30 the place was buzzing must try and arrange a return and later sitting for the Music"]
title: Best steak on the Wharf

content: ['This is a huge barn and that only refers to the 2nd floor restaurant and facilities. Dark wood and rich red colours may be good for night time entertainment but not appealing on a sultry, late summer day. Seated by the window but view of neighbouring office windows and walls did not excite. Our waiter was poorly trained and had difficulty explaining the various beers/lagers available. Later he knocked over and broke a glass on the table and then returned and did the same with a beer bottle - fortunately empty and glass too thick to break.', 'Food expensive and lacking any flair. My starter of spicy squid (£9.75) featured rubbery strips which over coated and a pink sauce. Not impressed. Had high hopes of the 28 day aged 12oz rib-eye (£32.00) cooked medium rare but again poor quality meat for such a price. The steak was not tender and had no great flavour so why all the fuss about its provenance. Sweet potato chips dredged through paprika (£4.75) were edible but much too thin to impart the lovely flavour of this super vegetable.', 'I was a guest so had to keep my views under wraps lest offending my host who obviously thought he was bring us to the best restaurant in Canary Wharf. Yet another disappointing "big" lunch outing']
title: Distinctly underwhelming

content: ["Went to Boisdale Canary Wharf on a Tuesday evening so didn't expect it to be too busy. We paid the music charge and had a meal before the jazz band came on. The main music room on Floor 2 was not very full at all. There was an event going on in the next room which was quite bustling and every time someone came through the adjoining door, the music was slightly drowned out, as it was right next to the stage. There was also a very noisy event coincidental on the floor below (the Terrace, I think) which was so loud and booming, that the floor almost shook and the bass could be heard above the jazz band! The waiter service was very good but they were very quiet, however, I received the wrong food in my starter. The main course 12 hour cooked lamb was tender but overpoweringly herbed and I could not eat it all. Overall, disappointing for a club with such high expectation."]
title: Bit of a let down

content: ["Boisdale is a terrific place to go for a romantic dinner with live music. Book a table where you fancy and have a two course meal, wine and whisky that leaves a lingering taste for hours.... or add a third course. Even the Angus steak hamburger is excellent, the steak is worth paying extra for it. We saw a Salsa style band with a nod towards the Buena Vista Social Club from Cuba, where they would like you to show off your moves and get with the rhythm. If you have a craving for haggis, go A La Carte and have it as a starter. Thereafter you will be hooked, and have to go back. With my Scottish ancestry it's a must. At lunchtime you feel as if you are in a Scottish mansion in the highlands rather than the London Docklands, with stags adorning the walls. A treat!"]
title: Dinner and Music event

answer_text: ['Hello Paul s, ', 'I am glad to hear that you enjoyed the recent function you attended here at Boisdale Of Canary Wharf. Your kind words about the food have been well received by our kitchen team. ', 'Thank you for taking the time to let us know how you enjoyed it, hopefully we will see you again soon.', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ["Attended a busy function here in early July and the food was as you'd expect very good indeed. Main course featured an extremely tasty and tender roast fillet. Cheese was also rather good"]
title: Excellent beef

content: ['Stopped off here for a drink before going onto a restaurant for dinner. Sat outside upstairs which was quite nice. Unfortunately a lot of smokers which spoilt it a lot, that said good service and very relaxing. They had live music and were very busy, they have a restaurant where you can get reasonably priced food.']
title: Not bad for a drink..

answer_text: ['Hello Samantha B, ', 'Thank you for taking the time to write your recent review. I am keen to get some more detail on why you found the food offering to be disappointing. ', 'Please contact me directly on gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk as I would like the opportunity to speak to you directly. ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ['The venue is very nice, the whole ambiance. They had a live band which played lovely music but the food was disappointing. Not worth the money. ']
title: Mother-in-law Birthday

answer_text: ['Hi Sue M, ', "Thank you so much for letting us know of your recent visit, and enjoyment. I am glad you eventually found us and were able to take advantage of our Jerk wrap 'Happy Hour' - it is a fantastic offer and, I agree, delicious! Paired with an ice cold Red Stripe or refreshing Appleton Cocktail it is the perfect snack on a summers evening. ", 'There are areas of the terrace that are less exposed to the music as we do try and cater for all needs. However, should you join us again on a Tuesday, Wednesday or Saturday you can request to be close to the music and we can point you in the right direction....where I am sure you can make some musical requests!', 'We look forward to seeing you soon, ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ['Read about this place in the Jamaica Gleaner before I left Jamaica to visit family in Liverpool. My son and I had been to the amazing Pink Floyd Exhibition at The V & A museum that afternoon as he is a big fan. ', "Our links with Jamaica made us choose the Boisdale, Canary Wharf, plus we always enjoy the 'after work' vibes at CF. We had a little trouble findingthe venue it but well worth the effort, as when we arrived staff were so friendly, helpful and fun! ", "Beautiful ambience with Bird of Paradise Flowers and other Jamaican Decorations. Began with their recommended great Appleton or Red Stripe drink and a free Jerk Chicken Wrap special which was the best I ever tasted. Tradition Red Stripe in a bottle! Appleton Special Fruit punches were delicious.The Jerk Chicken was the best, almost equal to 'Scotchies' in Jamaica. We ordered the great Chef's Jerk Platter, again amazing followed with a few more cocktails and finished with Coffee Martini's. It was great night and my only disappointment was in waiting for Saxon Sound to start playing I asked the Waiter if they were on Jamaica time? He said they had begun at 6pm but we couldn't hear them from where we were sitting outside in the centre of the terrace. They upped the volume later but it was mostly Soca and we would have liked to hear some good oldies, plus feel like the Sound was actually playing (sounded like a background recorded tape playing and not really Jamaica music vibes). Having said that I am taking my sister back there on Friday when we visit London again for her to take part in the 100mile cycle race on Sunday! One Love"]
title: Wonderful Family Visit - Jamaica 55 Excellent Event

answer_text: ['Hi helenmiller2016,', 'Thank you so much for your feedback and it is great to know you would recommend us! ', 'We hope to see you soon, ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ['Best of Scotland showcase for PAs/EAs who also book business travel. Brilliant evening, Boisdale staff were very attentive, fantastic venue in Canary Wharf, with roof terrace.', 'Would recommend this lovely venue.']
title: Best of Scotland Showcase

answer_text: ['Hi Snowball71,', 'It was a real pleasure to read the review of your recent visit. Thank you so much for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. ', 'You will need to come back soon so you can enjoy our fantastic live music - it really does add that extra special touch to the evening.', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ['We recently had a team leaving dinner there and the menu was extensive, the wine list was awesome and the atmosphere was brilliant. Such a shame there was no Jazz on the night we booked but I just love this restaurant and they have never failed']
title: Best for a Business Dinner in Canary Wharf

content: ['Location is excellent. 5 minutes from Canary Wharf Station which has Jubilee Line and DLR connections so really well accessible from both east and west London. Reception was fine, great table overlooking the square and the service was excellent. Not too swift but relaxed enough to have reasonable conversation but at the same time efficient. The atmosphere livens up around 2000 so I would not book for dinner before then unless you simply want dinner and then leave. If you overstay into the music session you will be charged a cover charge which is not cheap at around 25 pounds a head. We booked dinner and a show, it was UKL 44.75 per head excluding drinks. We had a two course meal which was included. We both had the squid deep fried which could have come out of a bag of frozen squid and a steak which was cooked well and along with fries was good. I had a portion of steamed broccolli which was ok. A gin and tonic is 11 pounds and water is 4.20 for 75 cl. A Treacle pudding which looked like it was out of a bag was 7.50. So as you can see this is not a cheap place to be. The total bill as above and service charge added ( its also added to the show price so beware ) was 152.10. I think that is expensive. We could have had a meal and show at Ronnie Scotts for less. The room itself is a good size and sound is good so this is a good venue. Its pub food at fine restaurant prices but if you are happy with that in order to see some live jazz on a Saturday night then I guess it is worth it. We probably would not visit again.']
title: Interesting but Expensive

answer_text: ['Hi Theresa666,', 'I was given the feedback from my team and as my duty manager promised you on the day I have subsequently sent you a personal e-mail to go into a bit more depth with regards to your recent visit. ', 'I look forward to your reply,', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ['We booked a table of 4, to celebrate my birthday, with my best friends.', 'Table was booked for 13.45', 'It appeared that there was a shortage of staff. ', 'We did wait some time before our drinks orders were taken.', 'And no explanation of how the menu options worked.', 'My friend asked what of the two meat roast options the maître d recommended and he suggested the Pork. She was very happy with this as she said she loved the crackling, as per the menu.', 'And then a further long wait for our starters.', 'We had to request more than once, to have our glasses re-filled..after sitting with empties for some time.', 'Eventually the food came...haggis option was hard, overcooked.', 'The rest of the starters were good.', 'Then we waited and waited and waited for the main course!', '1 hour 45 minutes later, we called the maître d and waiter over to enquire where our main courses were, bearing in mind that it was now 15.30 and the place closed at 16.00?', 'As we were speaking to him, the plates arrived.', 'The meat was almost cold.', '1 little pot with a few VERY small roast potatoes for me. The others were presented with CHIPS. And there was no crackling for my friend!!!', 'We each had a small bowl of soggy looking sliced carrots YUK', 'No apologies ', 'No explanation ', 'Nothing except excuses...', 'They went to check in the kitchen and returned to say they had run out of crackling AND roast potatoes! ', 'Had we not of raised this, we were just expected to accept it...not even the courtesy of an advance warning or apology or explanation.', 'By now I was in bits. Birthday meal ruined. ', 'And still no satisfactory explanation.', 'We ended up walking out and refusing to pay a penny for the few drinks and a starter each.', 'Disappointing service, food and lack of people skills.', "We won't be returning!"]
title: Birthday meal ruined!

content: ["We booked dinner and live music tickets for a Friday Soul Night. Tickets were £39.50 and included a 2 course meal plus a glass of prosecco. We booked our table for 8.15pm and the show started at 9.45pm. I loved the decor and atmosphere and we were given a nice candlelit table near to the front. There are nice views from the window side and you can go downstairs onto the terrace. Food was good and so was the service. But the highlight of the evening was the band - Andy Mitchell and his Big Funk Corporation, an eleven piece band - they were great! They played a really good set with many current songs as well as standards, which was nice. The set lasted 90 minutes and many of us were up and dancing. Do be aware that some of the options on the set dinner menu incur a supplement (e.g. £6 for steak). With desserts, a bottle of wine, a beer and service charge we spent a further £78 which I didn't mind as we were celebrating a special occasion but I wouldn't want to do that every time. Apparently you can also book tickets just for the show and a cocktail at £19.50 each. Would certainly go again. We thoroughly enjoyed the evening. ", ' ']
title: Great night out

content: ["It pains me to say this will be the last time we visit Boisdale. We've been going to boisdale twice a year for the last six years (summer and Christmas) in the last 18mtns we've seen a significant decline in food, entertainment, beverages and overall standards. We went to see ELVIS on the 5th August which being a massive Elvis fan I was really looking forward to. (Drinks) For a beer drinker like me you usually have at least one run of the mill beers (fosters ,carling,heiniekn) no, only two beers which I've never heard of. (Starters) We used to have a varied choice of starters and if you didn't like what was on offer there was always the good old prawn cocktail which was absolutely superb. (Main course) A fair choice but nothing like it used to be. The menus come on a piece of card, yet in the last five or so years it would have been a leather bound founder with a wider choice of food. The food they do serve is nice and hot and the service is excellent and I wouldn't criticise this at all. (Deserts) Standard deserts but excellent just what we want. (Show) We have seen earth wind and fire, Elvis, rat pack and have always walked away feeling we have been entertained and had a superb night of dining and dancing. (Toilets) Years ago it was always good quality hand wash and paper towels, now we have pound shop hand wash and you rub your hands under the dyson. A clear sign to me it's all about the profits. (Show) As a big elvis fan I thought he was a good singer but the actual show was poor. In the past five years all shows finished between 2345-midnight this night it was 2310, a long time to sit and wait for our cab. (Overall) We have always had a great night at boisdale, it's not a cheap place to go and it can also be a real expensive place if you've had to many beers. We always have the same table close to the stage (table for four at the top of the stairs) which we pay £140 for which on top of the £395 bill is a fair old bill for a night out. At the end of the day you know when the time has come to quit and move on. Thank you BOISDALE for some great nights but goodbye."]
title: Time to leave boisdale

answer_text: ['Hi porkynagger, ', 'I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed the atmosphere and music at your recent Sunday lunch with us. ', 'I have spoken to the chef about your comments on the seasoning of the sides and this is something that we both are monitoring closely. I am confident that should you join us again this is not an issue you will face again. ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ["Atmosphere, music and drinks were great. We were a party of six for Sunday lunch. The menu only had one item marked as vegetarian although there were a couple of other options. Everyone enjoyed their starters, although mine was tepid. All the vegetables served with the main meal were very salty. We asked for some carrots that were not as salty and we were given spinach, but that wasn't much better. Even the roast potatoes had too much salt. Desserts were ok."]
title: Food left a bit to be desired

answer_text: ['Hi Stuart O, ', 'Good food, music and service pretty much sums up what we work hard each day to achieve. Thank you for recognising this and posting your findings!', 'We look forward to seeing you soon, ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ['Great place for dinner and a bit of Jazz. Very good service and good food right in the middle od Canary wharf.']
title: Dinner

answer_text: ['Hi jmrich29,', 'This was a lovely review to receive and thank you for taking the time to provide your short and very sweet feedback! ', 'Looking forward to seeing you again soon, ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ['Love this place, steak always amazing, atmosphere buzzing and the staff are really friendly, will return again']
title: Great food and service and atmosphere!

answer_text: ['Hi 127anthony01,', 'It was an absolute delight to read your recent review of your Sunday lunch celebrations with us! I am so glad that we were able to make this a special and memorable experience, we work very hard to try and do just that for all of our guests. ', 'I have passed your kind words on to Siobhan who was more than happy to help and is on hand should you have any other special occasions needing organised! ', 'Hopefully we will see you in the near future,', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ['It is always a wonderful feeling to share an amazing experience with family and friends on special occasions.', 'Needless, to say these gathering are never easy to organised – However, with the help of Boisdale – Events Manager Siobhan Brewer we were able to planed a wonderful memorable Sunday luncheon accommodating 17 guests in order to celebrate a family member 50th Birthday. ', 'The private room which we hired overlooking the square in Canary Wharf was spacious with a view of the live Jazz band performing in the main restaurant. The music permeated the room adding to the wonderful setting – The menu was accommodating – The Salmon, Chicken which comprises the Main Course was a generous portion, it was absolutely delicious with the house wine complementing the excellent three course meal. The staff were magnificent. All the diners were made to feel special with their dietary requirements catered for. All this led to a wonderful 50th birthday celebration - one which those who attended will never forget for many years.']
title: Let Us Celebrate

answer_text: ['Hi igloolondon, ', 'Thank you for your review of your recent visit with us. ', 'I am sorry to hear that there was a slight delay with you being seated due to the fact that you had come upstairs from the 1st floor into the main restaurant, our reception is at the other end of the restaurant at the entrance by the lifts so this is where the confusion was. If no one was available to seat you then you should, of course, have been pointed in the direction of the reception by a member of our floor team. This is something I have briefed everyone on and not something that is usually an issue for us. ', 'The lemon mayo should have been served with your Langoustines - again, please rest assured that this is something that has already been addressed and is no longer something that is served separately in case anyone else faces the slight delay you had. ', 'The chips for your main courses came on a separate tray from the kitchen and followed directly behind your main meal, which I served and it was myself you spoke to. ', 'I am glad you enjoyed the food and music,', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ['We book a table for my daughters birthday 8/6/17. ', 'We arrived early so went to the bar for a drink. Once the rest of our party arrived we went to the restaurant to be seated. I should have known the evening was not going to go well when we were completely ignored by every member of staff and no one wanted to seat us. I had to grab a member of staff and inset that we were seated. No apology at all.', 'We let this go as we all wanted to have a good time as we were celebrating.', "The waiter came and took our order. So far so good. The starters came (sort of!) The majority of the group order langoustine and lemon mayo. The langoustine arrive on a bed of ice and that were it stopped. No plates no mayo no finger bowls. We waited for about 5 minutes nothing. I asked the waiter, he said someone else was bringing the plates and mayo. By 10 minutes I was betting a bit upset. I had to ask again before the plates and the rest of the order came. We finished the staters and waited for the main course. What could go wrong this time? you guessed it................not all of the food turned up. Again we waited again I had to ask. I was told its coming. Shouldn't the whole order come together!!!! still two guest did not have their whole meal. Chased again and was told the kitchen is very busy it will come. By this time the foods going cold so I ask for the manager. A waitress arrives with the 2 missing sides and I ask for the manager again. Im the manager she tells me. I explain the situation and that it is not acceptable. Her attitude was not the best. Leaving me with the feeling that she was angry with me for complaining and not with the terrible service her staff have given us. Begrudgingly she say I will look at the bill and see if I can do something for you after your meal. The waiter comes back to take the desert order and guess what ?????? again we didn't get the whole order. We only ordered 3 deserts and 3 coffees and a coffee was missing. The bill come and the waiter presents it say that they had reduced the bill by 20 % and taken off the service charge.", 'All in all the food was very good the music was very good the service was absolutely horrible. Boisdale please take note if you want repeat customers please treat them better.', 'Would I come here again? maybe for the music']
title: Disappointed

answer_text: ['Hello zigtravel, ', 'Thank you for taking the time to provide us with feedback of your recent visit. Feedback is a really important tool for us to measure where we are and how we can evolve as a business and improve. ', ' I am saddened to hear that you did not enjoy our steak. It is our most popular item on the menu and we rarely receive negative feedback. I have shared your comments with our chef and we will both be keeping a close eye on the cooking of our steaks moving forward. ', "To hear the service described as 'stunning' gives me great pride and is a comment that really made the team smile. We all work very hard at providing a 1st class service and to know that we are doing well makes it all worthwhile. ", 'Hopefully we will see you soon for some Haggis and a wee dram! ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ["For such a supposed high class establishment in such a moneyed area of London the steak was overcooked. I knew I should have stuck to gauchos for steak. If you come here stick to what Scotland does well. Argentina does steak, no-one else does. Have the haggis as a main not as a starter as I did. Avoid the steak. If you like whiskey you're in for a treat. The service was stunning and made us forgive the steak. The steak was rescued by the delicious accompaniments of sweet potato chips and the stunning sauces which rescued the night, bar of course the great conversation I had with my friend at a place with superb views over the area and great atmosphere. "]
title: Avoid the Steak but amazing haggis

answer_text: ['Hello michelle s,', 'I am delighted to hear that you have been able to come and enjoy our Jamaica Garden Terrace as well as all of our tasty Jamaican offerings to accompany the beautiful surroundings. ', 'Thank you for your review and we are looking forward to welcoming you back soon, ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ["Love boisdale nice cocktails great night with friends have a great selection of cocktail sometimes do themed evenings we went for the Jamaica themed night well it's on for the month of July the rum punch was very nice so was the BBQ. They had jerk pork and chicken on the terrace we just had a good drink and and bite to eat on terrace but you can also go upstairs to the restaurant would certainly be returning"]
title: Great night

answer_text: ['Hello charlotte4112017,', 'Although I am disappointed to read a number of the points you have raised in this review I would like to thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback. It is an important tool that we use constructively to ensure we are moving forward in the right direction. ', 'Apart from wanting to delve a little deeper into the concerning points raised I would be grateful if we could speak as there are also some details that I am confused by - we have not had steak tartar on the menu for over 3 months.', 'Please contact me directly on gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk so that I can have the opportunity to deal with this personally and better understand how we fell short on this occasion. ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ["We went to Boisdale Canary Wharf for the first time for my daughters 22nd birthday. I paid £60 in advance to reserve a table in the premier area close to the band. I booked the table at 8.15 because the band came on at 9.15 and, my thinking was, that we would be approaching desserts then, and be in the mood for some live jazz. The service was terrible, We waited and we waited and, eventually, we were served. The drinks that eventually came (cocktails) were all wrong. The starters finally arrived at around 9pm and, before our main meal had arrived, the band came on and it was far too loud to have our dinner at the same time. Even though I had paid £60 for this spot we asked to be moved to another table in the main part of the restaurant so we could talk while we ate our main meal. My steak tartar was, to be honest, awful. The rest of the food was average. Due to the slow service, I had asked for red wine to accompany the main meal well in advance but it never arrived. More cocktails were ordered but they were wrong again. The bill was over £300 (plus £60 for the premier table) making the total bill for our evening frantically over £400. An expensive night for a less than average evening - I would not go back and I certainly wouldn't recommend this venue."]
title: A real disappointment

answer_text: ['Hi Oliver, ', 'You have made some deeply concerning points in this review that I am sorry to hear as your opinion. Of course, all opinions are subjective and it seems that this is very much the case with this review. ', "We have some fantastic feedback on our food offering here. As well as diversity and flexibility when it comes to prix fix menu's and larger parties. ", 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ['This is a typical corporate hang out in Canary Wharf.', 'Nobody, including ourselves, comes here for the food. Unfortunately, that shows. This is fast food at a higher level. Pre-selected menus are engineered to cater for the lowest common denominator. The preparation of the food is industrialised and again engineered to maximise profitability. Everything is just about edible.', 'One of our guests summed it up well "...that steak was awful...".', 'But I guess, food and venue play less of a role when you decide to come here. Most likely you will be part of some form of corporate event and as the restaurant is organising these rather effectively.']
title: Business as usual

answer_text: ['Hi Dauban M,', 'I am sorry to hear that you were unable to enjoy our live music when you joined us recently. We have no music on a Monday, Tues-Sat in the evening and on a Sunday afternoon. ', 'Generally we have a great atmosphere in the restaurant so it is a shame that you were unable to see this. I fed back your comments on the food to our chef and I will keep a close eye on the Salmon dish moving forward. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed our service. ', 'Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback, ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ['Live music but not during this visit. Very large place, but almost all tables empty. Food is nothing special, overcooked salmon. Service is good']
title: Empty restaurant

content: ["Although I work at Canary Wharf I have never eaten here until this month. Note we ate in the lower area and not the upstairs restaurant. The service was perfect - a very charming young Spanish guy. However, the food was really pretty poor. Maybe we should have known better than to order the tapas - it's just a selection of ready made items, or deep fried items. Nice decor although getting a bit worn in parts. Would be happy to try the main restaurant upstairs however."]
title: Tapas...mmmm....lots of deep fried stuff

content: ['Taken to Boisdale by business colleagues last night and enjoyed a fabulous meal - superb mini haggis with obligatory Glenfiddich for starters, and a succulent rib eye for mains, all washed down with a quaffable Malbec from Argentina. A great experience - highly recommended.']
title: Wonderful Dining Experience

content: ['Great atmosphere with Friendly staff who are all well trained. The live group Payback were sensational and it was pleasing they did not stop for a break after 30mins but played on continuously until about 11.15pm lots of dancing and party atmosphere something you always can expect Boisdale to deliver.']
title: Great party venue

content: ['I have just returned from a night at Boisdale Canary Wharf and usually do not revue restaurants, but tonight was very poor, so I feel I need to warn others.', 'I booked a dinner and show to see Kerry Ellis and phoned to confirm my booking of a few weeks ago. Strangely they could not find my booking, I gave the the confirmation number but after a few minutes they said they could not find the booking and would phone back. They phoned back and said they had found it and all was OK, although I could only have 8.15 or 7.45. I explained that my booking had been confirmed for 8pm many weeks ago, but they said thats the only table they had available. ', 'I had booked a standard seating table with 2 course meal for £50, when I arrived i was shown to a table that had no view of Kerry Ellis, which was in a "restricted view area". I went back to the reception area and complained and they said they would inform the manager. Needless to say the manager did not show up and I had a good meal listening to a good sound coming for a structural pillar. ', "I thin it is obvious they had lost the booking and tried to assume i would accept a v. poor viewing area. It is a shame they didn't own up when i phoned to confirm, as I would have cancelled if they didn't have a seat where you could see the artist.", 'I like the Boisdale ethos, but today they dropped the ball and did not even have the courtesy to come and talk to e about it. Shame in you Boisdale.']
title: Complete fail

content: ["Boisdale has been in the wharf a longtime but it isn't one of my go to places. I think it could be because it is tucked away at the far end of the shopping mall and you have to use elevators to get to it and they are a bit tucked away. The place itself is a bit tired and dated now and probably could do with a refurb but it's an okay average sort of place! We had finger food at a drinks party this week and it was really pedestrian and all tasted and looked over fried. Definitely put me off eating in the restaurant. "]
title: Canary Wharf stalwart

content: ['Food was outstanding, service attentive, cocktails superb and loved the entertainment. We went on "Swing night". Loved every second']
title: Wonderful night out

content: ["Went here for a drink at the bar, waited 25 minutes, I asked to be served and NOTHING! Not sure if it's a staffing issue or if they only prioritise their service to eating customers only. ", "Just don't bother."]
title: Not worth the visit

content: ["Great location and lovely views of the fountain, but the food was dreadful. The chicken breast was rubbery - I initially worried that it was under cooked, but it wasn't pink so all I can assume is that it was cooked ahead of time and warmed up. The burger was OK, but for >£20 I expected much better. Overall; I'd recommend avoiding the restaurant if they can't even cook chicken and a burger well."]
title: Nice location, bad food

content: ['Boisdale is a terrifically stocked bar in Canary Wharf, catering for the downtrodden sins and daughters of toil who lurk there. High grade booze, great bar food and an on-site cigar outlet of which two (female) friends availed themselves. Great evening. Bring money. ']
title: Bankers …

answer_text: ['hi 53lesley2016,', 'This is exactly the kind of review that puts a huge smile on the faces of all of our team!', 'I am so glad that we were able to make your trip to London memorable and we cant wait to host you next time. ', 'Thank you for your kind words,', 'Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ["Wow.. wow..wow what can I say. We took our daughter and son in law for Sunday lunch and it was amazing. The food was fabulous.. we had a 3 course lunch.... the staff were so attentive and there was a wonderful jazz band playing. We can't recommend this enough. Would go every time we visit London..."]
title: Sunday lunch

content: ['By far my favourite place to relax in London. Great staff all round and you will never be disappointed. If you like a drop of whisky or a nice cigar, speak with Filipe. His knowledge and customer service skills are exceptional. Would highly recommend.']
title: Best Place to relax

content: ["I dined here several times with my husband. Steaks are extremely tender, melt in the mouth sort of taste, like no other I have tasted. We dined here on 50% of meals deals sent to me via an email. Otherwise it is a rather expensive restaurant. We have also dined at their Bishopsgate branch, serving equally quality steaks. The sides are rather small and not quite enough. At £4.95 per side is rather a lot for approx. 10 pieces of chunky chips, but nevertheless tasty and well cooked. We ordered mushrooms and broccoli and chips on the side which all come as separate items all at £4.95 a portion, which are all very small but beautifully cooked and served hot and perfect for consumption immediately. Would go again and again as a treat on special occasions and also when sent emails with promotions. They always send me special offers and dates of special quests attending the restaurant and special occasions of Jazz Events. If you stay to dine after 9.30 in the evening you have to purchase a live music ticket or vacate your table. We don't stay for the live music so I can't comment on this. I would definitely recommend this place for quality steak lovers and for celebrating special occasions. Scottish theme throughout, owned by a Scottsman. Menu also Scottish themed. Not suitable/ designed for children, young children anyway, we have yet to see any children there each time we have been there its more catered for Canary Wharf office staff and the older/more mature generation with city pay packets. Drinks are also very expensive, a very extensive wine selection. Soft drinks are also very expensive. They do offer tap water to guests and sliced up sour bread with butter on sitting at the table, which are served fresh and are rather mooorish. We ordered salt and pepper calamari for starters which were £9 for approx. 8 pieces. The steaks were on average £35 with sides extra. All in all a rather expensive evening but well worth it. If you want quality steak, this is the place to visit. Give it a go and enjoy. They also add 12.5% or so tips. If you order the 42 day mature steak you will not regret it. They also do the steak to share for around £70 but again its matured for 42 days and it melts in your mouth. Delish, enjoy."]
title: SIMPLY AWESOME, TENDER, SUCCULENT STEAK

content: ['We dined and watched suspiciously Elvis on a Saturday night. The setting is like going back in time, old fashioned dinner dance. Elvis was 5 stars, the food was traditional British Fayre and not over priced at all. The only negative was the service which lacked attentiveness and follow up (a bit functional). I would definitely do it again and Elvis is a must! ']
title: Great food and entertainment
