Not too pricey this time, thats saved for the sides, but I've had nicer meals in a gastro pub for 25% of the price.", 'None of us will be rushing to go back, which is a shame as we have just moved offices to Canary Wharf.', 'We had a late lunch booking and expected to relax over a couple of glasses of wine, but the bar closed at 3:45pm and they started re-arranging the tables around us. Not very relaxing!!']
title: Average service, average food and eye watering bill!!!

answer_text: ['Hi Shanni C,', 'Although there are some issues in your review that I will need to address with the Chef I was delighted to hear that you could not fault the service.', 'All feedback we receive is taken constructively, so thank you for taking the time to let us know of the difficulties you experienced with the food.', 'I do hope that these issues will not prevent you coming back to join us in the future as I am confident that you will have nothing but praise for the food next time round!', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ['Canary wharf - great view. Xmas Party. ', "Guess I expected a bit too much. My soup was great really creamy and flavoursome. My turkey - it's looked okay in terms of presentation. Nothing too fancy... it was also dry, very dry. I found it hard to swallow at time and the cranberry sauce came whilst we were half way through the meal - too late to even really try it out. Having said that I dont feel they could have redeemed that turkey. The dessert was nice... really chocolatey... so much so in fact it was a little bitter... not really to my taste personally but it went down well with my friends. I felt that it would have probably done nicely with some ice-cream or something. Can't fault the service thought the staff were brilliant. "]
title: It was okay

answer_text: ['Hi John_Dareth_Evans,', 'I was sincerely saddened to read your review of your recent visit. ', 'Needless to say I would like to get a bit more detail from you as you have raised some issues that need to be addressed. you can reach me on gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk,', 'I hope to hear from you soon,', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ["Works Christmas Do -- Food was cold and inedible. Barman was so slwo I could have made the beer myself in the time it took to get my order in.... Men's toilets were filthy and even when I told the manager, he didn't seem to care. Service was rubbish.... What the hell are people paying for???"]
title: Xmas Dinner

answer_text: ['Hello JASPA333, ', 'I was sorry to read your recent review and discover that the food fell short of your expectations. Please rest assured that I have discussed this in detail with our Head Chef and we are seriously looking at what went wrong here and how we can improve moving forward. ', 'Above this I will also be paying close attention to service and the wait time for drinks coming from the bar as obviously these were other areas of concern on your visit. ', 'All in all you did not experience our usual level of standards, which is a real shame. I do hope you will return in the future as I am confident that we will be able to deliver on these. ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ["Went here with family for Sunday lunch ant to be fair the starters mushroom soup and the smoked salmon were very good but that's where it ended!", "4 of us had roast beef 1 pork and 1 chicken , the beef was tough full of fat and tasteless, the pork pretty much the same but the chicken was good as were the roast potatoes the veg of carrots and kale was bland with the kale tasting watery the desert was very average as well and for £37.50 a head we was expecting something special and it wasn't!", 'Service was average and drinks were very slow coming', 'The venue is very nice inside a bit like a New York steakhouse and the jazz music in background was nice.', 'Overall not a good day!']
title: Avoid Sunday lunch

answer_text: ['Hi GiaKoutra,', 'What a wonderful review! Thank you for your short and very sweet feedback. ', 'We look forward to seeing you again soon,', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ['We had a fantastic night at boisdale. Awesome jazz band playing live, exquisit malt wiskey from the jawdropping old bar, great art and oyster bar on the terrace. ']
title: Fun!

answer_text: ['Hi KiwiFlyng,', 'Thank you for your feedback.', "There is always more food, drinks and music to sample so don't wait too long before you visit us again! ", 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ['Good noisy Scottish restaurant with band and soul singer. Wide selection of meats, fish and salads together with wines and of course whiskey.']
title: Scots Food & Entertainment

answer_text: ['Hello slimbeau,', 'Thank you so much for the review of your recent visit. Feedback is very important for us to keep our finger on the pulse and ensure we do not become complacent. ', 'You definitely must make sure you spare some time for our fantastic Cigar Library the next time - it really is something special! Edita or Filipe, our cigar experts, will be on hand to offer any advice should you need it.', 'We look forward to seeing you then,', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ["Hubby and I went there on a Saturday evening. We booked premium package . Show started at 9.45pm. The band was awesome, it was an American lady. Songs were mellow, then upbeat and then mellow. We ate and enjoyed the show at the same time. The food was very good . Unfortunately hubby didn't have time to have a cigar. That will be for our next visit. Most of the crowd were couples, late 30's and above. Loved it, loved it. "]
title: Fabulous, can't wait for next time.

answer_text: ['Hello Anush B,', 'I cannot say I am surprised to read such a wonderful review of Filipe. He is a huge asset to the business and his customer service is second to none - I will take great pleasure in sharing your feedback with him. ', "Don't wait too long before your next visit! ", 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ['Filipe at cigar library makes my visit worth while every time. He is not only extremely knowledgable in cigars and very welcoming but also very attentive to individual needs of his guests. Always a pleasure to unwind in peace after work. Highly recommend if you are into cigars. ']
title: Amazing service at the cigar library by Filipe!

answer_text: ['Hi TraxTrax,', 'Feedback of any kind is important for us to move forward positively. Thank you for taking the time to offer this. ', 'It is a shame to hear that you feel our terrace to be nondescript. We spent a lot of time sourcing some beautiful trees/plants to try and make it feel like a tranquil garden in such a bustling city. ', "Hopefully you will give us another go and enjoy one of the various offers we have on at the moment, including two for one cocktails on the second floor bar which boasts one of Europe's best Whisky collections. ", 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ["Ok first thing I didn't eat here", "So I'm only commenting it as a bar", "Now if you are a smoker it's ok - sort of nondescript outside seating area - nothing special", "The actual bar is ok but the room is an awkward shape around the bars so don't really feel it works on either floor", ' ', 'There are better bars in the area imo']
title: Might be a good restaurant but bar doesn't really work

answer_text: ['Hi smk101,', "In a word it doesn't get much better than 'Exceptional' - thank you for your review. Although, you have raised a point about the music that you can rest assured I will look into. It is very unusual for any of our musicians to seem like their heart is not in it. It is usually quite the opposite!", 'That aside, to hear that both the food and service you experienced were excellent is fantastic. Tim does a great job and I will make sure he is aware of your kind words. It makes all of our hard work worthwhile! ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ['Beautiful décor ...Jazz a little subdued but it was a Sunday lots of gaps between tunes seemed rather like a practice than a polished set ..bit so a bit lazy..I came esp. for the Jazz so although the band were fantastic players and the singer a great crooner I felt their heart was not in the Sunday session. Food was amazing ....the best roast potatoes ever and the beef fantastic. The best part of our visit though and the reason we will return was the excellent service. Tim you were so attentive and friendly...you worked that room like the true professional you obviously are . You are a credit to the restaurant Thank you ...']
title: Exeptional

answer_text: ['Hi Michelle F,', 'Thank you for giving us feedback of your recent visit. I have taken on board what you have said about the service being unwelcoming, this is not feedback we receive regularly and the welcome/departure of guests is something I will be paying close attention to in the coming weeks. ', 'I do hope to see you soon so that you can enjoy a more all-rounded experience.', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ['Went to boisdale for oysters and wine with the intentions of staying for a meal. Service was poor not very welcoming and when we left just got stared at with no thank you or goodbyes. Oysters were good despite service.']
title: Oysters and ok service

answer_text: ['Hello tony h,', 'Thank you for taking the time to give us the feedback of your recent visit. Elvis is always extremely well received so I am glad to hear that you enjoyed. ', 'I am disappointed to hear you feedback on the food and service. Please rest assured that I am looking into the areas you have mentioned and am confident we can use your comments constructively to ensure we do not fall short moving forward.', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny ']
content: ['we attended on saturday 12th november for a 60th birthday, we had the private room just to the left of the stage. Elvis performed that night and he was truly brilliant. The food we ordered was served luke warm and some of the salmon not cooked correctly. We only had 1 poor girl who was trying to serve us all with drinks etc and she was very very good but desperately needed some help{there was 28 in our party} Hard to score boisdle as we had a great evening of entertainment which i would score 9 out of 10. The food and price of the drinks would only score around 3 out of 10. Overall you;ll have a god evening if the entertainment is good but certainly do not expect a nice meal.']
title: great venue ..average food

answer_text: ['Hi Kenny p,', 'I was sorry to hear that you did not have a fun evening when you recently joined us. We do try and be as flexible as possible with the menu however business levels can dictate this somewhat at times. ', 'You are correct on the house wine, we did have a supplier issue which has subsequently been rectified and is not something that happens frequently. ', 'It is a shame that both of these points impacted your evening. Thank you for providing your feedback and should you wish to join us in the future I am confident that you will have a more positive experience. ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ['We had a sales gathering dinner here on Thursday night and Boisdale is quite an impressive restaurant which looks like it could be great fun - except it just wasn\'t. Problem 1 and one of the team sismply just didnt like the menu and asked for a simple green salad with simply grilled chicken and all these ingredients were on the menu in other dishes. No! our chef is like Gordon Ramsey, I can\'t ask him for anything non standard????. Gordon Ramsey this place ain\'t. Then they run out of their own house red wine? Pretentious and precious and food was good but not anything other than \'nice". ']
title: Big place with potential but precious

answer_text: ['Hello Jaine D,', 'Thank you for taking the time to give us feedback of your recent visit. I am concerned about many of the points you have raised. What you seem to have experienced falls extremely short of the mark with regards to both the quality and standards that we pride ourselves on. ', 'If you would like to contact me at gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk I would like the opportunity to discuss this with you in more detail. ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ['I was disappointed from the minute I got there . I had emailed to ask for a nice table as it was our first time there . The email was never acknowledged . When we got there we was sat at a table along a curved window looking out at building works . The stage was blocked out by a big pillar . As it was a jazz lunch that was booked you would of thought that you would of been by the stage to actually see or even hear the music . What then was not meant to of been just a Sunday lunch out then became one , which is not why we travelled all the way to London for . ', 'We opted for the dearest choice on the menu , which was a three course , 1/3 bottle of wine and a glass of prosecco @ £47.50 a head .', "We waited ages for the prosecco , and soon realised that the 1/3 of a bottle of wine wasn't given to you , in a carafe , say , but you had to keep waiting for a drink throughout your meal as they came round and gave you a small glass of wine here and there . I'm not sure we drank a bottle and a half between us and surely this is a trading standard issue as you are sold one thing and that's not actually what you get . In fact also a licensing issue as you then are not aware of what you have actually had , which is then a breach of weights and measures . Quite Cleary an issue that needs resolving .Anyway moving on , the food ! My partner had a prawn cocktail that was served in a martini glass , lots of lettuce with a very skimpy amount of prawns on top , I had the haggis which was fine .", 'He then had pork which he said was nice and the beef I had was also nice , a yorkshire,luke warm roast potatoes and the veg , really boisdales ? Who do you have in your kitchens , a very small dish of wafer thin sliced carrots and a spoonful each of kale and that was the roast .', "Desserts then even became more laughable , my partner ordered the baked elderflower cream with strawberry and then was told they didn't have it . We was in at the first sitting and it wasn't busy so not sure why they didn't have it . He then asked if they had sorbet which wasn't on the menu , they said yes and went to check flavours , he was told the flavours and chose the lemon . They then can back and said the chef was crazy and no they didn't have the lemon they told him they had so he chose strawberry . They then came out with two strawberry and another scoop of something else mixed ! Then had to take it back and bring one strawberry only ! Phew ! What a palaver ! I ordered the cheese board , I got a few cheeses and on another board the crackers , with ....", 'Sliced pear and a dish of honey ?? ', 'I asked if this was a poor mans quince ? Laughable really ! ', 'Would I go back ...... No ', 'I could of gone up the road from my house to a nice gastro pub and actually had a nice roast dinner . ', 'Very poor food and awful experience .']
title: Waste of money

answer_text: ['Hello mgdfit,', 'Thank you for providing me with feedback of your recent visit. You have raised some points here that I would like you to rest assured I have dealt with - particularly when it comes to the service side of things. ', 'I do hope that you will visit again as I am confident that the negatives you mentioned have been addressed and rectified, it would be nice for you to see this. ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ["Nice decor, good choice of wines. Okay service, the waitress was a bit hyper and I didn't like that she didn't listen to me and instead proceeded to advise my boyfriend on wines I didn't want and obviously we wouldn't get. Nicely cooked steak but sweet potatoe chips and spinach were born tasteless. Tasty gluten free bread, but my boyfriend got his bread served with no butter and the butter arrived for both of us later with my gluten free bread. Nice place but overpriced for what it is and staff needs better training."]
title: Okay, not as good as experience

answer_text: ['Hello Peter H,', 'It was with great pleasure that I read your recent feedback - thank you! ', "The chef was over the moon with your comments about the dishes you enjoyed. Don't wait too long until you pay us another visit!", 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ["This was our first visit and it didn't disappoint. Haggis to start was full of flavour. The burger to follow was succulent and nicely garnished. The mushroom side was one of the best I've had for a long time. And the Scottish rarebit was excellent value. Service good. Went there before the live music - worth it for the food. "]
title: Surprisingly good food

answer_text: ['Good evening B D,', 'I was disappointed to read your recent review however feedback is very important as it allows us to recognize our short comings and rectify any negatives. ', 'These are certainly not our usual Boisdale standards that you experienced. ', 'With this in mind please contact me on gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk so I can discuss this in more depth with you. ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ['Whilst the food was good the service was lukewarm and the atmosphere was also cold. ', "The icing on the cake was when the waiter brought us the bill when we hadn't called for it, to suggest that we might like to finish at the table! Then about a dozen staff came out of the kitchen carrying their own meals and went and sat down in the reception area to eat!! Basically they give you the impression that you are an inconvenience to their afternoon. "]
title: Business Lunch

answer_text: ['Hi Nicky,', 'To hear that we proved to be a suitable date night destination is fantastic (I know how important these nights are). Thank you for letting us know about your experience. ', "Don's wait too long before your next date night - we will be waiting! ", 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ["This was a great find. My husband and I were out for date nite and wasn't sure where we wanted to go. With the help of trip advisor we stumbled upon this amazing restaurant. The lovely lady that greeted us on arrival explained that there would be a £5pp cover charge as the evening entertainment had only just started. Our table was great overlooking the fountain outside. The restaurant staff were great taking our order and making good recommendations to us. All the food served was stunning. This is s great place for romantic dinners and good ambiance, it is a pricey place but worth it. "]
title: Date nite

answer_text: ['Hi Riki747,', 'I am glad to hear that you took advantage of our recent Lobster offer and enjoyed to kick start your weekend. ', 'I am sorry to hear you felt the service dropped off towards the end of your visit, this is not something that you have to worry about upon your return. ', 'We look forward to seeing you again soon,', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ["I was passing through Canary Wharf shopping centre and was given a leaflet for a Whole Lobster 1LB for £20 so thought why not, it is Friday so that's fish night anyway....", 'Made my way to the restaurant and as it was only 6pm there was no problem getting a table and as a consequence service was quick and efficient.', "The lobster tuned up after a short wait -it was enjoyable and washed down with some suitable wine by which time the place had started to fill up and the service was slow after that. Not sure if they are short staffed? That's not to say it was bad, just noticeably slower than when I arrived....", 'All in all an enjoyable meal, I would return, maybe at the earlier time just in case the service suffers later on as I had experienced.']
title: Friday night lobster treat

answer_text: ['Good evening Tasha, ', "Wow! We couldn't really ask for a better review than that, 5*s. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience.", 'We have lots of fantastic musicians coming up over the course of the next few months, you should join us again if any of them are up your street. ', 'Kind regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ["I had an absolutely amazing time! Let's start with the great live music (Bob Marley tribute band) the band has me rocking all night.", 'Food was scrumptious! I enjoyed a lovely fresh seafood platter with mussels, shrimp and oysters.', 'Followed by a mouth watering Scottish salmon.', 'I then could not resist going to the cigar library to enjoy a Cuban cigar to close the night.']
title: Amazing night! 5*

answer_text: ['Hello joanie_x,', 'I would have to agree, the set menu we have is fantastic value and I am glad that you decided to take advantage of it.', 'Please accept my sincere apologies for the confusion with regards to the dishes that were/were not available - I will ensure that this is something we pay extra attention to in future. I am glad that it did not impact your night too negatively. ', 'Kind regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ["great value set menu for dinner. on the day we visited, the soup and one of the mains on the set menu were not available. They didn't tell us that the soup we ordered was unavailable until after an alternative was served and consumed but it was probably just a slight oversight. otherwise, service was good. "]
title: great value set menu

answer_text: ['Hello Wim V, ', 'Thank you for your recent review. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed the flavours of the food and sorry to hear that you felt the price point unjustified. We do source all of our produce from high quality suppliers.', 'I hope we have the opportunity to welcome you back again soon to enjoy both the atmosphere and music again! ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ["I had the iron flat steak with broccoli and an ice Cream as dessert. The food was really tastefull but not mutch! It was rather expensive (+-50£) for what you'll get. The atmosphere was fantastic though with live music and candle light. "]
title: Nice but expensive

answer_text: ['Good evening Stylin2308,', 'Needless to say you have raised some seriously concerning points in your review that I would be extremely keen to discuss with you in more detail. ', 'Please contact me directly on gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk and I can give you my number so I can better understand what went wrong here. Obviously, from your previous reviews, you did not experience what our usual standards of both quality and service are. ', 'I hope to hear from you soon,', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ["As you will see from previous reviews, I have been to Boisdale on a number of occasions (for business and pleasure)! It used to be my favourite restaurant in London! sadly today, for my wife's birthday- it was below par!! ", 'My waitress was far to busy focusing on a High roller table to worry about the plebs at my table!!', 'Food was below average, the menu had changed & no more cheese trolley!!']
title: Seriously underwhelming

content: ["I come to this place simply so i can smoke outside in the cigar area with my dear friends. It's warm with heaters and Philippe will give you blankets and he is always attentive to his customers. He knows his cigars! The food has always been good. Only downside if you are drinking at the bar the service is a little slow for my liking. Table service is much better. To top it off you get to listen to some great music and it sets the mood of a classy ambience. I will keep going back."]
title: Cigar heaven.... Jazz heaven

answer_text: ['Hello Tim R,', 'Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback - we really do value this information. ', 'I am sorry to hear that your dining experience did not live up to expectation. Please rest assured I have discussed the points you have raised with our chef and will keep a close eye on our seasoning moving forward. ', 'Should you wish to give us another go I am confident that we will be able to showcase our usual standard of quality. ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ["Went on a Friday eve, in the bar/grill. Ordered from set menu, Gravalax, Fillet steak. The steak arrived cooked ok but over seasoned m, so much salt and pepper couldn't taste meat. Sent back next one came , but a little dry."]
title: Overpriced - mediochre

answer_text: ['Hello KMgibbs,', 'I am glad to hear that you managed to take advantage of one of our offers, it is a real shame to hear that you joined us on an evening where the levels of business had a negative impact on the atmosphere as when we are busy there is a fantastic buzz both upstairs in the restaurant and downstairs in the bar area.', 'I have shared your feedback re; food with the chef and I will ensure that we monitor the cooking of the chips going forward. ', 'I would love for you to give us a chance as a leisure destination as well as business as we showcase some magnificent musicians upstairs in the restaurant. You can find out who is playing on our website. If there is an act that you fancy and we have availability I would be happy to book this for you. ', 'gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk is where you can reach me, should you wish to take me up on this.', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ['I visited on an early evening for a short business meeting. I had booked via a table booking app and therefore got a meal deal at £17.95 per head, including a glass of fizz. This was a great price and looked a good deal.', "The negatives were really down to it being really quite. It is a barn of a place with tables on two floors. We went to the wrong one and then had to insist they checked when referred back to where we had just came from. The lack of dinners, meant that the atmosphere was a bit thin. The last thing that I think was poor, was that my chips weren't cooked! How can you mess that up! ", 'The positives were the staff, who were friendly and attentive. The starters were excellent. I had Haggis, beautiful. Finally, the steaks were small but of very high quality. They cook to English standards, so my medium was really well done, but my guest who wanted well done, had it well over in my view but, he was really happy with his, so I guess they cook to that standard. ', 'Overall, it was ok. I will be back for a business stop off but not a leisure venue on a week night. ']
title: I don't like Mondays

answer_text: ['Thank you for taking the time to post a review from your Sunday lunch experience at Boisdale of Canary Wharf. I was very sad to read that the food did not meet your expectations. If possible please can you contact me at your earliest convenience so that I might get a better understanding of where we went wrong. You can reach me either via my email gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk alternatively you can call on 202 7715 5818.', 'I look forward to hearing from you in due course.', 'Kind regards', 'James Hardesty']
content: ["My friend booked the restaurant for her birthday. It was a special offer 3 course sunday roast. The starters were good, the the main was very dissappointing. Half the pork was still pink. The roast pototoes were rock hard and difficult to cut or chew. The dessert was good, but i don't think i will come back."]
title: Birthday Sunday roast

answer_text: ['Hello Robin, ', 'Firstly I would like to thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. Secondly I would like to apologize that obviously our usual standards of service and quality were seriously lacking on your visit. ', 'I would like the opportunity to discuss this with you in more detail, if you would be so kind. ', 'Please drop me an e-mail on gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk', 'I look forward to hearing from you,', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ['Very poor, disappointed , no attention to detail as the restraunt standards are very disappointing , it needs a revamp in the cold light of day, food cold over priced, service was exceptable, but severs have their work cut out as they have little or no support, the senior manager needs to improve his standards ']
title: Robin andrew

answer_text: ['Hi markandandrew,', 'This is a lovely review to read and I am so happy to hear that you enjoyed your evening with us. ', 'To hear that you will be coming is music to my ears and we look forward to welcoming you upon your return! ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ["Travelzoo voucher visit so expensive once you add wine however food despite thee supplements was great. Wine excellent and entertainment fabulous. What a great setting too! We'll be back!"]
title: Great music and great food!

answer_text: ['Hi Zuben, ', 'It is always a real pleasure to get such positive feedback so thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent visit. ', 'Fantastic to hear that we will be seeing you again soon!', 'Until then, take care.', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ['Checked this place out on the weekend ... have to say the food was great but the service really made our night. Big thank you to Mary for helping us out, your suggestions hit the nail on the head! Will be back for sure!']
title: Seafood and Steak!!!! :D

answer_text: ['Good afternoon,', 'It was with great pleasure that I read your review of your recent visit to Boisdale Canary Wharf. Thank you for sharing. ', 'To hear that we ticked all of the boxes from food to service, drinks and atmosphere is absolutely great. We work very hard to provide exactly the experience you described and to hear you would come back again is the icing on the cake. We look forward to seeing you then! ', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ['Thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Oysters were amazingly fresh, delicious haggis with tatties and neeps for starter, for main tender pink grouse with bread sauce, redcurrant jelly, grouse crisps and wild field mushrooms- unbelievable. Wrapped up with a dark chocolate fondant cooked perfectly :) a bottle of two of champagne then into the cigar lounge to enjoy an espresso martini or 3 while the other half enjoyed a cohiba - perfect evening. Staff were great, live music gave a good relaxed atmosphere too. Would go again.']
title: Fantastic restaurant with a relaxed Scottish vibe

answer_text: ['Hello teslart,', 'Thank you for providing your feedback of your recent visit. You have raised some concerning points that I would like the opportunity to discuss with you in more depth. ', 'Please contact me on gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk to do so. ', 'I hope to hear from you soon,', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes']
content: ['Very mixed feelings here - this is very much a chain restaurants that aims pretty high and falls short of its ambitions.', 'The food is definitely tasty but there\'s always something to dampen the enthusiasm - I had a venison carpaccio as a starter: tasted great but was on the small side, and the decoration was downright uninspired - some lettuce leaves and stripes of average parmesan. Mains was the fillet steak - excellent flavours, served as ordered (rare) but rather stringy and definitely on the smaller end of the 10-12oz range at best. Finished with a cheese platter, for which I was not "happily" shown the tray by "dedicated staff" but was rather presented with a rather boring and conservative choice. The fresh pear turned out to be just two super thin slices.', "Service had difficulties getting their act together with food turning up before the wine for both the starter and the cheese (for whom the accompaniments also took a significant time to turn up). Can't blame the staff for this since they are clearly competent but overloaded - never seen waiters just constantly on the verge of actually running through the restaurant to keep up. This also ruins the cosiness of the place. Perhaps things are nicer on a quiet night.", "Overall, the food stands out for flavour of the main component (except the cheese I ended up with), but in every other respect, there is a lot of room for improvement. Worth the money? If you're dead set on staying in the neighbourhood, it's a tough call - in any other case, you can do better."]
title: Good and not so good

answer_text: ['Hello Dionne, ', 'To read feedback like this makes all of the hard work really worthwhile. Thank you for sharing it with us. ', 'Hopefully we will be welcoming you back soon, you should join us for dinner as there is fantastic atmosphere in the restaurant with live music.', 'Kind Regards,', 'Jenny Hughes ']
content: ['Loved the Sunday roast! Food was just lovely, brilliant service and cracking wine list. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a restaurant in Canary Wharf and surrounding areas! ']
title: Brilliant experience

content: ["Went here for lunch with the team, set menu as we with quite a big party but nice options and variety across the courses. The decor isn't my style as it does scream class & old world money all over. At any rate the food was good, the service certainly not as bad as some other reviews suggest yet the bill was probably a bit over what would have been justified by the overall package."]
title: Tres chique Tres Expensive

content: ['I love this place. Its all about great food, music and just enjoying yourself.', 'We went recently for a Motown music evening. The live music was fantastic with the only issue the dance floor being slightly too small. This is one of the best restaurants for steaks. Remember to avoid adding too many extras. Ribeye, fries and mustard or Horseradish is all that is required.', 'There are hundreds of whisky and an excellent wine selection.', 'You can take a break from the music and sit out on one of the balconies with a drink and cigar.', 'Big thanks to James, Glen and all staff for making this a great evening, as usual']
title: Just great

content: ["This place touts itself as a steal restaurant in Canary Wharf and has one steal on the the menu - Flat Iron so I was forced to eat a burger and I don't eat burgers. We asked for thick cut chips/fries and they only arrived after a 3rd request once we were half way through our meal. The 2015 Cab/Merlot we got, advertised as 2013 on the menu, smelled and tasted corked even though it wasn't and the Irish Coffee was luke warm. The service was what you would expect in a busy coffee shop in Oxford street and for this they charged us a poultry £95!!! We would have been better off braving the Jubilee line into the City at 35 degrees! They couldn't have done much worse! Avoid this place like the plague!!!"]
title: What a miserable experience

content: ["Took me a while to decide what to say about Boisdale. I think our problem was that we arrived late on Sunday only about 15 mins before last orders for lunch. However if they take your order they should deliver their best. I ordered the beef and my wife the cod, well the beef was not the greatest, the roast potatoes a bit solid not the best roast. My wife's cod came with mussels which were not on the menu and my wife cannot eat shell fish. They were going to remove them but they were part of the sauce and as that was the last cod she had to settle for the risotto which she did enjoy. The service was good and the staff were friendly and efficient, we may go back again but earlier and book next time."]
title: Sunday lunch

content: ['Sadly took some customers to this recommended restaurant, the service was so poor it it has become a standing joke with my customers, we booked for a table 7.15-7.30 pm actually got food 9.37 pm, and when it actually arrived, it was at best average.', 'I was so embarrassed, we would have gone somewhere else but we where intrigued to find something good about this place, and it was poring down!, but sadly the only good thing was the music.']
title: Over rated, Over Priced, Poor service.

content: ['We had a business lunch here - if you are reserving try and get a window seat as the views are good. Our waitress was very friendly however the service was a bit hit or miss.']
title: Fantastic restaurant space

content: ['Popped in with a friend for some wine and nibbles. The service was very friendly and attentive, wine delicious and tasty food. ', '⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️']
title: Excellent

content: ["Booked this for lunch for my birthday after visiting Sherlock Unlock. The venue is beautiful once you get in but we didn't realise it was inside a kind of precinct where the trains run from so had a bit of trouble finding it. We ate in the restaurant and were served by an excellent waiter called Tim. He was brilliant, very helpful, courteous and pleasant throughout. We all choice a variety of dishes from the menu but didn't opt for the three course fixed price menu. Overall the food was very nice and most people enjoyed it, however, we did have to complain about the chicken as my husband's piece has blood in it and two of my other guests who had the same dish advised their chicken was pink/red so did not want to finish their food. They were all offered alternative meat, as the restaurant had run out of chicken, but two declined as were already full from the remainder of the meal but my husband did order the pork. Everyone who had the pork or fish dishes said their food was lovely but those that ordered the beef said it was tough and a bit grisly. Considering the beef was priced at a premium, this was very disappointing. The desserts, coffee and drinks were all excellent but the issues with the mains was upsetting, especially as this was somewhere I had chosen for my birthday to celebrate with friends. I was also surprised that the manager of the restaurant only came over to us on the first complaint about my husband's chicken. The two, later complaints, received no acknowledgment. I would recommend for the lovely ambience, music and mostly the food was good but I think the restaurant is short staffed as our waiter, although attentive as he could be was clearly serving a number of other tables, as were the other staff, and all struggling to keep on top of the demands of good service."]
title: Sunday Lunch at Boisdale Canary Wharf

content: ['The food here was very nice and well presented. It was my first taste of haggis, and i must say it was nice.', 'The live music was also very good.', "The service of the food was also good, but when it came to drinks, the service was appaling. We got a drink when we first arrived and sat with an empty glass the rest of the night. We couldn't get the attention of anyone, despite putting our hands up like schoolchildren. We gave up and left. We told them when we paid the bill and they waived the service charge"]
title: Good food and music, poor service

content: ["First time at this venue. Like the Belgravia Restaurant very much and been many times so decided to try Sunday Jazz Brunch for my Birthday. Had family party of 11. Good things include the spacious interior but still had atmosphere and the musicians were good. Unfortunately in anybody's book 4 hours for lunch is v. poor service. It took over an hour to make an order. By the time we were finished the jazz trio had long since left the building. The food was OK but the roast did leave the impression it was an end of the day quality. Had an unprovoked apology from our waiter even though we did not complain. Hoped for a similar acknowledgement when the bill came but no such luck! Probably won't go back."]
title: Birthday Sunday Lunch at Jazz Brunch

content: ['Went with my adult son to the bar/ terrace for dinner . I ate from £12-95 set menu : haggis and fillet steak. Son had a very large burger. Nice bottle of wine and enjoyed the experience . ']
title: Nice meal, big portions

content: ["The set three course lunch on Sunday is not cheap but is really good quality.The portions are large and I really enjoyed the haggis the Yorkshire pudding and it's great to see bread sauce with chicken. The British cheese trolley is a real treat. The wines are a bit limited but all good quality. The service tailed off so that even after ordering and receiving coffee and then the bill we were still waiting for dessert plates to be cleared. That needs to improve. If you want to talk rather than listen to jazz, it is quite loud on certain tables, and when we went it was the more discordant style of jazz rather than laid back. I think we would go for the food but go when there is no music."]
title: Sunday lunch jazz

content: ['We had a wonderful Sunday roast with Jazz music at the Boisdale.', 'Food was very good & starter smoked salmon was delicious. ', 'Jazz music and Scottish decor made the ambience top notch.', 'We would definitely go back.']
title: Sunday roast with Jazz

content: ['We went here on a Friday night with friends and everything was perfect from start to finish.', 'We started with pre dinner drinks in the bar on the first floor and took advantage of the smoking balcony with views over London.', 'The service and food were amazing from the cold crab starter to the mixed cheeseboard at the end.', 'The wine flowed and the band playing a mix of old and new jazz made the evening something to remember.', 'Not cheap by any means but great for an evening out.']
title: Wonderful Evening

content: ["I had a Groupon voucher for Sunday lunch.Service was poor from the moment of booking( complete lack of flexibility),servers treated us as second class citizens and made us feel very unwelcome ,food was ok but overpriced for what it is.Music was nice and the venue looks really good.i don't recommend this place and will not go again!"]
title: Overpriced fot what it offers

content: ['Love it here. The outdoor terrace, the cigar humidor, the fantastic music, ambiance, the food and whole experience is always 5 stars!']
title: Wonderful!

content: ["Food, staff, decor & entertainment excellent. We've never been disappointed - a Scottish/borders menu with French imagination and presentation, just wonderful - always check the daily specials - also lovely views of Canary Wharf. "]
title: Our Favourite Restaurant

content: ['We have visited Canary Wharf Boisdale several times but not of late, there are three reasons to visit a dinner and dance venue, these are great atmosphere, great service and great food 2 out of three is not good enough, why, i will tell you:', 'On arrival we were greeted and shown to the lower bar a great area for pre drinks i love the place! onward to our table some 60 mins later, after a few cold ones. Our service was excellent the atmosphere was superb, then came the most horrific excuse for food. I started with a sweaty Carpaccio of Venison, it was straight from a packet placed on a plate and served, it was dressed well on the menu but the execution lacked skill and imagination, appalling, then came the Chef Salad for my main meal, the menu stated it changed daily,wow, it needs changing immediately, soggy rocket leaves covered in oil with lentils and pine nuts can not be saved with a mere shaving of dry truffle powder.', 'Canary Wharf is a vibrant gastronomic powder house with restaurants surrounding Boisdale, Toms Kitchen, Plateau, Roka, One Canada Square, The Parlour and Hazev. I understand you cannot dance in these 6 restaurants but my advice, eat elsewhere, then enjoy a drink and dance at Boisdale at least until the chef is able to look after large events? ', 'My rating below is based on an overall package 2 out of 3 sections very good the other not worth turning up for.', 'If you disagree let me know']
title: great venue, great service, poor food

content: ["Time I commented about the Boisdale in Canary Wharf, since different is often god, and this is GOOD. Chains are so . . . damn boring, and although there are now three Boisdale's in London, give them a go, music, food, understanding and patient staff, and a lot of fun.", 'Great wine, food, including the steak, that is generally excellent, well thought out interesting.', 'Go for the music - damn fine!', 'Go for the food - brilliant!', 'Go because its a great place to meet and have fun with friends, perfect!', 'Really, give it a go, and be happy that there are still places that are not just over-designed factories.']
title: In a world of sameness, Boisdale has personality and good food

content: ["Dreadful fish and chips, massively overpriced drinks and I don't mind a little light jazz but the music and continual drumming made conversation difficult.", 'Huge service charge.', 'Had a better meal at Burger King.', 'Will never return.']
title: Overpriced Food and Drink Noisy Music

content: ['Had voucher through travel zoo , lunch was delicious, waiter helpful and friendly. Jazz trio great. Would go again.']
title: Sunday lunch

content: ['Went on a Thursday night for my birthday, and it was quiet which was great.', 'The service and food was outstanding! There was a slight mishap, but it was forgotten.', 'Atmosphere was amazing also.', "There is only 1 tiny bit of constructive criticism - I found majority of the waiting staff was rushing around like flies - I don't know whether this was due to having a private big table, but at times I felt on edge when they came round to top up the wine or take plates away."]
title: A place to come back to again

content: ['A friend bought us a Groupon deal at Boisdale as a thank you for 2 Wagyu Beef Burgers and a prosecco. As I am a veggie, I called ahead and asked if I could have an alternative and asked if I could have the mushroom and black truffle risotto, which they allowed. We were seated on the balcony that looks our over a leafy square in Canary Wharf on a lovely warm day - it was excellent! I enjoyed my risotto, it was very flavoursome, and my boyfriend said his burger had been good but not exceptional. He did have the truffle fries though and I stole a couple, they were divine!! We had a cheeseboard additional to the deal to finish and that was amazing, it is bespoke so you can choose 6 or 10 cheeses from a selection of hard, soft, blue and smelly! ', 'We enjoyed the meal so much that the next week when we had cause for celebration when I got a new job we immediately decided on going back to Boisdale. This time we could choose more freely and had a few of the tapas sides. I had the truffle and mushroom rarebit which was really yummy and we shared a variety of the small plates and a plank with cheeses and cured meats (for him of course!). We were very impressed once again, and have said should either of our parents come visit we would definitely take them back there!']
title: So good we went back a week later!

content: ["Been here umpteen times since November 2015 and can't praise it enough.", 'We own Vista - a stretch limousine and events company in Wellingborough, Northamptonshire and regularly recommend and take our clients to Boisdales of Canary Wharf (and Belgravia.) ', 'Great venue for Stag or Hen party, or those clients looking for a first class night out in London with fantastic music (great cross section), dancing, fine dining and great atmosphere. ', 'Well run and managed, great and helpful staff who work together as a fab team, excellent customer service. ', 'Ambience second to none, food is 5 star +, check out their amazing whisky selection. Prices extremely reasonable for London and great value. Menu superb and something for all tastes.', "Boisdales ..... what's not to like. Try it once .. guarantee you will want to return. So do yourself and your friends and family a huge favour ... go check it out."]
title: IN LONDON - THEN THIS IS AN ABSOLUTE MUST

content: ['Went for an after work dinner. Firstly we had cocktails at the bar which were superbly made and then onto the terrace for dinner. We opted for the set menu and had the whitebait and steak. Perfection. The waiting staff, cigar expert and bar tender were superb. Boisdales Canary Wharf is a hidden gem and an example of to how to provide a wonderful bar and dinner experience. ']
title: Wonderful experience

answer_text: ['Dear Kate', 'Thank you for taking the time to respond to your experience at Boisdale Canary wharf on Trip adviser. I was disappointed to read your comments in light of the email that I sent to you detailing the information relating to our music listings. Please see below.', '"I understand that you dined with us through the Group on forum, that will indicate only that you had a dinner and show package, and does not communicate the specific act. All our music acts are listed on our website which includes video footage of each act, so that our guests can get an appreciation of the music that will be performing on each night."', 'This clearly states that there is no "small print" and that our website provides substantial details of each act, so that our guests can make an informed decision as to which show they would like to attend. The act in question was Cream, which has a very specific guitar based blues sound, and was generally well received by our audience. ', 'All of our guests who purchase tickets via the Groupon forum have a choice as to which show they would like to attend, and we will make every effort to provide the best experience for dining as well as a memorable music show. ', 'On the Groupon website we are referred to as a Jazz and Blues venue, although it does go on to detail that we have tribute acts such as David Bowie and Queen, which is an indication of the variety of shows that we host at the restaurant.', 'You clearly stated in your email to me that you enjoyed your meal and the service very much, and that the show was not to your liking. I am sorry that the music was not to your taste, although we believe that a variety of acts is essential to ensure we have a broad and consistent appeal to all.', 'Please do not hesitate on contacting me in the future should you require any information relating to future acts. ', 'Kind regards', 'James Hardesty']
content: ["Visited with a groupon voucher and had never visited the restaurant before. The food was lovely and we looked forward to the evening of jazz and blues that was described on the groupon and Boisdale website. What a shocker the music was loud rock, so loud we couldn't hear ourselves speak and not the sort of music any of us would have chosen to listen to. ", 'The manageress agreed it was dreadful and we left our table and took our drinks to the bar downstairs. ', 'I emailed Boisdale to say how disappointed we had been but they responded saying that although they advertise as a jazz and blues restaurant they have a more eclectic mix on a Saturday. ', 'No apology just suggested we might have looked into the very small print on their website. ', 'Customer service sadly lacking. ']
title: So disappointed

content: ['Fabulous night from start to finish. Professional, friendly, experienced staff, with great service , delicious food and an amazing band.', 'We danced the night away once we had finished dinner, which was outstanding and we drank a variety of cocktails. This is a must visit place if you are after a special day or night out, we loved the whole experience and we will be back.']
title: Brilliant night, with delicious food and great music

content: ['Really refreshing lunch with few glasses of champagne and bellinis for the girls as well as single malt for the boys.', 'Crystal clean glassware and proper serving temperature.', 'A little confusion with timing with one of the dishes but hey good attitude works miracles.', 'Very good Rib-eyes cooked as requested med-rare with all the trimmings.', 'Very good crowd and fine ambience, very friendly stuff and interesting decor.', 'I like the place.']
title: Professional and prompt

content: ["Booked a meal and an evening of great Jazz music through Groupon at a discounted price. The evening was fantastic from the minute we walked in the service was first class as well as the table near the stage, the food and the singer performing. Would highly recommend this venue to couples especially as it's a great place if you want a romantic venue with lovely food and great music."]
title: Great food, Great music in one lovely venue.

content: ['Great location. One tube journey from Waterloo then off at Canary Wharf through the luxury shops directly into Boisdales. Could see the shard and the gherkin from our table as the sunset. Boisdales has a loose Scottish theme and a very pricey menu. Definately overpriced for what it was. Service a bit sporadic over the top at one point and then disappeared the next. Over £400.00 for 6 with no starters or deserts although we did have a few bottles of wine. However we really came for the entertainment which on this particular night was a sort of Vegas themed . Could do with making the dance floor a bit bigger as everyone wanted to dance even the staff were getting into the spirit. Would have been nice to have 2 halves as it all seemed to be over quite quickly but great fun.']
title: Fun evening

content: ['Visited here last night for dinner and a show. First time visiting and will definitely come again. We enjoyed 2 courses and 1 dessert between us. Mostly couples but a few groups too. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Great evening. ']
title: Lovely food and wonderful music

content: ['Amazing food , beautiful atmosphere, top notch service and if you are a jazz lover then this is the place to be. Hidden away on the 2nd floor it makes it exclusive and a brilliant dining.']
title: Best Place In Canary Wife

content: ['A group of 6 of us went down to see Zalons Soul Show! What a great night music and performance was amazing with lots of people dancing all night and great customer interaction from Zalon who is an amazing singer! ', 'We started the night with drinks on the beautiful terrace on the 1st floor overlooking the square. Great friendly service too.', 'We then went up to the restaurant on the 2nd floor for dinner. We had a great table with a good view of the stage. We were greeted by a very friendly host chap who showed us to the table.', 'Starters were spot on ( mini haggis, scallops, smoked salmon and a crab) crab was very disappointing sliver with mostly unnecessary garnish. Mains were great, lobster, steak, calves liver, and fish. All tasted great and had a few extra side dishes (rather small).', "We had some lovely wine (well priced). Didn't have room for puddings. We then danced the night away until way past 11.30 to great sounds of soul!"]
title: Great Soul night with Zalon

content: ["I don't even like whisky and only (begrudgingly) smoke cigars at weddings but this bar is something else. The selection of different whiskies downstairs is impressive but upstairs it's breathtaking, covering a huge wall behind the bar. And if expensive cigars are your thing, the smoking room looked like a great spot to spend a lot. We were only drinking beer, like peasants, but it wasn't as expensive as I'd expected: north of £5 a pint is standard round there anywhere you go. The legions of staff were very friendly and they have a smoking balcony with a decent view as well, with blankets for when it gets chilly. I full intend to return soon and fully live out a Gordon Gecko-style evening."]
title: Opulent bar experience.

content: ['Good place for small groups to meet in the week, large groups can get a bit difficult as large crowds at the end of a week. Great menu, good food, excellent wine list and cigar lounge. Jazz and full menu upstairs but for most of us the terrace downstairs is great. Members terrace good value for a quiet place to catch up. ']
title: Good place for small groups

content: ["We were here with a Groupon voucher which made it decidely cheaper as it included a glass of pro seco. We added on a small haggis to share for our starter - it was good and quite enough for the two of us. Then the beefburger! The bun it is in is way above what I have experienced in other restaurants. The beef is wagyu and the taste is splendid. A couple of lettuce leaves on the base and on top of the burger some mushrooms and a large fried egg, cooked to perfection i.e. white well set and the yolk very liquid. The chips were good. Interestingly they charge £1.50 for mayonnaise but it is homemade with a touch of mustard in it - added a nice flavour to the chips. My companion is Italian and felt the pro seco was of a good quality. The decor is outstanding - lots of tartan around. Live music too, later in the evening - we had a few minutes of a taster as the musicians did a 10 or so minute rehearsal. Then canned music - much of it from the 1930's and 40's - so enjoyed it. We will certainly be returning here to taste other items on their menu. Note that the restaurant does not open for lunch on a Saturday."]
title: Probably one of the best beefburgers I've tasted!

content: ["Booked this offer for two courses and show for something a bit different. On arrival seated at a perfect table at the front. Menu was great really unusual to be honest I hadn't realised it was a Scottish restaurant which went down well with my Scottish husband. Haggis for starters was apparently delicious. I had goat cheese salad also lovely. Onto the main poached salmon and lamb chops both amazing. Food was really excellent we paid extra for the cheese board a selection of 5 British cheeses WOW. service food and entertainment were superb special mention to our waitress Rody. Would highly recommend and will return "]
title: Terrific Travel zoo deal

content: ['If you enjoy good Scottish Roast Beef The Boisdale is the place for you. Excellent service with wine included , live jazz music to boot you cannot go wrong ']
title: Fantatic Sunday Roast

content: ["We went to this restaurant on a voucher deal, on arrival staff were welcoming and we were shown to our seat.it took a while before we placed our order as our waitress seemed distant and distracted as if her mind wasn't on the job! However the food was excellent and the live music was top standard."]
title: Food was very good

content: ["If you want like hearty British food, whiskey and low lighting with a sprinkle of jazz music this place is for you. The food is good and plentiful, you won't come away hungry. Staff are friendly and pricing reasonable, but the whole thing doesn't blow me away and makes for a very heavy evening."]
title: Heavy evening

content: ['We were treated by friends to an evening at Boisdale as part of special birthday celebrations and could not fault it. As we walked thought the entrance I was concerned as to where we were going but as soon as we walked through the door to club was really impressed by the interior which is beautiful with rows upon rows of whisky bottles in a grand display cabinet make a great backdrop. Not only did we all enjoy our meal which included amongst other dishes Haggis, Chilli Squid and Steak, but the band that were on that evening were fantastic. It is not often that everyone in our group of 50 somethings rush to the dance floor. It was made particularly memorable by the fabulous waiter who was attentive but discreet. I wish I had made a note of his name.']
title: Great celebratory evening with excellent band

content: ["A colleague booked. It wasn't on my list. ", 'Pleasantly surprised by the food - good steak, and a lovely Chianti, but for a business dinner, the others were commenting on the decor which just feels a bit like an strange Scottish nightclub in places. ', 'And half empty where other places booked out which given the size of the place left you with a feeling that you got a table there easily for a reason. ', 'Hosting customers and the last feeling you want is a slightly apologetic one. ', "Staff were lovely but it's the ambiance... "]
title: Ok

answer_text: ['Dear Celia,', 'Thank you for taking the time to write some valuable feedback regarding your visit to Boisdale Canary Wharf. I was very disappointed to read that the experience did not match your expectations. Please can you contact me at your earliest convenience so that I can discuss the issues you encountered in more depth. You can either contact me via email gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk or on 020 7715 5818. I look forward to hearing from you in due course.', 'Kind regards', 'James Hardesty']
content: ["I've been wanting to visit this place for a long time, but it was to my disappointment. We were sat quite a distance from the live band plying that night, but we asked to be moved closer, the manager told us it was a VIP area costing an addional £45 just to sit there, Yikes. ", 'The food was not top notch as I expected, the starters had 2 slivers of ery bitter cougettes and about 4 bits of cheese, it was bad so complained. The manager said we got into this club using a voucher but after my challenge of suc a strange comment fro him, he couldnt explain why a voucher had anthing to do with the quality food since all diners were eating the same foods. He did offer another starter but the first was enough to put me right off.', 'The service was excellent, very prompt and polite, and decor was really nicely done, but the fact that we not even allowed to around the bar, which could easily have had 20 plus more, i find it too contolling for a good night out.And thank the good ', 'Lord i didnt pay full price for the bits i got.tears at bedtime comes to mind. Sort it Boisdale']
title: Boisdale -Canary Wharf, Eat at home first!

answer_text: ['Thank you for your valuable feedback on your visit to Boisdale Canary Wharf. I would like to discuss in more detail some of the issues that you raised. Please contact me at your earliest convenience either via email gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk or on 020 7715 5818.', 'Kind regards', 'James Hardesty']
content: ['Show ', "My friends and I were here to see Zalon who used to be a backing singer for Amy Winehouse. I'll start my review with the positives. The show was absolutely fantastic, zalon and his band were great and had most people on the dance floor wanting more. So definitely worth going there for the show. ", 'Food ', "We paid £45 each for a two course set meal and tickets to the show, the only reason we opted for this was because we wanted to be seated. What a mistake! First of all we were seated so far from the stage so we had to get up anyway! I was annoyed when I looked at the menu, most of the items on eBay set menu had supplements, so you ended up having to pay at least £10 extra per person excluding service and drinks. This would have been fine if the food was good! I had the scallops ceviche my friend had the squid and her husband had the salmon... All extremely average. For mains my friend and I had the burger and her husband had the steak. I asked for my burger to be medium rare and it came completely charred! Sent it back and got another one which was medium well. But I couldn't be bothered to send this back as everyone else was finishing their meal. The food is nothing to write home about and for those prices I rather go elsewhere. ", 'Service ', 'The service is really hit and miss, the staff here seem like they think that they are too good to be working in this place. Some of them were bordering on rude! Even when we asked for bread it was just plonked on the table! ', 'Overall. ', 'In my humble opinion I would suggest that this place is good for a drink and show, the venue is lovely. But save yourself the money and eat elsewhere. ']
title: Zalon!

content: ["Friendly service, nice Scottish menu, food was very good, great choice of whiskies and all in all a very pleasant meal. We took in the show, normally jazz but on this occasion an excellent Elvis impersonator. Only complaint - when you buy the ticket for the show it suggests there is a table d'hote meal included yet we only got the a la carte menu and there was no allowance made on the bill. This needs to be much clearer on the website. "]
title: Enjoyable Canary Wharf Restaurant but watch show ticket price

content: ["We visited when there was live jazz, £30 per person for two courses (and the music), but over 50% of the menu choices had a hefty supplement of at least £4-8.00 - the choices on the menu without a supplement were the choices you'd probably overlook and were just basic dishes. This applied to both starters and main courses. ", "It's a shame because the food is good (but we paid the supplement as there was nothing on the menu we fancied without a supplement), the wine list is good, and the music was very good too, as was the service. But the £30 pp is not the actual price, we paid an additional c.£10 each in supplements. On the one hand, perhaps we don't mind, but I believe that a higher price should be the advertised price! "]
title: 3 is harsh but deserved

content: ['Not great value for money, but good selection of food. Decent place in Canary Wharf for dinner or lunch. Also has a terrace.']
title: One of the better places in Canary Wharf

content: ['We bought a dinner and show ticket and treated us to a special night. I was a bit disappointed knowing the Victoria branch by the overall flair, it lacked a bit of soul. Food was delicious, although the set menue has many extra charged supplements ( for a burger an extra £ 4,95 and so on and they charged us for the truffle mayonnaise an extra £3 ! This supposed to be on the burger but we couldn t taste any. So Overall WE Ended up with a Bill of £ 125! , having had a bottle of wine for £25. The band was great and it felt like being back in 1959. ']
title: Yummy food but big price tag attached

content: ['Visited on a Thursday for a special occasion. Set menu and jazz. Scottish theme steak whisky etc and many staff had kilts..Mixed reviews on food.. starters excellent but steak ok..Most items seemed to be extra £ Drinks very good - great selection of cocktails especially those whisky based. Wall of whisky was impressive and loved the vibe feel with attentive service. Jazz was very good and overall a very enjoyable evening and definitely will return. Why not 5 stars ? On leaving the bill felt bit high but a great evening.']
title: Great evening - but ££'s can creep up

content: ["A great bar, very decent restaurant and cigar emporium. I enjoyed oysters and steak washed down with a very palatable red. Staff were efficient and pleasant. It did shut a little early but that's Canary Wharf for you. "]
title: Steak & Cigars

content: ['Excellent bar and also very good food. I have been many times both for drinks and dinner. If you can get a night when they have a band play its well worth it. Usually quite jazzy. There is a balcony off the bar which is great when the sun is shining. For whiskey lovers there is a huge selection.']
title: Favourite bar

content: ['I was at this restaurant for a business dinner and I thoroughly enjoyed it.', 'I have a 2 course meal and both dishes were very good and well presented. Service was good and attentive.', 'Very good selection of wines and excellent selection of whiskies.', 'Highly recommended']
title: Very good meal, warm atmosphere and great whisky selection!

content: ['We visited Boisdale Restaurant at Canary Wharf for our Anniversary which was our first time there after a recommendation from friends. I must say we were not disappointed and in honesty, we could not fault any of it at all. Not only was the food mouth watering tasty and well presented, the service was such a high standard and probably the best we have ever experienced. It was quite a pleasure to watch the staff on occasion going about their business, serving tables as well as our own almost being unnoticed at times. But as soon as you needed something, they were there and a credit to the management. Sometimes I do contest "service charge" when applied to our bill but not this occasion. The entertainment (Viva Santana Tribute Band) was also really good which made it a very enjoyable evening indeed. We would have absolutely no hesitation in going there again or recommending to friends and family. Just excellent.']
title: Boisdale

content: ["We took my dad here for lunch on Father's Day - I had heard it was good but it surpassed my expectations. We opted for the lunch without the recommended wines and it was excellent value for money, the atmosphere is warm and welcoming and the staff friendly and helpful. I had haggis scotch egg which was wonderful followed by roast pork and baked cheesecake. The wine list is reasonable and covers all tastes as you would expect. Afterwards we had coffee and whisky on open terrace which was wonderful.. My dad really enjoyed the afternoon and i would recommend Boisdales for a special occasion - good man food!"]
title: Father's Day Treat

content: ["Very enjoyable evening here in February, top notch plates served up, most excellent steak in London. Selection of scotch and whiskey is superb, practically unmatched. Don't forget the desserts. Just be sure to bring your am ex."]
title: Jazzy Ambience, a great steak, and some fine scotch

content: ['Very good meat, very good seafood and classic service! Special mention to our host, Gianluca, and the guy who brought us the food, Kevin, impressed about him, he is very attentive and assisted us when rest were busy! Whiskey menu massive!']
title: Classic

content: ["Had lunch here with friends and as much as like what Boisdake is about they just don't deliver. Small portions, cold and over priced food for what is is. Service depends on who you get. We had three different waiters to who we explained the menu and constantly chased for service. If you like Boisdale I would try the Bishopsgate branch but alas we will not be going back."]
title: Not good, not good at all

content: ["Coming out the lift up from the busy, bustling shopping mall, you find yourself in a quiet, dark, draped & boarded corridor as if in a fine, London gentleman's club leading to an tartan art-deco curved dining room. The staff were professional and attentive (though a lil' under-resourced this particular lunch). The a la carte menu is half Scottish/Italian classics and half full Grill room standards. Plumped for Air-dried Wagyu beef, asparagus & egg for a starter, then an excessive order of rose veal & aged Parmesan pappardelle with sides of bone marrow, herb crumb & horseradish and truffled seared foie gras - all absolutely delicious! No time for dessert or coffee this day but a lovely meal nonetheless"]
title: Reassuringly proper business restaurant with Jazz, Oysters & Cigars for afters

answer_text: ['Thank you for your feedback regarding your meal at Canary Wharf Boisdale. I was very disappointed to read that the experience fell short of your expectations. Please can you contact me at your earliest convenience so that may get a better understanding of the issues that you encountered. ', 'You can contact me by mail gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk or on 020 7715 5818.', 'I look forward to hearing from you in due course.', 'Kind regards', 'James']
content: ['I have been here before for a tribute Earth Wind and Fire Band a couple of years ago - great atmosphere but very very expensive. I took a friend here for a birthday on Tuesday this week - it was an early dinner so restaurant was quiet as expected and service was very good. However, the food was dreadful. I ordered a goats cheese salad which came with one crouton and two square pieces of goats cheese! I was in total shock and thought they were joking!! I then ordered a steak and chips which was an additional £8 on top - steak was lovely however the size of a small orange! aND I had about 15-20 chips. I asked for mayonaise and had to pay another £1.50 for that although the tomato sauce my friend ordered was free.????? Definatley not value for money at all! The service was good however, the bill for drinks first time round for a gin and tonic and a bottle of beer was completely different then the second time. Why was the first one more expensive?? They sold doubles without even asking if I wanted doubles or singles so be careful.... Very disappointing visit and would not reconmend this place to anyone... if you go bring plenty of cash..']
title: Cannot see what anyone sees in this restaurant!

content: ['This restaurant is the place where one can get out of his/her comfort zone - my suggestion is that one should just infer his/her preference to the waiting or bar personnel and just see what they recommend. ', 'The ambiance is very nice, the food is excellent and the service second to none - definitely one of my favourite restaurants in London.']
title: Consistently excellent

content: ['Did the fixed menu and show package and have to tell you - it was great. We were seated right up by the stage, the food was great, the music fantastic (Mississippi - spelling alert - Swamp stylee with plenty of really great musicianship), the wind most enjoyable - just a fantastic night out.', 'Fixed menu had something for everyone - even our picky vegetarian daughter - and all very high quality.', "Highly highly recommended. Great waiter too but sadly can't remember his name."]
title: Great Jazz Night with Fine Food

content: ['Booked for 5 of us with Groupon for my sons birthday. Having been to Bishopsgate we knew the food would be excellent. ', 'I told the receptionists on arrival that we were celebrating a birthday, they took his name, asked if we had a cake. I said no, they then said he would arrange for a candle to put on his desert with happy birthday inscribed on the plate. Also they would mention it to the band for the to announce, They could not have been more helpful. The manager James came to introduce himself, and was delightful and helpful, shoeing us to our seats and asking who the birthday boy was. Ashley our waiter was great, really friendly and attentive, helping out with choices for Whisky. ', 'We had to pay supplements on the food that was not included in the voucher price, but it was well worth it, the steaks were delicious. As was all the food we had. ', "The band were very good if not a little loud so we had to shout, but that wasn't a problem.", 'The two men especially like the cigar room and disappeared for 1/2 hour! ', 'Overall i would highly recommend if']
title: Great birthday night out

content: ["Had a great night, top class cocktails, fabulous oysters, can highly recommend the haggis. Well looked after by Martin Moran and his waiting team. Can't wait to go again. "]
title: Loved it .....

content: ["We went with friends on a travel zoo offer, £20 per person per head for two courses. The menu offered a good choice, but almost all the dishes carried a supplement of up to £8! Plus extra if you wanted sides. I chose for my starter Warm Vichyssoise with pickled St Georges mushrooms, new potatoes and garlic. The soup was fairly tasty with very thin slices of potato, but I really couldn't tell if there were any mushrooms in it at all - St George's or otherwise. I told the waiter and he said he'd tell the chef to put more in next time! There was no feedback from the kitchen though. Generally the food was pleasant but nothing special and the final bill was £170 plus the £80 we'd already paid. So £250 for 4 people with very little alcohol seems a bit excessive, considering it was supposed to be a promotional price. The jazz band were entertaining and got people up dancing. Staff were friendly and efficient, and we enjoyed the evening very much. It was our third visit, and we'll probably go again, but really not good value for money."]
title: Good evening, but...

content: ['My partner and I went to celebrate my birthday with the Groupont deal.Everything was perfect except one thing.Due to the fact that it was my birthday I requested a nice table because it was a special occasion for us.Unfortunately we did get a farthest table from the stage...I understand Groupon voucher is Groupon voucher but at least they could try to satisfy us.Anyway the food,the service and show was excellent.We went to try some cigar as well...worth it.']
title: Birthday dinner

content: ["We had some haggis and steak, which were really filling. First we were seated outside as it was quite sunny, however later it got windy, and the staff had no problem to move us inside. We went around 12 o'clock weekday and it was not busy at all. Would come back again"]
title: Lovely food

answer_text: ['Dear Rini9', 'Thank you for taking time to feedback with regard to your visit to Canary Wharf Boisdale. Please can you contact me at your earliest convenience, so that I can discuss your visit, and also your previous encounter at Boisdale on the 24th May 2015. ', 'You can contact me via email gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk alternatively by phone 020 7715 5818.', 'Kind regards', 'James Hardesty']
content: ["Went on a night when the band was playing so had to pay a surcharge for that (which we didn't mind as they were lovely). The staff we dealt with were unfoundedly pretentious and not great at all. The food was a real disappointment- the 'chicken' pie I ordered had one tiny piece of chicken. How was that allowed to be served for the prices that they charge. Left feeling extremely underwhelmed. "]
title: Very disappointing

content: ['If you up to a nice properly cooked food, it is a place to enjoy it:) I always take their salmon as a starter as it is melting in my mouth. In regards to main, you do need to select it yourself - I do go for stake. The quality is very high and you can also go for the blue, if you do like raw meat:) ']
title: Great stake:)

content: ['Spent a lovely evening on the terrace catching up with friends. Bar snack and champagne which on ladies night (Wednesday) is half price. Food and service both excellent.']
title: Catching up with friends

content: ['I tended to believe this would be an ironic experience but, in fact, the food was good, the entertainment excellent and the service of a good quality.']
title: Massive yet enjoyable!

content: ['whenever I came to London for Oceanology International, After a long exhaustive day I spent my evening with my friends in Boisdale']
title: superp

content: ["Jazz can range from the sublime to the ordinary and I'm sure the level has a significant impact on the quality of the experience. For our visit, it was towards the lower end with too much emphasis on praising the musicians rather than relying on creating a special musical ambience. The venue is impressive although with some touches spoiling the grandeur. The food was good and service professional. My lasting impression is how good an event could be here - and probably is on many event days."]
title: I am confident the rating will be better next visit

content: ['Went here for Sunday Jazz lunch and it was great experience. I ordered the smoked salmon as my starter and was very happy with the taste. My main meal was the roast beef and that was also very tasty with generous proportions.', "The overall dining experience was very enjoyable. We weren't rushed and the Jazz was an added bonus.", 'I definitely recommend Boisdale for a Sunday lunch treat']
title: Lovely Sunday Jazz lunch

content: ['Had a great dinner with colleagues, very comprehensive list of whiskeys, knowledgable staff and great steak.']
title: Great steak and whiskey

content: ["If you're looking to add a touch of class and have some money to burn then go here! It's really nice inside and the staff are helpful. With 600 whiskys to choose from you can find something rare. Perhaps, like me, you can't afford the whole bottle from a shop but you can taste it anyway and brag about how good it tasted later.", 'The balcony is a great place to try their cigars. Luckily I was given one from a nice client!']
title: A classy place for whisky and cigars

content: ["Really can't praise Boisdales enough. We went for an evening meal as the music was a Bowie tribute night. We had been told it was good but it was superb. The music was brilliant, the food was stunning and the staff were very attentive without being intrusive in any way. Really don't know how to praise this place enough, we will certainly return. The food was reasonably priced, the décor was very nice and the atmosphere made the evening perfect.
