title: Fantastic Food, Great Service

content: ["Great little gem in Canary Wharf. Food was fab- big steak couldn't finish it, the waiter gladly packed the rest for me to takeaway. Live jazz was great although if you sit right at the front of the stage you won't be able to have a decent convo.", 'Romantic setting with candles and dimmed lights.', 'Went for our wedding anniversary and was given a sticky toffee pudding on the house! ', 'Very sweet of them. ', 'Overall great night!']
title: Anniversary

content: ["Was really sceptical about this to start with, having grown up in the 80's and learned at school how Canary Wharf was developed as a 'yuppie playground', I was really unsure that this ousted be anything other than a bit pretentious. I couldn't have been more wrong, the staff were attentive, the food superb and the Jazz band absolutely brilliant. If you are a whisky connoisseur, they have the largest collection of single malts in Europe according to our waiter but be warned that some can cost up to £500 a shot! A lovely way to spend an evening - particularly an anniversary or birthday."]
title: Excellent food, music and atmosphere

content: ["Had a great night out with live 80s music and awesome food! There is a charge for the music which i don't believe is optional. Would recommend this place when in london. "]
title: Great night out!

content: ['Boisdale is my guilty secret. We try and go as much as we can because its pricey but I will pay for good food, good music and good service. I have been twice in the last couple of weeks and both times the service has been below par. I did not write a reveiw last time due to money being taken off the bill and all my other great night. I went again last Saturday and again we had to wait for 25 minutes just to order, our waiter was trying hard to make everyone happy running between tables but could not keep up. The table next to were waiting longer both of our tables he apoligised, the table to my left called the waiter over to say that his food had been left on a small table to go cold. We were so disapointed that we decided to go after we recieved our food and not stay for the whole of the show. The floor manager recognised us and asked if we were ok, we told her no and that we feel that they are about 3-4 members of staff short. A previous floor manager ( Glen) went around checking on tables, pouring drinks and making diners happy, now the floor managers serve to keep up with demand. We have decided to have a rest from Boisdales for a while.']
title: Disappointing service

content: ['Good atmosphere and entertainment with very good food (albeit a bit pricey) but do beware the waiter trying to push up the bill by encouraging you to buy high priced drinks', 'We had a very enjoyable evening and would go again, the only downside being that we had a table near us with three very noisy drunken young guys with little respect for their fellow diners or the entertainers. ', "I can only put this down to it's proximity to the financial district bringing in a few noisy people with too much money and too little culture. I can't imagine them being tolerated at Ronnie Scotts, where they would have been shown the door. To be fair one waitress did ask them to quieten down but they still interfered with the first half"]
title: Good food, jazz, but noisey neighbours

content: ['Had a Groupon voucher £49, steak & lobster plus glass of prosecco each. Which is a good price. ', 'We booked for a table at 6:30pm but arrived at 6pm, the waiter are more than happy for us to take a seat and let us choose our own table. ', 'Good we were early, as looking at others surrounding us, their food took ages to come. The waiter did say there were 58 people that evening who were using the Groupon voucher for dinner service. ', 'We ordered a side dish, bottle of water, desert and a glass of red which bill came to £35 which we thought was a bit pricey. ', 'Dinner was served on first floor, after dinner we went upstairs to get our parking ticket verified, and realised second floor atmosphere seemed much better than downstairs, might want to give this place a try instead, as looks even nicer. ', 'Food was cooked nicely, but felt lobster had been over cooked. However with me asking for medium rare and my hubby requested medium, the steak was cooked to perfection :)', 'All in all, food was good, but we had to wait for very long time for service, and you can so tell the staff a very new. ', 'I would like to try dining upstairs on second floor next time.']
title: Second floor is nicer than first floor

content: ["We sat in the bar area and the first issue was that the music meant any conversation was impossible. The service was poor from the start. Ordering was slow and surly and the plates were collected before the whole group had finished. The food was okay at best (burgers were only available medium well or well done) but not worth the poor service. Boisdale feels as if it would be fine if you were a member, but if not don't expect them to treat you well. "]
title: Okay food...terrible service

content: ['Brought a voucher on groupon for this resturant because we wanted to go somewhere different. This place is very different, in a good way. Really nice decor, really nice staff. The food was superb& value for money. Would definatly go back. And recommend this resturant to anyone.']
title: Fabulous

content: ['My boyfriend and myself ate here using a Groupon deal. We had a rib eye steak and half lobster each, with chips and a glass of prosecco. The service was excellent; attentive and efficient (compared to a restaurant I have recently reviewed). The medium steak was perfectly cooked and the lobster meaty and juicy. We ate outside on the terrace which was very pleasant. It would be expensive without a deal but you get what you pay for. Will definitely be booking here again. ']
title: Excellent!

content: ['Have been here a couple of times for lunch.', 'Access is upstairs from the shopping centre using either the stairs of the lift.', 'They have a good 2 course lunch menu and the food has always been really good. ', 'Love the mini haggis!', 'Reasonable prices too.', 'Service always impeccable.']
title: Very good set lunch

content: ['We ate here for our wedding anniversary and the food was fantastic. The steak were exceptionally tender. The green salad had a trace of dill running through it which was fresh and tasty. Followed this with a small cheese platter between the 2 of us. There was a wide tasty choice of cheese.', 'The prices, however, do leave a bitter taste in the mouth. Being charged extra because a jazz band was going to play, even though we had finished before they started was unacceptable. 2 x steak and chips, 1 salad, 1 small cheese platter and a mid-range bottle of wine...£180.', 'Coffee with a port for me, a whisky (the cheapest on the menu) and a small cigar was another £70. ', "While we had a fantastic evening, next year we'll go away for a weekend instead!"]
title: Fantastic Food - At A Price...

content: ['Having been disappointed on previous visits we were a little hesitant to return but we had a really lovely evening.', "The maître d' was from the Belgravia restaurant and what a great character.", "Service was good, our waiter was new but you wouldn't know it. He was very good and a credit to the restaurant.", 'All our courses were spot on and very tasty. The drinks were all good and we loved the cocktails.', 'The live band really made the evening, they were fabulous.', 'I do hope the restaurant can keep us this high standard for our next visit as based on this evening we will return.']
title: A lovely evening

content: ["Took my mother a number of times to the Boisdale . Fantastic especially amongst all that London has to offer. Great Friday and Saturday night haunt. Whiskey and cigars as a digestif. Really enjoyed a great experience there will most certainly return....... Music and entertainment was really enjoyable couldn't have been happier ."]
title: Little Scotland

content: ['We booked for the deal with a glass of sparkling wine, steak & lobster with strawberries to finish and enjoyed the whole experience. Beautiful decor, attentive staff and a 5 piece band to entertain you. Would definitely return, great for couples or groups on a celebration.']
title: Wonderful evening

content: ["We ate here a few nights ago, dining from the set menu. It was good value for money and the food was lovely. Enormous portions too. My steak was huge! They do music too but we dined early and were sleepy so didn't stay for that unfortunately. The service was also excellent, attentive but not over-bearing."]
title: Lovely meal

content: ["Great place to dine while music is played live. Great quality of food and service is attentive. Not noisy and enough space to discuss business while appreciating the vibe. Plenty of selection of drinks of that's what you are after."]
title: Pleasant atmosphere

content: ['Just go - we love Boisdale in Canary Wharf. The food is just basic yet satisfying. The top floor dining experience is something we enjoy each time - great cocktails, wine and whiskey selection. They bring in very talented musicians and the service is attentive. We also love to go after dinner elsewhere to have a drink and cigar. They offer a covered outdoor balcony terrace and it is a great way to end an evening with friends. They also have an indoor cigar bar with a decent selection.']
title: Go for the food, Go for the music, Go for the cigar bar

content: ["We booked tickets at the Boisdale specifically to see Si Cranstoun perform. We paid £50 each for the ticket/table reservation (including a goodie bag). I wouldn't pay the premium rate in the future (this was for a special occasion) as the band can be seen and heard well from further back - tickets were from £20, and you could probably just book a table for dinner and enjoy the music, as there were a couple of spare tables.", 'Anyhow, we had an amazing time. Si Cranstoun and the band were amazing and had half the restaurant up dancing by the end. The music started just before 10pm, and finished around midnight with a 20 minute interval.', 'The service was excellent - our waiter Jon-Luca deserves a special mention for being very polite, friendly and attentive throughout the night.', 'The food was very nice - I can highly recommend the haggis starter (despite not having tried haggis before...) and the steaks are melt in the mouth. The drinks were also lovely, although the cocktails are certainly on the strong side! However, the place is not cheap - we spent almost £200 on a three course meal and drinks (not including the cost of the tickets).', "The dress code wasn't as formal as we expected. Some men were wearing suits, but many were just in open necked shirts and trousers. Similarly, women don't need formal evening dress, just to look reasonably smart. We were a little apprehensive about the evening (not being accustomed to fine dining in Canary Wharf!), but were made to feel at ease and very much enjoyed the experience. Thoroughly recommended."]
title: An Amazing Night

content: ['Very nice restaurant. Good food. The service was quite slow. They have a nice terrace, so it is a great place to spend time with friends.']
title: tres Bon. Service lent.

content: ["Booked for a Bob Marley Tribute & was a little dubious but shouldn't have worried. An amazing class act form 'The Legends'.", 'Food was really delicious. Perfect size portions if enjoying a 3 course meal. Starters- Scallops were divine and potted shrimp was plentiful. Mains- My husband said the truffle burger was a bit too thick and not all flavours came through but he still enjoyed it. Pasta with pecorino, broad beans and pea shoots was beautiful light and more than enough. Dessert- Sticky toffee pudding had the lightest touch but would have been better with ice cream and not clotted cream. Cheesecake with strawberries and basil was small, perfectly formed, but the right amount. Very flavourful. Great price too. 3 courses, 1 side, water, mocktail & one alcohol drink all just under £100 inc 12.5%. Nice service.', "Slight negative....we were completely forgotten at the beginning of our meal for 25 minutes while more 'favourable' customers, who arrived after us, were fully served before us!!! Was later kindly offered a table with better stage view but we stayed at our lovely table. I think at least a free drink could've been taken off the bill considering they still included their service charge! Overall we had a lovely evening and will definitely return."]
title: Beautiful evening

content: ['I came here with a colleague and a client a couple of weeks ago.', "I'd had been to the Bishopsgate restaurant and here for lunch previously. This time I visited for dinner and it wasn't good. The restraurant was very quiet and my colleague was first to arrive, what was nice though is they served him some lovely canapes at the bar as he was waiting. I wish I had ordered a platter of them as they tasted far better than the food I had.", 'Ordered haggis as a starter, it was terrible; dry overcooked and tasted terrible I told the waitress as I left most of it. Then came the seafood gratin one of the most ill conceived dishes a chef can create, suffice to say it was poor. Then around 10 the jazz started which for a couple of musicians it was just too loud for a 25% full room. ', "The next day I could still feel the food lying on me, I won't be coming back here anytime soon and it taught me a valuable lesson, don't bother trying to have a decent meal in Canary Wharf. I've been a few times and yet to find somewhere any good."]
title: Poor experience and would not return anytime soon

content: ["Love this place, have lunch and drinks regularly on the 1st floor, the food is great and really reasonably priced, the set menu changes weekly. The best thing about Boisdale is the staff, always efficient and friendly even when the place is packed in the evening. The outside Terrace is an added bonus not to mention the cigar shop....... What's not to like! "]
title: What's not to like !

content: ['A nice place to meet with friends and enjoy fine dining and music, No to mention fine cigars to add to the experience. Offers outside seating on the Terrace and a nice drinks list.']
title: Food, Jazz and fine Cigars

content: ['If you like very noisy restaurants with average food and overpriced drinks this is the place for you. Even allowing for London prices the cocktails were very small for the inflated price.', "We certainly won't hurry back."]
title: Nice enough but nothing special

content: ['This place is absolutely great. ', 'The service the food and the entertainment spot on. ', 'The cigars and whisky are very good I would recommend visiting this place for a great night out. ']
title: Peacepics

answer_text: ['Please email me to discuss your dining experience further Katie@boisdale.co.uk']
content: ['I went to Boisdale yesterday with a colleague and friend for dinner. Firstly, the carpets from the entrance and stairs leading into the restaurant on the second floor had a stale smell. At the entrance, a lady promptly informed us that there would be a £4.50 charge added to our bill to cover the cost of listening to the jazz musician. She then told us to walk in and pick our own table?! - at a restaurant? ', 'We walked into the restaurant and sat at a table at 7.47pm. About two-thirds of the tables were empty and we observed 4 different waiters rushing around in a hurry. After waiting for 15 minutes, We tried to catch the attention of a waiter with no success. ', 'The atmosphere was very odd. We then saw 4 people at one of the tables get up from their table (at the restaurant), and leave, carrying their glasses and bottles of wine out of the restaurant. Probably fed up waiting for service. ', 'At 8.15pm, we still had not been approached by any of the waiters or given menus, so we got up and left after waiting for almost half an hour. ', 'This restaurant has the worst service or should I just say "no service", and appears to be really short staffed. All the staff we observed yesterday, just looked so stressed and exhausted.. including the lady at the door. ', 'I would not go back again or recommend to anyone. If I could, I would give 0 stars on the basis of zero service in half an hour.']
title: Very disappointing - Terrible service, would not return

content: ['Missed my flight and had a couple of hours to kill. The outside terrace is wonderful as were the selection of oysters, wine and a cigar. Latvian lady who served me, believe her name was Eva, was excellent. Will return.']
title: Terrific

content: ['Visited here for combined birthdays as a group of 10. From the start separate lift to go up to the restaurant, walking to reception area full of leather seats and art work to have your drink before lunch. Once everyone is ready walking to your table looking up to the impressive bar full of Scottish wiskeies crowned with a head of wild pig. Waiting staff were all very professional in friendly way. From the bread from the beginning to birthday cake at the end, all the food was very good! If I have to mention something, it is warm coffee I thought was less than avarage compared to good, strong tea in a pot. Also there were 5-6 birthdays, making it bit like "yes, today we dug deep and came to celebrate!" stated all round, but what can I say? Yes, if you have your family visitors to impress in London looking over all the new buildings such as cheese grater, etc, to the background jazz, it\'s a perfect place, but you need a budget of about £50/person for three course, which may not be too bad in London.']
title: Perfect when you need to impress!

content: ['I had a business lunch with an old colleague. Boisdales Canary Wharf has the design and charm of the other two, more old school, sites...although I did find having a view over Canary Wharf a little different - the sunlight came as a shock.', 'The menu is the same wonderful listing of a modern twist on traditional greatness. I had the lamb...which was off the charts great. My guest had the seafood linguini which also went down well. The service was just the right side of close.', 'I have always found Canary Wharf to be a hard place to find a great meal - no more.']
title: Outstanding lunch -now I have been to all three Boisdales and loved them all

content: ['We went there with some colleagues to celebrate the end of the year. The place has an impressive wine list. However, we opted for cocktails and a bottle of rosé Champagne. The atmosphere is really good and the service a bit slow at first, but as soon as we ordered the Champagne, we had all their attention!']
title: Scottish interior with latin terrace.

content: ["Visited on Saturday evening after booking in March. Having read a few negative reviews I'm wondering if those people actually ate here or are only happy when finding fault with something. We arrived to a friendly welcome and were shown directly to our table. Actually couldn't have been happier with where we sat, third table from the stage with plenty of room around us. We enjoyed G&T's while we chose our food and wine. I had the dressed crab which was light and delicious, and hubby had the Haggis with a noggin of whisky. Igor, our amazing waiter, popping up every now and then to refill our wine glasses. For main course I had the salmon with squid and chorizo risotto. It was cooked to perfection and incredibly tasty. I ordered buttered baby potatoes to go with it but needn't have bothered as the dish was beautiful enough on its own. Phil had ribeye steak which tasted amazing, was cooked exactly how he'd asked and just melted in his mouth. We finished our main courses just in time for the band to start playing. Iain Mackenzie and Swing City, a Sinatra and friends tribute band. They were brilliant! We ordered a selection of cheeses and more drinks which we enjoyed listening to the band. We had the BEST night!! The food was great, the band was great, the drinks were great, the bill was a pleasant surprise and Igor was better than great :)) It's lovely to go somewhere and not have to think about whether you fancy another drink because your waiter pre-empted you! ", "To eat in a lovely restaurant while listening/dancing to a live Swing band is something that is on my bucket list, and now I can tick it off. Pleased to say I don't think we could have chosen a better place and have to say that Igor made it even better. Thank you Boisdale, two very happy customers! "]
title: Fabulous night!

content: ['Another great time at this venue. Cannot fault the service you receive, the waiters and waitress are so well trained. food was great too. ']
title: Another great visit

content: ['Absolutly amazing place to have dinner or some drinks while enjoying yourself with a live show. My girlfriend and I bought an offert on the Internet to have some cocktails at the restaurant while we enjoyed some live music. They knew we were going to have some drinks with a couple of vouchers and the staff treatment was absoulutly nice, as if we were going to spend as much money as the guys from the nearest table.', 'We had four cocktails each, really good flavour. We enjoyed the live show, a band playing some soul music. The stuff looked after us the whole time, really polite and with excellent manners. Even the manager came to ask if everything was alright with us, and for sure it was. ', "We didn't go to the restaurant to have dinner but after that we regretted after seeing the menu and the food. It was not as expensive as we thought, you can get good food for a really nice price. And have a nice time with your couple or with your friends. ", 'In short, tasty drinks, good location, and the most important thing, excellent staff.']
title: Eximious place

content: ['decided to go somewhere we could actually here each other speak, nice menu, starters were plentiful a we shared they were so big ', 'Mains lived up to expectations and there was a very reasonable wine list ', 'All in all a really lovely evening would recommend it']
title: Great night spent catching up with friends

content: ['Food was ok, probably just above average for the price. The steak was a nice piece of meat and well cooked. ', 'Cheese board was extensive but it depends on what you choose. ', 'Overall cost was a little expensive and results in a lower star rating. Outlook over the Wharf is a big plus point']
title: Great location and theme

content: ['One of the great things to do in the UK on a Sunday is have a carver lunch. Roast beef, Yorkshire pudding, roasted potatoes, and gravy. If it is done well it is spectacular -- done poorly, you will have so suffer through dense Yorkshire pudding, lumpy gravy, tough meat, and greasy potatoes.', 'The problem is to know where to go because nearly every pub will throw something together to attract the tourists and, like I said, it can be miserable.', 'The Sunday Carvery at Boisdale Canary Wharf is fantastic! Everything about it is great but the enormous, light and fluffy Yorkshire pudding steals the show. If you can manage it, you can get a second slice of roast beef.', 'I had a martini to start which was very nice. The service is fantastic and it is easy to get to via the tube.']
title: Great Sunday Carvery

content: ['Ate in here on a Friday evening with friends. There is I understand a more formal restaurant and menu upstairs and a brasserie style in the bar area.', 'I had the inferno hamburger with a spicy scotch egg and both were excellent. I had a couple of glasses of the Merlot and this made for a great accompaniment.', "The service was nice, I don't remember it being too attentive or lacking. I thought the menu was good value and it is available on their website with the prices.", 'I would certainly dine in the Brasserie section again.']
title: Friday night burger

content: ["We ended up in here in search for late drink after an evening out with friends. We weren't dining so skipped the restaurant which had tables laid for meals facing toward a a small stage. We went downstairs to the bar and enjoyed cocktails, beer and wine - all well received by their recipients. The music upstairs was loud enough for us to decide that we weren't feeling we were missing out - not to my taste. Nuff said.", "The bar is ok but the decor on the whole is bizarre - very loud tartan carpet! I'm not personally in a rush to return here. I think I would explore some of the neighbouring area and find an alternative venue."]
title: Late night drinks

content: ['Recently visited this restaurant on Saturday 9th,first visit as it was a special occasion and had booked early in the week.', "The menu wasn't extensive,but there was a good variety,we had a Crab starter which was very small(£15) and Carpaccio of Venison(£10),main was Lamb(£27) and Chicken Pie(£16) which was again small with additional portions of veg..the wine was ok and desserts lovely..cocktails to begin with weren't the best,biggest gripe about the night was the service,upon entry we were told to see the band would have been an additional charge which we didn't know when booked(£10),the waitress wasn't sure on what the specials were and the waiters seemed to be very new as they looked like they were being shadowed,the whole service was hurried,courses arrived literally as soon as the previous one had finished,no breathing space in between,once courses had been eaten table seemed to be invisible,trying to pay took a while,the venue itself was really relaxing and could easily have spent more time there and stayed to see the act(Frank Sinartra Tribute) if had known in advance,did have a cocktail downstairs in the lounge which was nice.Cost £180 for 2 which as a special treat was expensive and probably would go again but there are better options in the area."]
title: Nice food and Wine/Atmosphere..but why the hurry?

content: ["My Boyfriend and I visited the restaurant last evening, he is obsessed with the offer. On line, Amazon, groupon etc... I am not because generally the restaurant give you a 3rd class service when you are visiting with that deal! But yesterday it didn't happen at all!", 'Since the first minute that we walked into the venue we felt really welcome from the staff. They offered us a really nice table overlooking the fountains in Cabot Square, and they were very attentive to our needs.', 'In Particular an Italian girl, Elisa.', 'She also suggested us to visit the Jazz ', 'Venue upstairs and she offered to book a table ! We were too tired but we will definitely coming back!', 'Thank you for the amazing evening! Also the food was exceeding our expectations !', 'Lara and Abbey']
title: The Perfect Saturday Night

content: ["I've never been in a place like this. The restaurant can hold approximately 300 people, but the costumer is served at the table as if he/she is the only one in the main hall.", 'We enjoyed a really special service, we drank Champagne (reccommended By my niece, a sommelier), Two great wines (one from Argentina and another from Germany) and at the end we chose a whisky from the biggest wall composed of high quality bottles, that I ever seen!!', 'The menù was interesting and various, I can remember a great risotto and a great selection of cheeses with Passito... It was just perfect.', 'The Price is quite high (70 per person), but it worth every pound.']
title: Special place

content: ["We were a party of 6 celebrating a couple of birthdays, we arrived at 7pm and the place was fairly empty which meant we were given a great table for the entertainment (later). Cocktails were very good. Didn't know what to expect food wise, however the food was fantastic, the quality and taste/texture of the beef was amazing, a huge surprise. After a couple of bottles of excellent Malbec the entertainment (soul band) started which was great also, which culminated with most people dancing up by the band, we left about midnight, a great night. Bill for 2 approx GBP 220"]
title: Fantastic quality of food, wished we'd found this place before!

content: ["Went for dinner as a walk-in on a Thursday night. Our waiter was very pretentious and talked down to me (I'm not sure if this is because we didn't book or because we had come straight from work whilst it looked like some others had dressed up especially for dinner?)- either way it was unacceptable and put a massive dampener on the evening. ", 'I ordered the chicken and mushroom pie which literally had only 2 tiny pieces of chicken in it- the rest was mushroom and dry pastry. Not great for £20. There was a surcharge of £30 for the 4 of us for the live jazz that stated at 9.15pm which was ok given we were told when we entered. ', 'Will definitely not be returning which is a shame given we live a 5 minute walk away and the actual restaurant looks very nice.']
title: Snobbish staff and poor quality meals

content: ['A vendor took me to Boisdale for dinner.', 'The greeting was a bit pompous, but when we got to the table the atmosphere was very good and the table staff excellent.', 'The menu, especially the starters where very fish orientated. There are some vegetarian options but it appeared tome the restaurant is focused on fish then meat with a few vegetarian options thrown in.', 'The puddings where excellent.']
title: Good place for a upmarket business meeting

content: ["A wonderful long lunch (the way they should be) with luscious wine, great steaks and warm surroundings. Service was just the best - much better than other restaurants in Canary Wharf I've also visited.Great private rooms and a fabulous long bar with more whisky than I've ever seen in my life in one bar."]
title: Perfect lunch with loads of space and super quality service

content: ['We had a very enjoyable evening last night at Boisdale. Delicious food, attentive service and lovely wine. My husband and son and I had been to Boisdale, always on a Monday evening. This was now our 3rd time. The first 2 times we simply booked our table online, there were no "tickets" to buy. We had lovely seats and enjoyed the music However, this time, we were required to buy a ticket for a table. We chose the 14.50 GBP per ticket price for a guaranteed seat. The other 2 Monday nights when Eric Ranzoni played, we did not have to buy any tickets. So we asked the manager to clarify, as the artist last night was no better than Eric - it wasn\'t a "special" concert that would warrant an extra 14.50 per person. He basically said he would never pay 14.50 on a Monday night as it is quiet, and we should have just "turned up to get the best seat." I believe we should have been credited that 58.00 GBP\'s - especially with spending over 335.00 GBP\'s for dinner! Not good customer service at all from the manager!!']
title: Great food and service, BUT.......

answer_text: ['Hi RickyTracey', '\xa0', 'Thank you for taking the time out to give us your feedback following your recent visit.', 'Regarding to your\xa0dinner with us I am obviously very concerned and I have spoken with our team \xa0to ensure that this does not occur again. We are proud of the reputation we have created and so it hurts when we hear of the kind of\xa0mistakes\xa0that occurred\xa0at your\xa0table.', '\xa0', 'Please contact us directly to gm@boisdale-cw.co.uk if you wish to discuss your experience further. ', '\xa0', 'If I can be of any further assistance, please do not hesitate to contact me.\u2028\xa0\u2028I look forward to welcoming you to our restaurant.', 'Warm regards,', 'Sergei Gubars', 'General Manager']
content: ["I am a great advocate of Boisdales, we booked for 7 for Fleetwood Bac and were looking forward to it (8th time we have visited). The food was good but served so quickly we didn't draw breath, it felt as though they just wanted to get it done rather than we could enjoy the experience, our desert turned up before our table had been reset and it was all rather amateurish. Following our meal our service stopped. we served our own wine and if we wanted a drink tried to order from a passing waiter which meant it did not turn up. My Brother ordered a whisky 4 times before a young girl slammed a glass down on the table in front of him. I discussed our experience with the manager who was pleasant enough and removed the service charge. It really wasn't about the cost it was about our evening being ruined. To sum up I am so disappointed because this was my favourite place and it isn't any more."]
title: so disappointed

content: ['We went for the 2 course sharing menu on a Friday night. The oysters were to die for and the steak was PERFECTION. The view over the fountain and the band turned this into one of the best night ever! Small hicup with desert order was rectified quickly and very efficiently. VERY HAPPY CUSTOMER will be back soon.']
title: Brilliant

content: ['Went here for a evening of music and food. The music was very good and the tables/atmosphere was excellent.', 'Unfortunately for the price, this place lets itself down. Although our main were great, we ordered a side of mashed potato that was just warm with no taste - it had the texture and taste that is was cooked some hours earlier and left in an oven to stay warm.', 'Wine - we ordered a second bottle of wine and the waitress topped up our glasses - mixing the previous wine with the second (different) bottle. This may not bother some people - but when you buying expensive wine, you want to be able to taste the wine.', 'The place needs to look at the details and it could be an absolute gem.']
title: Could be so much better

content: ['Went in for dinner. Starter was very good (quails scotch eggs). But serving seared fillet of Scottish salmon that is raw in the middle (and Luke warm) with cold mash? Terrible. Sent it back and had a classic burger with fries. Burger tasteless - but I wanted fish! Not good ']
title: Not good

content: ["I have been there three times. They have theme nights with live band. We have done soul night, Bob Marley night and Luther night. All very fun nights with dancing. We Loved it each time. The food and service was good too. Lovely rib eye steak and the sticky toffee pudding is delicious. Cocktails nice too. I recommend this place as a fun night out. It's not cheap but is good quality and definitely entertaining with lively food."]
title: Enjoyable experience

content: ['Wandering around after a long day I fancied dinner and was recommended this restaurant by canary wharf mall employees.', 'Upon arrival I had a look at their menu (lovely appetising range of food locally sourced) they had an offer clipped onto the main menu with a Set Menu. Which unfortunately offered only starters and mains as an option and Not mains and desserts. That was a little disappointing, but I fancied just the steak which I was told I could have alone for £29!(?)', 'Considering that the two course set menu was £20, including the £8 supplement for the meat, it was a little insulting to have to pay more for not having a starter! I asked if I could swap the starter for a dessert and I was told that the chef wanted the offer to be this one. Very unaccomodating for an empty venue on a Monday evening. I left to browse different options, ended up meeting an old friend that works locally and he suggested we try the set menu. I called the restaurant to make a reservation and was told the set menu had to be booked online! And online only..As they just serve the a la carte menu to the public, obviously untrue as I had just been there a moment ago. I was truly taken back by this.', 'Discouraged by being bullied into booking via a website when they have a piece of paper with the offer attached to their menu and being just 5minutes away, I gave up and went elsewhere instead.', 'Not the experience I was told I would have. A shame as the venue was beautiful and the menu enticing.']
title: dissapointing

content: ["I love this place. I'm a Scot so was dubious about how good it would be but I was most certainly pleasantly surprised. Had the oysters and the haggis! Great service , great food!"]
title: Fabulous!

content: ['While looking around Canary Wharf one Saturday evening, we came across this place which looked really nice.', "We went up to the second floor (where the food is accompanied by live music) to be told the tables were all booked so we were escorted downstairs and handed over to the other Maitre d' (who looks like Piers Morgan). ", 'The bar menu (which we were given to choose from) was a little confusing and appeared to have more beetroot than any other menu I have seen, but a quick chat with the lovely Elisa clarified things for us.', "With her assistance, we chose the Charcuterie sharing board, with a Scotch Hens Egg with haggis, and a spicy scotch quail egg each along with the olives. The olives weren't fantastic and we could have done without them, but the rest was extra special.", "For our mains, I had the Inferno burger and the green salad. The burger was indeed quite hot and tasty. I had the extra cheese and bacon, but it really didn't need the bacon. The salad was wonderful - lots of fresh herbs with a yummy dressing. My fiance had the chicken, which he enjoyed.", "To wash this down, we chose the Terra Milenaria Rioja and finished with two amaretto coffees. All in all, it was a very pleasant meal made all the better by Elisa's service."]
title: Reasonable compromise

answer_text: ['Dear Elvira Nikolova', 'Thank you for your kind review. We sincerely hope that you will visit us in the future.', 'Warmest regards,', 'Sergei Gubars', 'General Manager']
content: ['Words cannot describe the atmosphere in this jewel of the fine dining. From food, through interrior and views to staff everything is excellent. ', 'The music will be loved and even from people that do not like jazz!', 'Personally recommend the oysters! Looking forward to go back.']
title: The place to go!

content: ["This branch is a pale lowland cousin of it's spirited highland eccentric uncle near Victoria. that said the food was well presented if a little stingy in portion size. It was OK, but not really special. "]
title: Sterile tartan clad cuisine

content: ['Great service, great atmosphere, great wine and great food at a reasonablish price. Not the cheapest night out. ']
title: All round great

answer_text: ['Dear Brightredangel,', 'Hopefully nothing will go wrong! I hope to welcome you back again soon & thank you for posting your comments. ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['Oh, jazz, great people, great food, a well stocked bar with an extensive wine and whisky list and music of top of all that, what could go wrong?']
title: Jazz

answer_text: ['Dear JonathanRB,', 'Thank you for your kind review. I am delighted you enjoyed our 2course set lunch for £11.95 on the 1st floor Bar & Grill. The menu changes weekly, so be sure to revisit soon!', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['We had the set 2 course menu in the grill/bar area of this restaurant (the larger restaurant has live music and a more up-market menu). The set course menu was excellent value for money with a good selection. Between us we had most of the menu options and all my friends enjoyed the food. The deserts were not included in the set menu but are worth paying extra for (we had an amazing one). We will definately be going back.']
title: Excellent set menu

content: ['I have been at least 10 times to Boisdale in Canary Wharf and normally it is good enough. But on this occasion the restaurant was virtually empty at lunchtime and the food was simply far too expensive for what we got. The service was proficient and friendly but with starters at £16 and mains in the high £30s, it just felt a bit toppy. This Boisdales is nothing like as good as the one in Victoria which had a wonderful clubby atmosphere. Finally, I have mentioned this before but please will the restaurant sort out the really nasty smell that greets you on arrival at reception.']
title: average

content: ['The 1st floor bar and 2nd floor restaurant look amazing, in an enviable spot overlooking the fountain at Canary Wharf, but it all ends there really. In the bar when we arrived there were 4 or 5 staff and none said hello or took our drinks order. When they eventually did the barman didnt seem to know how to mix a Cosmoplitan and took ages. Dirty glasses were not cleared away from where we were sitting even thugh we were the only people in there. In the restaurant, our order was taken by a stroppy waiter. Ten minutes later he returned to say they did not now have the dish my friend ordered. Twenty minutes after that they came to say they had run out of my dish as well. I complained and they gave me another main course for free. The steak was probably the worst i have ever had. All vegetables and even potatoes are extra cost. The singer was nice, A bit twee. Dont go.']
title: Fur coat, no nickers

content: ["This place was recommended to me by a work colleague so I thought I would check it out when my family came from Scotland to visit. We were all really impressed with the service and the general ambiance. My dad enjoyed a cigar on the terrace - quite the novelty! The steaks and the fish of the day in particular were a real hit! We enjoyed it while listening to really good live jazz music! Again...what a novelty! I don't think I know another place like it in London. All in all it is safe to say we will be back. A terrific night was had by all! "]
title: Taste of home!

content: ['I have several times here and never been disapointed.', 'Food is very good and expensive, wine list the same.', 'Service really warm and helpfull', 'We were there on Saturday night with a Jazz concert, it was really enjoyable.', 'Highly recommended if you have spare £ to spend']
title: One of my favorite in CW

content: ['My husband took me on a date to Boisdale, as he had heard through a colleague, how good it was, so we thought we would try it out. We are so glad we did! The staff were just amazing and the food really spoke for itself. Stunning fish which was cooked to perfection.The choices amazing....The jazz was such a great touch and the atmosphere was right up our street..Just loved the whole experience...We will so be back... Thank you Boisdale, for making our night.']
title: An absolute delight

content: ["It's always a bit too empty to have an atmosphere, except on the terrace in summer. However the food, service, and views are excellent."]
title: Decent food, weird atmosphere

content: ["I came here with the 50% off ala carte menu but still felt it was not really worth what I paid for. I cannot comment on the other dishes other than mine since I did not really try the rest. However, for £24 for a steak with nothing on the side is not worth it. The steak was average with a a big price tag, I've had better steak elsewhere for about the same price or cheaper but sure made me smile. I ordered blue but it came somewhere close to medium, maybe medium rare but more to the medium side. I would have asked to re-fire a steak but with the company I was with, I did not want to make a fuss. To be honest, how can a blue steak turn medium, if it was rare would have still been excusable. Chips tasted familiar too.", "All in all, just an OK experience, but I wouldn't come back for more."]
title: Just alright, poor value for money

answer_text: ['Dear england201516,', 'I am very pleased you had such a great time and the team were able to look after you so well. ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['hi its us from folkestone we really enjoyed our time in your restrant all the staff are so helpfull epecialy Gabor Gervis and you cant forget the great Elisa thank you all see you soon x for elisa']
title: great

answer_text: ['Dear Ryan B,', 'Thank you for taking the time to write your thoughts. Am was sorry to hear that the service was slow on this occasion and that you had to wait for your drinks. We work hard to deliver excellent service, and I am disappointed to have not delivered. To clarify the music timings, the bands start at 7pm on Monday & Tuesday, 9pm on Wednesday & Thursday while Friday & Saturday the shows start at 9:45pm. Hopefully you will let us know under manager@boisdale-cw.co.uk if you plan to return so we may restore your faith in us. ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['I brought my team here for dinner one night while staying over in London for business. We arrived about 1900 and got a nice table overlooking the fountain with a view of the Thames in the distance and were told that a live jazz band would start around 2000. We ordered drinks, appetizers and a main and that took easily 2 hours. During this time there was no band. We ordered dessert which took another hour and finally the band showed up. The service was extremely slow as it was a busy night, but the food was very good (the mini haggis as an app was great). The wine and cocktail list was also extensive and we would have indulged more had we not had to wait 25 minutes for a drink. I also noticed while paying the bill they charged us each a cover charge for the band which didn’t seem right after we only heard them for a few minutes as they were very late. Anyway, it was a nice place they just need to improve the speed of their service and keep their bands on time.']
title: Good atmosphere, slow service

answer_text: ['Dear CosmicCarrot,', 'Thank you for taking the time to write. As you find it difficult to put your finger on ‘it’ I also am sure you should visit us on a Tuesday or Wednesday evening when the atmosphere is most like the original? Let me know your thoughts…', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ["It's the city-life atmosphere and the views that make this restaurant. The food and service are excellent, too. The question for me is, would I go back? In truth, I wouldn't go out of my way to go here, no. It was a 'nice' experience but I can't say there's anything outstanding or particularly enchanting about the visit. We had champagne, we had a variety of oysters. Everything arrived swiftly and looked fresh and tasty. It's pricey, yes, but I would expect no less of a traditional-like restaurant in the wharf. If I were going to to the city for a business meeting, this would be an excellent place to wine and dine a client, or to unwind after a busy day. The food and wine selection is impressive, and it was a generally positive experience. ", "So, what's wrong? It's hard to put my finger on it. I feel the place lacks soul. But maybe that's a wharf thing. On the other hand, I have been to a few places in the same neighbourhood that has the kind of energy that makes you know there is love in the food. Am I being overly sentimental? Sometimes there is a fine line between a deceptively good copy and the down-home real thing."]
title: It's fine, it's ok, really

answer_text: ['Dear FrequentFlyerEater89,', 'Thank you for your review and for your comments. Perhaps I can persuade you to come and visit us for evening drinks in the whisky bar. The atmosphere of the room changes quite drastically in the evenings and we receive excellent feedback for the ambience and drinks we serve. ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ["I came here for a business lunch, but I wouldn't come here for a social occasion. The restaurant has a slightly cold and impersonal feel, in my opinion, especially when you compare it with a more intimate steak venue such as Goodman. ", 'We had the steak tartar, which was nice enough. The wine was very good, and the service efficient and friendly. ', "I would recommend the restaurant for a business lunch but I couldn't see myself coming here for anything else. "]
title: Decent enough for a business lunch

answer_text: ['Dear Mike O,', 'Please contact us directly under manager@boisdale-cw.co.uk if you wish to discuss your experience further. ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['Joined a party at Boisedale at Canary Wharf. Posted this review about Boisedale in Belgravia by mistake. Went to Canary Wharf on a Saturday night. Poor service, poor wine, starter of beetroot and goats cheese nearly all beetroot, desert of rhubarb crumble inedible. When complained about a bottle of wine that was clearly off I was told that French wine is variable! All this for £100 per person!']
title: Poor

answer_text: ['Dear Steve B,', 'I am delighted you had such a lovely evening and we all look forward to welcoming you again back soon! ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ["Having a great night tonight. Here I am live on a Saturday night in Boisdales in Canary Wharf and I'd like to say what a thoroughly enjoyable evening I'm having. In recent times the steaks haven't been great, but tonight they were perfect!!! Special mention to Igor our great waiter and an even more special mention to Seb, who has always irritated the hell out of me for his obnoxious behaviour in recent times but tonight he was exemplary. Thank you Seb and thank you to all the fantastic staff at Boisdales. Well done guys. I just hope my friend gets some special attention because it's her birthday ;-)"]
title: Back to its best - even Seb!!

answer_text: ['Dear nwk84,', 'Thank you for your comments I am delighted you enjoyed our fabulous Truffle Burger! I hope to welcome you again soon. ', 'Warmest regards,']
content: ['Excellent for business lunch. Hefty and very delicious burger. Nice Scottish setting and very good service']
title: Excellent

answer_text: ['Dear VikingRider_10,', 'I am delighted you had such a fabulous time with us. We all look forward to welcoming you again soon. ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['We spent a most enjoyable evening at Boisdales in Canary Wharf at a charity event. The main performer was Jools Holland, he was brilliant and the atmosphere in the restaurant was electric. The food offered was superb bearing in mind that they were catering for around 250 guests. The Scottish steaks simply melted in your mouth, they were cooked to perfection. The cheese board was sensational and the service all evening was second to none. Boisdale ...keep up those excellent standards, well done.']
title: Marvellous..must come again!

answer_text: ['Dear dave187,', 'Thank you for reviewing us. I am pleased to hear that you were moved to another table but concerned that you were subsequently disturb by other customers. Having reviewed the evening we will ensure sufficient space between diners & drinking customers and have additionally highlighted on our website music performances that with generate a livelier atmosphere in the room. Hopefully we are able to welcome you again. ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ["Went there on the 20 march for a music night , paid for a standard view dining table got put on a table with a big pillar in front of it had to lean forward to see the stage, so I complained to the girls on reception as I said this was a restricted view table , I got moved to a better table but then had people at the bar behind us later on in the evening invading our space , couldn't move again as no tables left. Marks out of ten I'll give it 2"]
title: Query your table

answer_text: ['Dear plodsquad,', 'Thank you for your review. I am disappointed to hear you did not enjoy your evening as much as hoped. We have since added further information regarding evenings where we anticipate a livelier atmosphere so you may make a more informed choice of tickets. Please contact us under manager@boisdale-cw.co.uk should you wish to discuss further. ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ["Wanted a romantic evening with the lady got a table at the front then had what seemed like people from a Yates wine lodge barging past us so they could dance. Spent £80 on the table couldn't see the musicians and got agro from someone who tried to barge passed me. We left early if you're thinking of splashing out on a premium table don't it's a massive waste of money. I am not recommending this to anyone."]
title: Don't pay for a premium seats for a music show

answer_text: ['Dear Rancidrick,', 'I am delighted you have had a great night with us. While it is entirely possible to go for the finer things in life, we try to cater for everybody so it is equally possible to dine for under £50 per person and still have an excellent time, the choice is yours really. Until next time! ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['We booked a premium seat next to the stage and had one of the best nights we have had in a very long time. The service was attentive and helpful, the food was without any exception excellent ( wife had crab, new york strip and a marquis. I had haggis, fillet on the bone and cheese board). Buddy whittington and his band were amazing. Boisdale definitely attract the best talent. The cocktails were made perfectly, the whisky and rum selections were delicious and so was the wine. The atmosphere was truly unique and took my to the live blues albums i have listened to over the years. Be warned..... This is not a cheap night (£300 plus.....). But for a special occasion if you are a foodie and music lover, very hard to top.']
title: Atmosphere, food, music, brilliant!!!

answer_text: ['Dear RickyTracey,', 'Thank you yet again for such a lovely review. I am delighted Neha and Marco were able to make you visit that little bit more special and hope to welcome you again! As you know the two will receive a little gift as a thank you for looking after you so well. Hopefully until very soon.', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['The staff here know how to treat you. Customer service is fantastic, I made a booking blunder and Nia (spelling??) sorted it for us and we had a fab night. Bob Marley tribute was wonderful and Marco waited on us with a professionalism and friendliness which it would be hard to beat. six of us had the rib eye which was cooked to perfection, orders ranged from blue to well done !!!!']
title: Again just fabulous

answer_text: ['Dear Steve M,', 'Thank you for your review. Please contact me directly under falko@boisdale-cw.co.uk. I would love extra information on the service you had received as this is not the standard we set ourselves.', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ["Only went to bar for a few drinks but this is a good venue by Canary Wharf standards. Good mix of clientele and a refreshing change from most of the bland venues there. They actually serve proper beer as well. Nice views at nighttime (by the wharfs standards). Only downer was bar service a bit poor - one guy was quite surly even though he wasn't busy. Definitely going back to try out restaurant "]
title: Good place for evening drinks

content: ["I never get around to writing a review!, but on this occasion it's a must!", 'From the minute I entered into the stunning restaurant I felt I had gone back in time to old school glamour!.', 'We were shown to our table which was right by the stage. ', 'We were shown the wine menu and also the cocktail menu.', 'After choosing our wine and cocktails, we expected a wait as the resturant was extremely busy', 'After only a few minutes our cocktails arrived and the wine which was placed in a wine stand/ ice bucket ', 'I have been to many restaurants where unfortunately you have to ask for the wine cooler.', 'Our waiter ( forgot his name!, was really attentive, but not overly)', "I love simple things like the wine / water being topped up. It's just the little things that makes you feel you are in a special environment. The waiter was lovely, very charming and attentive.", 'Our starters arrived quickly ', 'I chose the potted Mackrel pâté, which was divine. ', 'We chose different steaks and I have to say my steak was like velvet, just mouthwatering tender and full of flavour', 'The side dishes were small, but flavoured really well.', "We didn't have desert as we were so full, but ordered another bottle of wine!", 'The band/ singers came on after an hour of us dinning and it was the best two hours I have had in a long time ', 'The singers were fabulous and all the restaurant were hooked on watching and almost immediately half the restaurant got up and danced!', "The venue is beautifully decorated and boasts a beautiful bar with 100's of whiskies on display ", 'It was an amazing atmosphere and lovely seeing couples dancing together ( some were really good!)', "It's great to have a venue, where you can dine, watch a band/ singers and dance all under one roof!", 'I am so happy to have found this gem.', "It's a place I would say for couples and you could go with a group of friends. ", 'A fantastic venue for a special occasion .', "There were lots of different ages, it was nice to see people our age group 40's!", ' ( just leave kids at home!) ', 'I have read other reviews and some say its expensive ', "I think it's worth every penny and in line with most venues in London. ", 'One more thing, you have to go take a look at the cigar room', 'I ended up buying some and you can even smoke a cigar in the special room!', "I can't wait to go back again!", '( I work in the hospitality industry and I am always critical over venues, this one I can honestly say is amazing!)', 'Lovely goodey bag we received too ', 'Thank you we had a great night!']
title: Fantastic!

answer_text: ['Dear Chrislovesitaly,', 'I am delighted the team was able to look after you so well and make your present special. Please let us know when you plan on returning so we can say thank you personally for your lovely review.', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['We were introduced to Boisdale by our (Grown up) sons who treated us to meal here as a joint Christmas Present. After research we decided to chose the Canary Wharf Boisdale as it had the best reviews and we thought that the venue would be the best for the entertainment as the other Boisdales looked smaller.', 'We visited on Saturday 21st and saw the incredible Steven Triffitt and his incredible orchestra for which we paid extra for - it was SO worth it.', "The atmosphere of the club was sexy and romantic with red walls adorned with sexy photos and photographs of famous jazz people (although I didn't quite understand why there were pictures of Mao Tse Tung?). ", "We arrived early but were shown straight to our table with no problem and from then on were looked after so well. We chose a standard view table but had a perfect view, not too near the front, or too far back. Our waiter served us with excellent timing and we enjoyed excellent quality food. We thoroughly enjoyed our evening and would love to return for another special occasion. The whole evening was pretty costly for an everyday occurrence but we didn't feel ripped off...on the contrary the evening was good value for a great experience.", 'The waiters work so hard ... they definitely deserve their tips at the end of the evening!']
title: Fantastic Food, Great Bar and Excellent Entertainment

answer_text: ['Dear GaroKiwi,', 'I am delighted you had such a great evening with us and hope to welcome you again soon!', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['We went for my birthday and we were nicely seated at the front. I was afraid it would be very noisy, but it was perfect. The staff was very attentive, the food was nice (nothing super special), but the wine and whisky lists are just unbelievable! We finished at the bar after the concert, and the barman was the best. Such a knowledge about whiskeys, it will blow your mind! Such a great place to discover new things, musically and spiritually ;)']
title: Great concert, best whisky bar ever!

answer_text: ['Dear Ibadanboy,', 'Thank you for another lovely review. I am delighted that you enjoyed the show. It was about time to have Mica back. Look out for more great night, like our upcoming evening with Jools Holland on the 19th March. Visit our website for more information.', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['Just got home after dinner at Boisdale. Mica brought the house down. An excellent performance. As always, the food and service at Boisdale were great. However, tonight, the star of the show was Mica. My friend & I had a most wonderful evening. Boisdale Canary Wharf is fast becoming one of the preferred jazz/ live music venues in London. Most highly recommended!!!']
title: Mica Paris at Boisdale CW

answer_text: ['Dear John V,', 'Thank you for joining and for posting your thoughts. I am delighted you had a good time with your friends on our terrace. I was a irked to hear you thought our cigar sommelier impatient, I will speak to him regarding the incident, however I have so far only ever received positive feedback. Hopefully we will be able to welcome you again soon. ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ["Visited Boisdale with a group of friends to have a drink and smoke (unfortunately I haven't dined in the Scottish restaurant yet). ", "If you're seriously into alcohol or cigars, this is definitely the place to be! The list of both cigars and drinks are endless and range from all different prices. ", 'They have a fairly sized humidor and someone is there to assist you in selecting your cigar(s). We had a couple at different price ranges, from £25 - £40 but you obviously pay for what you get! ', "The first floor is the terrace where you can smoke outdoors. We went in good weather so I'm not sure if heaters are available during the colder seasons. The view is not amazing, especially if you already work in canary wharf. It is located in Cabot square, overlooking a central water fountain and 2 large office buildings. ", 'For smokers, you can ask for a free cutter, or the cigar staff will cut your cigars for you. They also provide free matches. ', "Overall I would say drinks are fairly priced for London and cigars a bit on the expensive side. You can always bring your own! Staff are lovely aside from the assistant working in the humidor. They can become impatient, especially if you're new to cigars and unsure what to try first. ", "I would definitely revisit and would recommend it to others - don't expect to have a good cigar experience on the cheap. "]
title: A humidor, cigars and a tonne of alcohol

answer_text: ['Dear Nick W,', 'I am delighted you have given us the opportunity to restore your faith in us and that we were able to deliver. I look forward to welcoming you again soon! ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['I have been here before and was disappointed but not this time _ we were invited for lunch which was served quickly and in a friendly fashion. I started with the dressed crab - well presented and tasty. My main of Shetland cod was excellent not so much for the cod but for the shrimp garnish - really fresh , small and tasty shrimps which set off the subtlety of the fish perfectly. We will return and start bringing our own clients here at this standard of delivery ']
title: Very Good business lunch

answer_text: ['Dear Janetrngr,', 'Thank you for taking the time to write a review. I am thrilled the team looked after you and made you feel so welcome.', 'We look forward to seeing you again very soon.', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['The entire evening was wonderful. The atmosphere, in both the bar and then the restaurant, was fantastic. Very warm and welcoming. The food was lovely, although a bit pricey. The entertainment was beyond our expectations. Highly recommended! Try it.']
title: Fantastic night, a hugely pleasant surprise!

answer_text: ['Dear artyrach22,', 'I am saddened to read of your experience and would love to receive a little more detail. Please contact me directly under falko@boisdale-cw.co.uk. I would like to investigate your evening further. ', 'Warm regards,', 'Falko']
content: ["We waited half an hour to be asked for orders, it took an hour for the food to come and then it took nearly an hour for us to receive the bill. I mentioned the slowness of the service to our waiter and was met with a frosty reply. Other customers had come in, ordered, eaten paid and left by the time we receieved our food. I have no idea why we were treated with such snobbery but, quite frankly, this was the worst experience I have ever had in a restaurant. The food wasn't particularly special when we did get it and the atmosphere felt very fake."]
title: Worst service I've ever experienced

answer_text: ['Dear RealNeilH,', 'I am delighted you enjoyed the Buddy Whittington show. I have had some great feedback form that night and I am sure he will be back to visit again. ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['We booked a premium seat at Boisdale mainly to see Buddy Whittington, who was as ever brilliant.We were very pleased with the standard of food and of the service.All in all a great evening at an affordable price,we WILL be back.']
title: Buddy Whittington and great food

answer_text: ['Dear Jon L,', 'I have passed your comments on to our head chef who has already taken remedial action. Any feedback is greatly appreciated and will help to improve us constantly. I was delighted to hear you enjoyed the service from the team. We did have a cancellation from the band hand contacted all reservations made beforehand to inform them of the change of entertainment offering them a refund of tickets or a transfer to another date should they not have wanted to join us on this occasion. The charge for the music is designed to only cover the acts cost. We have always been clear that music will be charged and you would have been informed of a music charge. If this was not the case I apologise profusely; a quick mention to the manager on duty could have resolved any issue on the night. Please contact me directly should you wish to visit again and help us restore your faith in us.', 'Warm regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['I visited on a Friday evening with some friends, table booked at 7.30pm. As with previous visits to Boisdales the appearance of the restaurant cannot fail to impress – the table are beautifully set out and the range of glasses shine out like an array of crystals. The staff are very friendly and attentive, service was just at the right pace. My concern was really the quality of the food. I had the Haggis for starter which was tasty but the “noggin” of whiskey for £5 extra was frankly laughable – drink it quick before it evaporates! I chose the burger for main course, got to say disappointing – tasteless, tough mushroom and the hand cut chips looked more like your freezer chips over cooked. My Rhubarb and custard desert was I afraid uninspiring as well. Drinks are hugely expensive - £30 for a £7 bottle of supermarket white wine. The band came on about 9.45am and despite spending £140 per couple we incurred £7.50 a head extra on the bill to listen to the band. Not the advertised band, very good in their own right but not a bit of Jazz in sight – more like band from a wedding bashing through family standards. Overall a lovely place to experience but don’t except the food or drinks to be good value for money.']
title: Style over Substance

answer_text: ['Dear MrRommie,', 'I was disappointed to read that the service on this occasion did not live up to the standards we set ourselves. Our wine list is very extensive & while we aim have all items available at all times it may be possible that we have sold out on the night. As for the service I would be grateful for any additional information. Please contact me directly under falko@boisdale-cw.co.uk. ', 'Warm regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['Great venue in terms of internadesign. Fantastic whisky bar, with a lot to choose from. Unfortunately food was average and the fact that wine list contained items which were not available was what made my note lower. On top of that waiter told me that the wine I happened to choose was not very popular and that is why it was not available. Pricey. Live jazz music was good, improved atmosphere. Service slow and not attentive.']
title: Expected better

answer_text: ['Dear Agniukas', 'Thank you for taking the time to write your review. I am pleased that the team looked after you so well. Hopefully we will be able to welcome you back very soon.', 'Warm regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['Went there for couple drinks on bussy friday night and was amazed by the atmosphere and customer service at this place. Can not recommend the food since I have not tried but the drinks are good value buy.']
title: The most cosy atmosphere in Canary Wharf.

answer_text: ['Dear Boycee9876,', 'Thank you for your review. We aim to have many varieties of food and drink available. There are many options on the menu and it is possible to have a three course meal for under £35 pounds. Additionally our wine list offers 6 bottles under £30. Naturally when opting for finer things in life as our dry-aged Aberdeen beef it will come at a dearer price point. I was sorry to hear about the confusion with the music ticket. We have some of the finest UK performers on our stage every evening of the week and much like going to a theatre you buy a ticket to see the performance. Hopefully this clarifies your concerns and I hope we will be able to welcome you back. ', 'Warm regards,', 'Falko']
content: ["We visited the restaurant on Saturday for the Frank Sinatra evening. Music was excellant. There was an advanced charge for the performance then an overall menu charge for food & drinks. We expected the advanced charge to be deducted from our bill on the evening, but sadly wasn't, it was an extra charge for the performance only.", "This charge aside we felt the food bill was too high for quite a standard menu At £140.00 per head all in, we all thought it was overpriced and felt it's not a restaurant we would go back to. "]
title: Overpriced

answer_text: ['Dear DiddyDoddyDave,', 'Thank you for your fabulous review. I am delighted you had a great time. The tables in from of the stage are mostly taken by customers who want to be the first on the dance floor. During the week this should never affect viewing however on weekends the danceable music can result in plenty of dancing throughout the restaurant. Hopefully we will see you soon.', 'Warm regards,', 'Falko']
content: ["I love this place! I have been here on a few occasions and each time it's been a brilliant all consuming evening. Boisdales is set in Docklands and it has everything. There's a terrace with a fantastic view of Canary Wharf; a wonderful bar area on entrance; and a whiskey bar to die for, which is set into into the main dining area. The dining area itself is a truly stunning set up, full of buzz and atmosphere, with efficient waiters darting about. Then the food... absolute top quality... the Rib Eye Steak was divine. But to top it all, there's entertainment from 9.30 pm and an area in which to dance to set the evening off. Yes, it's expensive... But it's definitely worth it. An evening you won't forget. PS. Top tip... Get a table away from the stage, no one ever seems happy there, normally crushed by dancers!"]
title: Love life - love Boisdales!

answer_text: ['Dear Kay24762,', 'Thank you for your review, even though it was made for all the wrong treasons on this occasion. I have already been in contact with one of your party and am investigating the incident. I was encouraged that the duty manager took your feedback and reacted. Hopefully we will be able to restore your faith in us.', 'Warm regards,', 'Falko']
content: ["I have just experienced a very disappointing lunch at boisdales , not only was the the menu misleading , the service staff who albeit tried there best was just about satisfactory , the food came out cold and the sides didn't even materialise . After complaining to the manager all the food was sent back and fresh food was then brought back to us . we were given 2 bottle of prosecco on the house , I definatly won't be going back ."]
title: A very disappointing lunch

answer_text: ['Dear mikepaterson,', 'Thank you for your review, I am delighted that you had such a great time with us. The cigar library has been very popular recently and I have spoken with the team there was an unusually high amount of customers exiting & entering the library resulting in more than usual seepage of smoke. This has been addressed and should not reoccur in future. ', 'Warm regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['We took business partners out for a meal to the Boisdale. Despite being In the heart of Canary Wharf, it looks as if it would have not been out of place on the Titanic. The service was very good, and the steak served on the bone was fantastic. The selection of whiskies filled a complete book. They also have a cigar room, and unfortunately the cigar smoke smell had rather pervaded the restaurant too. Great view out of the window too, and live jazz later in the evening.']
title: Old world decor, great service, quality food and so many whiskies!

answer_text: ['Dear SatEats,', 'Thank you for your kind review. I am delighted you enjoyed your evening & the entertainment of the lovely Atlantic Soul Orchestra. Hopefully we are able to welcome you back very soon, so check our website for all the information on upcoming bands. ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['I recently visited on Friday 13th Feb for an early valentines dinner. We enjoyed starters, mains and 2 cocktails each for £89, which represented good value when considering the quality of what we were served. I would recommend the Daiquiris and the gnocchi in particular. Additionally, we had paid an initial £25 each cover charge and the entertainment, provided by the smooth sounds of the Atlantic Soul Orchestra did not disappoint. Overall, a lovely ambience and although an expensive evening out, it was a memorable valentines for all the right reasons.']
title: A perfect valentines

answer_text: ['Dear Gil J,', 'I am thrilled you had such an amazing time & the team were able to look after you so well. Gintare & Rocio will both be receiving a little present as a thank you; something we do when members of the team are mentioned in despatches. Hopefully we can welcome you again very soon. ', 'Warm regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['Boisdale definitely does not disappoint! It exceeds expectations! ', "From the very efficient and informative booking process over the phone with Gintaria who was indeed very pleasant to deal with all the way until the end of the experience, I have nothing but great things to say. My guest being a vegan, I informed the restaurant when booking the table. I was reassured to hear that it wasn't a problem. On the night she was offered a choice of several starters, main courses and flavors of sorbet for dessert. We both thoroughly enjoyed our food which was spot on. Trying my friend's dish I was surprised to realise that vegan food can be so tasty! (A stew with lentils, truffles, broccoli and more...). The musical entertainment was also excellent with a tribute to Buena Vista Social Club by talented musicians and charismatic singer. Finally the overall experience was enhanced by a fantastic service and a lovely Spanish waitress (sorry forgot her name) who kept a close eye on our satisfaction and offered just the right amount of presence.", 'Across the board a great experience with a very dedicated team from chef, reservation, reception and waiting staff who are no short of efforts to make your evening special.', 'We will most definitely be back.']
title: GREAT! committed to accommodate and exceed expectations.

answer_text: ['Dear RinaAK,', 'I was disappointed to read we did not live up to the standards we set ourselves this time & apologise sincerely. This is out of the ordinary and very unusual. Hopefully you will return once more and we can restore your faith in us. ', 'Warm regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['I was really looking forward to this experience and took my client for lunch. Service was slow, snail paced. 30 minutes for green tea and coffee and after reminding them. Overpriced steaks particularly given portion size. Nothing special. Chips were burnt. superfood salad was not bad. Overall disappointing experience.']
title: Overpriced, tiny pieces of stake and bad service

answer_text: ['Dear MsVictoria,', 'I am disappointed to read that we have not lived up to the standards we set ourselves. Please contact me under falko@boisdale-cw.co.uk if you wish to discuss a little further. ', 'Warm regards,', 'Falko']
content: ["I've dined here a few times over the past couple of years and there's always been something that's been cold, overcooked, dry or had to be sent back but this time was the worst.", 'The mark-up on the wines is hideous. Almost £70 for a bottle of Cloudy Bay sauvignon blanc is daylight robbery. This is a £20-£25 bottle of wine.', 'Again the burger was overcooked and so dry (£17.50). Ordered the foie gras with truffle sauce and shaved black truffles as an accompaniment (12.50). The foie gras was miniscule and was literally the size of a large stamp, if there was a truffle sauce I couldn’t see or taste it and the shaved truffle tasted like dirt. ', 'We asked for a jug of ice tap water and got a luke warm glass of water. The waiter was too slow topping up the water and wine glasses.', 'After all the previous issues with sending food back, being given the wrong order, overcooked food, cold burgers etc. I won’t be returning again.']
title: Very overpriced and not that good

answer_text: ['Dear HDismorr,', 'Thank you for your review. I am delighted you had a lovely time with us. We look forward to welcoming you again soon.', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['My boyfriend booked an evening at the Boisdale for my Christmas present, and he certainly did well! The staff are friendly and extremely knowledgeable on the wines and food, and are all very professional. The food was superb, pricey however. (steak on its own £27 without sauce or veg).', 'I would certainly recommend for anyone wanting a great night with live jazz music.']
title: What a lovely, luxurious place

answer_text: ['Dear Gerrie L,', 'I am pleased that you enjoyed your Sunday lunch with us. We celebrated Burns Night the day before this year and continued into the morning hours hence Sunday maintained the traditional Sunday Roast. We are looking forward to seeing you again soon. ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['Went here for lunch on a Sunday. The jazz band is such a nice touch, very welcoming and relaxing. As it was a Sunday a roast was the obvious choice, but thought seeing that it was Burns Night there would have been something extra special, which was not the case. Will definitely go back as the menu and choices is very varied. ']
title: Amazing Atmosphere

answer_text: ['Dear EssexHappywanderer,', 'I was disappointed to read that we did not live up to our standards on this occasion. Please contact me directly under falko@boisdale-cw.co.uk should you wish to discuss further. ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ["Waited an hour for starters, another hour for dinner, food was disappointing, venue very nice, staff were helpful, although the waitress who served us English wasn't great, but her helpfulness more than compensated for this,maybe I will try a lunchtime next, wont be rushing back, "]
title: Slightly disappointed

answer_text: ['Dear MrsMichy,', 'Thank you for your review. While I was disappointed that there were delays in the service to you I am pleased that the team made you feel comfortable throughout. Please let us know when you plan to revisit, we would like to say thank you personally. ', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['We were fortunate enough to be guests on Saturday and didn’t have to pick up the bill!! (A little pricey, but worth it!). ', 'The main reason for going to Boisdale was to see the Bootleg Beatles in intimate surroundings.
