', 'We have some fantastic acts in the calendar for 2013, so keep an eye on our website (www.boisdale.co.uk) or better still sign up for our newsletter so you can keep up-to-date. ', 'Please drop us an email at manager@boisdale-cw.co.uk before your next visit and we’ll be sure to say hello.', 'Warm wishes,', 'Nathan']
content: ['We have just enjoyed a wonderful night of entertainment, food and atmosphere at the Canary Wharf Boisdale. On a previous trip to London we saw the restaurant and then looked it up on the Internet We booked our VIP table which was fun however, some of the dancers nearly set fire to items of their clothing until we moved our candle. The group the Red Stripes were excellent they created a wonderful party atmosphere and we would be happy see them again. The food was excellent in particular the rib eye steak of gigantic proportions and a wonderful melt in the mouth fillet steak. The staff were friendly and attentive, it was a lovely evening that we thoroughly enjoyed. Thank you, we hope to see you again']
title: Great night out would highly recommend it

answer_text: ['I am absolutely delighted by your lovely review. Thank you for taking the time do write these lines. Please drop me a line under manager@boisdale-cw.co.uk when you next plan to come in and I will make sure to say hello!', 'Warmest regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['Friday night with beer, oysters, perfect steak, truffled spinach, (a completely unnecessary but excellent) sticky toffee pudding, cigars and jazz.', "With excellent service, really, what's *not* to like about this!", "Excellent evening (and the lady's prawn cocktail and crab linguine were pretty damn good too).", 'Cheap? No. Good value? Oh yes!']
title: Excellent. Utterly excellent!

answer_text: ['Dear Maria,', 'Thank you so very much for your lovely review. It is brilliant to hear that our neighbourhood is coming over to enjoy themselves. My favourite steak is the Sirloin on the bone cooked rare with bone marrow sauce. You should try that if you have not already! Next time you plan on coming, please drop me a quick line (manager@boisdale-cw.co.uk) and I will make sure to say hello!', 'Warm regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['As we are locals our trips to Boisdale happened quite often.', 'We love Boisdale because of....STEAK!', 'The steak is perfection. One of the best steak you can eat in London. ', "And don't forget about Jazz, you can listen good music and this is wonderful.", 'This is not a cheap place, but for the quality and entertainment is a really good value.']
title: Happy to be local

answer_text: ['Dear Guest,', 'Thank you for writing such a great review. I am delighted you had a great time. Did you know that Canary Wharf is only 15 minutes away from Green Park with the Jubilee Line? So I am glad you agree that it is worth the trip.', 'I hope to see you soon!', 'Falko']
content: ['A bit remote location but Boisdale of Canary Wharf is a great place, with large main room, located above the bar and cigar room. Very good food with a lot of Scottish specialities (poached salmon, crab, seafood) and great choice of steaks. 20 pages or so long wine list has great matches or most of dishes and a nice collection of port, including few quite old. But you are going there to listen to music (some nice Sinatra-stle jazz tonight) and it is absolutely excellent. Worth a trip to Canary Wharf to enjoy the place.']
title: Excellent jazz, good food

answer_text: ['Dear Paul,', 'I am delighted that you enjoyed your Friday evening and thank you for writing a review.', 'I look forward to welcoming you back very soon. To keep updated check out our website or sign up to our email alerts for details on upcoming events and shows like our Guitar Greats Festival.', 'Warm regards,', 'Falko']
content: ['A group of 7 of us went to dinner at Boisdale. We had a great evening. Service was excellent and food superb. My wife had the Linguine with Hebridean Crab which she said was devine and I had the Untrimmed Rib of Beef on the Bone (18-20 oz) and as a meat eater, I was in heaven. Great company coupled with good food and wine (we probably overdid it with the wine but you only live once!!) and finished off with a set by the Soul Sisters made for a fantastic evening. ']
title: Great Evening

answer_text: ['I am delighted you enjoyed Burns Night with us. Regarding the steak we have already agreed that the untrimmed rib of beef had too much fat content for the majority of guests and we will not be using it for set menus again. I am pleased you enjoyed the address to the Haggis, though it was strenuous holding it for so long; still great fun! I hope to see you in the near future and thank you for reviewing.', 'Warm regards', 'Falko Molitor']
content: ["Booked late and couldn't get a table until 9pm on Burn's night. Had to pay for the jazz too but said we didn't need to see the stage so only paid £10 each. Turned out we had a really good table with not too much of a restricted view. The Haggis was toasted at least three times while we there and the piper was great! We had the special Burn's night menu which included a dram of whiskey with the haggis neeps and tattles and a Drambuie with dessert. We had the smoked salmon to start which was delicious. It's was follows by the haggis which again was delicious. For the man course we both chose the steak and chips. We've been to Boisdale Bishopgate before and the steaks there are great, but the ones we had last night were poor and not the usual standard. It was a extremely busy so maybe this was the problem! Dessert was either clottie dumpling with custard or cranachan. We had one of each and they were good. We finished off with coffees. This was £48 a head so not bad. A bottle of my favourite Sancerre rose wine was £45. Staff were good even thought they were extremely busy. Will definitely go back."]
title: Burn's night

answer_text: ['Barry, thank you for commenting on your experience. You are quite right, the Cloudy Bay prices have soared over the last years, but there are many alternatives on the wine list that are equally stunning for example the Craggy Range Sauvignon Blanc as well as the Saint Clair Sauvignon Blanc, both like the Cloudy Bay from Marlborough, New Zealand. Our house Gin & Tonic is priced at £8.50, but as we have eight varieties available, your preference may change that. I am glad that you did enjoy the service and atmosphere though and look forward to welcoming you again in the near future.', 'Yours sincerely', 'Falko Molitor']
content: ["Went to see an Elvis tribute at Boisdale, Canary Wharf in January 2013. Tribute act was OK however prices were astronomical for what you get. Food very average and overpriced. Steak £22 with no side dishes. A small bowl of 'jacket' chips £4.50. Fish and chips (poorly cooked) £19.50!! Drinks overpriced. A bottle of Cloudy Bay Sauvignon Blanc £75!!!! Gin and tonic £11!!! Service was very good and the atmosphere was also good. However, value for money really poor. Four of us went - £80 entrance fee then a bill for £254 for food and drink and we didn't over indulge!! How people can afford this on a regular basis is hard to believe."]
title: Elvis Night at Boisdale

answer_text: ['Thank you very much for your feedback! I am sorry to hear that Elvis was not what you have hoped for; I have had so many great comments about him. In fact, he is booked again and I have sold already about 50% of the tickets; most of them on a return visit. I am thrilled however that you enjoyed the service & atmosphere. I would be happy if you would like to provide me with more feedback regarding the food. You can contact me directly.', 'Warm regards', 'Falko Molitor', 'dgm@boisdale-cw.co.uk']
content: ['Was really looking forward to this night out with close friends and have to say was a little disappointed. ', "The service was excellent! The atmosphere was very very good. The food hugely disappointing and it certainly wasn't value for money. ", 'The entertainment for the night was Elvis- who was average - not the best and not the worst although he did want to try talking and it was just a muffle! ', 'The pity is we was here last year and everything was excellent! So hence us looking forward to the night. ']
title: A little disappointed

answer_text: ['Thank you very much for your feedback Pearl. I am thrilled that you had such a great time. ', 'Warmest regards', 'Falko']
content: ["We reserved a table through toptable so we had 50% off. It was a great experience which would otherwise be quite costly if we didn't have the 50% off! Atmosphere was really great and romantic for couples. Food was good too. We ordered a Fruit de Mer for 2 as a starter and it was actually a little too much."]
title: Excellent food and atmosphere

answer_text: ['Dear Richard,', "I'm delighted that you enjoyed your visit to our Canary Wharf restaurnat and we are very grateful for your positive feedback.", 'Having traded our Belgravia restaurant for over 25 years, we have tried hard to make our latest outpost here in the Wharf as warm and welcoming as possible, in the hope that we could bring a little of the West End to the Capital of the East End.', 'Come and see us again soon.', 'Nathan']
content: ["Let's face it, the restaurant choice in Canary wharf isn't great - so Boisdale has been a welcome addition. Some may dislike the faux-Scottish surroundings, and the rather cavernous main restaurant, but the service, food and ambience are all up to the best West End standards. Steak is well-cooked and unfussy, and the hand-cut chips are impossible to resist. Good wine list too!"]
title: RAISING STANDARDS IN CANARY WHARF

answer_text: ['It is fantastic to hear that you had a cracking time Lizzy. I agree that Aberdeenshire steaks are the best and I have tried plenty others. Keep checking out our website as Jeremy will soon return with a big band for even more feel good tunes!', 'Falko']
content: ["Despite the previous reviewer saying that Scotsman don't come to the Boisdale....actually they do - we're from Aberdeenshire! It was the jazz that attracted us and it didn't disappoint, we saw the Jeremy Sassoon quintet and they were simply fabulous - so much so that I persuaded my husband to get up and dance.", "It's not a cheap night out. We booked our music tickets in advance and paid for a 'standard view' dining table at £20 per head before you pay for dinner so it's pretty pricey but I guess that is how they afford to have such great acts on so often. The 'restricted view' tables are £10 per head and I would have argued that ours was a restricted view but we didn't mind as we were sat next to the window with a lovely view out to the sparkling tree lights of Cabot Square.", 'The steaks are from Aberdeenshire (as all the best steaks are) and my ribeye was the best I have ever had. All the accompaniments were gorgeous too - thick cut chips, field mushrooms etc (all charged as extra).', "The restaurant is done out in sort of hunting lodge style - deep red and tartan carpet but not overtly so. There's a few stags' heads on the walls and mounted fish and the waitresses wear kilts but it's not at all kitsch. I bet there's not a Scottish waitress there though - ours wasn't, and I bet the majority haven't visited Scotland either......", 'I would love to go back with friends sometime.']
title: One of the best steaks I've ever had and definitely some of the best musicians I've seen - a great night!

answer_text: ['Phil, thank you for your kind feedback. I am delighted you had a lovely evening. Please come again soon!', 'Warm regards', 'Falko']
content: ['Last visited in mid November for a business celebration. We had one more than we expected and were still fitted in well by the staff.', 'The service was excellent, particularly at the bar where the barman took time out to explain through all the different cocktails available at Boisdale.', 'The food was also excellent, in all cases. Steak is cooked to exacting specifications, and the Haggis was just divine for the starter.', "You won't spot a Scotsman here but it makes a good effort at paying tribute to the Food and Drink culture of Scotland."]
title: Great Food, Great Jazz, Great Service

answer_text: ['Dear Jonathan, thank you for commenting. Some of our steaks have lots of fat, especially the untrimmed rib of beef, however some crave them like this. I am very sorry we fell short of your expectations in the service area, but since your comment we have made certain that every private room has a dedicated waiter only looking after your needs. Should you be in soon for another visit, please contact me directly.', 'Yours sincerely,', 'Falko Molitor', 'dgm@boisdale-cw.co.uk']
content: ['Ate in the private dining room which you might have expected to be a "showcase". Service was slow and drinks not refreshed regularly. Most disappointing was the steak which was fatty and large parts inedible. The haggis though was excellent (it was close to Burns night). Very expensive in my view. Would not return from choice (this was a business function).']
title: Average in every way

answer_text: ['Dear Reviewer, ', 'Thank you for taking the time to write about your experience at our Canary Wharf Restaurant. ', "We have now fixed, the temporary problem with the heating, which was exasperated by the exceptionally cold weather that weekend, please accept my apologies for any discomfort felt. The Oyster Bar & Grill is quieter on a Saturday night as most of our guests are travelling into the Wharf for the show in the main restaurant on the second floor. I'm delighted that you enjoyed the food and found our team to be helpful. ", "The cover charge you refer to for the second floor is actually a ticket for the live performance, much like a visit to the theatre or the O2 and I'm sorry if you thought the act did not warrant a £15 ticket. Unlike places such as Ronnie Scott’s who see ticket sales as an opportunity to make profits, we simple try to recoup the costs associated with putting on World class Jazz, Blues & Soul Acts. The prices vary depending on the night of the week, the act and the proximity to the stage. All upcoming performances can be viewed on our website www.boisdale.co.uk with full details of the ticket prices available. ", 'Thanks again for your comments. We hope to see you again very soon.']
content: ['Went to the Oyster Bar and Grill. Very nice table by the window but.... drafty and freezing. The aircon meant that I sat freezing in my party dress. Didnt want to sit wearing my coat so hoped the super alcoholic cocktail would help along with the very yummy chicken shnitzel and cauliflower cheese. The staff were friendly and helpful so didnt want to complain. The restaurant did seem quite empty but that was possibly due to the fact that everyone was dining in the main restaurant where we were headed to to see the evenings entertainment. ', 'To go upstairs to the restaurant or to dine during the entertainment you are charged a £15 cover charge each. I do think that a bit cheeky as the cuisine and drinks are expensive. The nights entertainment was great and the band excellent. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves but forgot that it was the Saturday following Thursday valentine day and it was full of loving couples - whoopsie - hey ho we had fun anyway.', 'It was warmer upstairs than in the Oyster Bar. Would not consider dining in the Oyster Bar again unless it was sub tropical temperatures outside.... sort it out please!']
title: Arctic Air Con

answer_text: ['Thank you for your feedback. It is true that Friday and Saturday have become so popular that waiting times are a possibility. We do mention on our website the ticket prices but are working on making this much clearer for you. I have not been to Loch Fyne myself but this is the first time I have heard of strong fish smell on the 1st floor. I am however delighted that you enjoyed the food and service. I hope to welcome you back soon.', 'Warm regards', 'Falko']
content: ["Went in without a booking on Saturday Night, but it is Canary Wharf! went into the Oyster Bar and Grill first, quite strong smell of fish when the lift door opens! I know it is an Oyster Bar, but Loch Fyne doesn't smell like this and they sell fish! So decided to go upstairs to fine dining, was told 1hour and a half wait, that it was £20 per head for the live music (cannot see that on the website) and that there was space downstairs and the food came from the same kitchen. So we went back downstairs and had a very nice rib eye steak, we forgot or did not notice the fish smell, all the staff bar and table s were very good, friendly , happy and attentive, strange menu you could have 1/2 grilled lobster as a sauce with your steak (£20) but not have hot grilled lobster as a main course."]
title: live music dining venue

content: ['Big fan of Boisdale when I\'m in the mood for a steak. The restaurant is split into two with a "restaurant" and a "bar" although both serve food and drink. The bar has recently expanded its menu to match the restaurant for its popular meals which was a welcome touch given that the bar is normally easier to get a table and you will be charged for the jazz performance if you happen to be in the restaurant whether you wanted to listen or not. ', "The steaks always come well cooked, the rossini being a particular highlight with lovely foie gras, a generous amount of truffles and deep flavoured sauce. I don't normally get starters but am a fan of the haggis which is surprisingly light and fluffy compared to denser offerings elsewhere. The desserts are generally a bit disappointing and remind me of school dinners in their stodginess. ", "Service is rather slow (delivery of food and general attentiveness) and the later you arrive, the slower it will be to deal with the back log in orders. It is also on the toppy end of the price range with a steak, side of fries and a beer setting you back around £50. Wine is also expensive. A great night out if you are a steak fan but you're wallet won't thank you for it!"]
title: Great steak but bad for the wallet

content: ['A nice location and a nice restaurant. The meal was very good, the steak being excellent. Good choice of beer and wine. A good place to choose.']
title: Great steak

answer_text: ['I would be happy to hear more about your evening; please do contact me directly. Thank you for taking the time to review us.', 'Yours sincerely', 'Falko Molitor', 'dgm@boisdale-cw.co.uk']
content: ['I am unsure if I would have dined here. We were a table of 4 and had selected this restaurant for lunch as it was local for all of us. . The wine started at £18.50 per bottle, the house white wine was pretty average. When we asked for the next least expensive bottle we were advised it was not available leaving us with the next priced bottle at £25. The total bill for 4 of us with two bottles of wine was £107.00, which was with 50% off food. The service was ok but nothing special. All in all nothing to write home about.']
title: If I hadn't gone through Toptable .......

content: ["OK. So I don't like modern city bars but this one is designed to allow the maximum number of people to huddle together round small thin stands and pretend they are having a good time. Packed full of folks for whom the ambience of a decent pub is too far away. Yuk. "]
title: Corporate cattle shed with so few seats you wonder how long they want you to stay.

content: ["Boisdale would be great without the live music, having it is really the icing on the cake! Love the bar, fun and noisy, you can be out on the terrace in the summer for drinks. Love sitting there having dinner looking over Canary Wharf towards the Thames. The oysters are always good, and the meat is excellent. The steak is so good have nt managed to try anything else yet . Great for a special occasion. Very expensive if you spoil yourself, that's why I don't lose weight!"]
title: My fave London restaurant

content: ['My family and I enjoyed a great night of food, wine and outstanding entertainment in the 2nd floor restaurant at Boisdale. None of us had eaten there before but we will almost certainly return ... if only for the entertainment. The theme for the night was Las Vegas and the big-band-sound and singing were of the highest order ... and certainly got the guests on their feet! The entertainment was preceded by dinner: the starters of fresh Scottish oysters were delicious and we all went for steaks for our mains, all but one of which were well cooked. Service was sprightly and attentive but not too much. A great party atmosphere and we all had great fun.']
title: A memorable night

content: ["We had a really fun time at the Boisdale this week. It was super busy, with a lot of Christmas parties obviously going on but I thought that despite that, they managed to give great service. It's not the sort of place I'd go to every week but I did really enjoy the live music and entertainment. The food is very good and better than I expected! The boys really enjoyed their whiskies - so many to choose from. Will definitely go again."]
title: Fun night out

content: ["Been twice, first time as a couple. Food reasonably priced but bill huge as drinks very expensive! I found the service to be over-attentive, put down fork for moment and expect your plate to vanish! Second visit was a business dinner and food was great and we dined in a private room, I wasn't paying this time so less aware of the cost! Nice place though and good atmosphere."]
title: Great food, expensive drinks

content: ['Getting to the restaurant early for lunch with friends meant I could have a refreshing Guinness and watch the place gird its loins for a busy pre-Christmas Friday. Even empty the ambiance is good. Photos of dudes and chicks cover the walls, big windows overlook the busy wharf, so there is plenty to occupy you while the hustle and bustle gradually builds up around you. the large, well stocked, oval bar sits centre stage on the first floor with tables for casual dining dotted around, more dining and private rooms upstairs for the serious foodie and drinker. The menu has all the Boisdale standards but we went for a traditional Christmas menu, which was excellent value. The portion size was generous, this was no wafer thin turkey slices but good hefty carvings and extra veg was brought out for the table, all was beautifully cooked. our lovely waitress of the day took great care of us and stayed smiling till the end ... The wine menu was extensive and covered every part of the globe and every sized wallet. By the time we finished it was early evening and although the staff need us to move on by then we were never rushed. Drinks back in the now crowded but happy bar brought the festivities to a close. Thoroughly recommend this bar and restaurant for business and friends. Jazz night next time !']
title: Jazzy tartan oasis

content: ['I loved the Boisdale when we went there last year (2011) for our annual Christmassy night out (festive jazz band and singers). The food was great, as a vegetarian I hate it when the only veggie choices are risotto or something involving goats cheese (SO unimaginative!). Last year the manager went out of his way to arrange an alternative main course which was great. This year was a very different story. The manager was rude, told me that my dish from last year was not on the menu, and that I could have a salad as a main dish (just what everyone wants on a cold winter\'s evening on a special occasion). In the end he "compromised" and said they would do a plate of vegetables for me - and that\'s exactly what I got - think a side of vegetables, but spread over a plate. For the type of restaurant that this place portrays itself as being and with a hefty price tag attached for the entertainment and food, this is very poor. I don\'t think they will see us again in 2013 for what seemed like it could have been an annual event.']
title: Great atmosphere but inflexible

content: ['The décor is elegant and warm. The service was impeccable. I have eaten there a few times and it has always been good. If you can... try the Lobster..so lovely : ) And the lovely bit of Jazz in the background just really adds to to a great evening out.']
title: Fantastic food, great service, good atmosphere

content: ["Nice place, good service, but the food was not up to the standards and I thought it was very expensive for what we had. I don't think I am coming back"]
title: Good service, average expensive food...

content: ['We had yet another fantastic night at Boisdale for our Christmas party last week. The staff were absolutely excellent. When we arrived we went to the 1st floor Oyster bar where we had two tables reserved for our Canapes and Champagne. Our waiter was excellent, nothing was too much trouble. We then went to 2nd floor restaurant, the table we had reserved was perfect just in front of the stage, the food,wine and entertainment were outstanding as always. If you are looking for a venue that excels for good food, excellent service with unrivaled entertainment Boisdale is the place.']
title: Another fantastic Night

content: ['We have dined in a number of times before and always found that the food and service have been at a pretty good level. We therefore invited friends to join us ona Friday night, when there is music and a better atmosphere.', 'Sadly we were let down. Some of the issues:', "'We do not serve Bellini'.", "'Oh, you asked for Rose Champagne, I am sure you said just Champagne'", "'No we do not have white bread'", 'Two of our party ordered the bisque to start and both were inedible becuase the butter was left in lumos at the bottom, not melted. When we complained, no apology or explanation was given. They were simply offered a replacement, and is is always the case, the moment had gone.', 'The bread was stale and we were told that no white bread existed. Lattely we were given four slices of toast!! It was a chea-end thin cut loaf of bread, amazing.', 'The main course were good enough, we passed on dessert.', 'An expensive and disappointing night. Good band.']
title: STANDARDS HAVE DROPPED

content: ['A joint birthday celebration with my daughter ( we share the same date ) so a visit was arranged to enjoy the Modern Jazz and to have a good meal.', 'The venue has a sophisticated feel and if you are a whisky enthusiast you will be overwhelmed with choice at the bar. The staff were very welcoming and the service attentive ......... the food was O.K. but not brilliant for the largish bill .', 'We pre-booked and were shown to a table in a premiere position close to the stage ( I was a bit worried that when the music began we would be deafened, but it was perfect.', "It was a quintet playing, headed by Karren Sharp and Robert Fowler playing standards by Zoot Sims and Al Cohen ........... The standard was very high and at times ' hot ' when some of the improvisations on the tenor saxophones were in full swing.", "I will treasure the evening as a nostalgic event taking me back to the days as an art student in the 60's when I saw live performances of Gerry Mulligan and Stan Getz ........ Magic !!!", "The whole evening was a great success and my daughter who is late 20's seemed to be converted to the jazz scene .", 'I hope to be back sometime !!!!']
title: A ' COOL ' EVENING AT BOISDALE

content: ["Went with friends to see 'Serpentine Fire'. The place has a great atmosphere. The food was first class, service was smooth considering it is a very busy venue and the two course set menu great value at under £20 per head.", 'Drinks are a bit on the pricier side at West End prices, however there is good range of beers and wines. ', "I booked a 'Premium View' table that was about halfway between the band and tables right at the back. Quite a good view, but not exactly premium. This is only a small niggle as we still had a good view and the sound system here really delivered.", 'All in all a great night out in Canary Wharf. If you love Earth, Wind and Fire make sure you check out this tribute act. They are fanastic, really entertaining and spot on. Really great musicians.']
title: Great Place to see Live Acts

content: ["We went as as a party of 7 on Saturday 3rd November. We'd just finished our average meal when one member of our party noticed a mouse running around!", "We told the waitressing staff who acknowledged they had a problem with mice and said 'but it is London - there's loads here!'", 'The manager came over to discuss and was aware mice were frequenting the resturant. As part of her defence, she told us that the mice were only located in our part of the resturant! Well thanks for seating us there then!']
title: If you like mice running around as you eat then eat here!

content: ['Food a bit expensive but very nice.The entertainment was very good and the selection of cicars and whiskeys were excellent. the only downfall is that when the entertainment is finished the bar is closed and they want you out. This turns out to be a very early evening in my case.']
title: Nice place

content: ["That is a great cigar place with humidor and large selection of fine cigars. Something you will not find everywhere in today's London "]
title: Cigar place!

content: ["Been there a Saturday night and I simply couldn't have enough of the music, the food, the champagne, the oyster, the cigar, the wine and so on.Warm atmosphere and nice staff.I couldn't wish for better.the only pity is that is a little overpriced."]
title: For a nice night out

content: ['Very nice restaurant to have lunch . Had a delicious hamburger with chips. Cosy Scottish atmosphere and perfect for a business lunch or just a fast meal . Service was good and will definately go back there again . Its nice when in England , to get the typical English , Scottish , Irish atmosphere i think . There are many modern places that are great but nice to try something different at times . ']
title: Hamburger for the hungry

content: ['My boyfriend and I visited Boisdale on Saturday night for the Blues Brothers tribute. The venue, music and staff were very good and are all reasons why we will be returning. The bar staff in particular were memorable for choosing the perfect cocktails for us. ', "Unfortunately, the a la carte food was overpriced for it's quality. I sent my first duck breast back as it had been overcooked. The second one was 'ok' but still not good. I have overcooked many many duck breasts in my own kitchen and have learnt the absolute necessity of letting them rest for ten minutes after you take them out of the pan before slicing them. I have to assume that the chef was in too much of a hurry to keep up with orders to give the duck the time it deserved but for a 2 course meal (with wine and tip) that cost us over £230 we'd normally expect a higher standard. We may try the fixed price menu in future but are more likely to perch at the bar and focus on Boisdale's strengths!"]
title: Not for gourmets - saved by the venue, staff and drinks

content: ['The setting of the grill bar is beautiful . The menu bounces from good offer for oysters and shellfish to average offer for meat and none for fish. Sides and entries to minimum level.', 'What is disappointing however is the (non)speed of the service , Needs to remind waitresses several time for a burger and a steack (!) in a half empty restaurant.', 'First time I was there a few months ago it was different as far as the service is concerned', 'Given the price level and the expectations this was a delusion -in a place where alternatives are', 'available this is a risky approach']
title: SLOW SERVICE

content: ["But... I booked a table for three... what I forgot to mention was, the three were two adults and a child! When we arrived, we were politely informed, Boisdale cannot entertain children because of 'the Whiskey Bar'! Not entirely sure what that meant, but got the impression Boisdale is not a child friendly zone! Will probably go back though, less child!!"]
title: Perhaps I'm a little unfair...

content: ['Took my husband for his birthday on friday with our children, the food was amazin and the staff were fantastic would recommend to anyone who likes jazz, good food and great service. We were treated like we were the only people in there, will be goin back for a 2nd visit.']
title: Amazin

content: ['A fantastic venue with fantastic food. I had heard the food was good but was amazed at the quality. I visited with a party of 12 as a retirement night out. The bar has the largest range of Whisky I have ever seem!!!! The service was really good and we were well looked after. The entertainment was great as well.']
title: Great music ! Fantastic Food.

content: ['On the positive the venue was very lovely. The food was good. The service was excellent. The singer and music brilliant. ', 'The primary reason i went is because its promoted as a music venue and this is why i went to listen to the music and singer. If you go to Ronnie Scotts or The Vortex ,The Hideaway, 606 club, they all insist that you show some respect to the artists performing and patrons who wish to listen Not at this venue,there were people at tables shouting and shrieking over the music. I have never known a venue which shows such a lack of respect for the artists and staff and management who accept it. Shame it could have been a be a great addition to the London music scene.A nice restaurant but if your a real music lover i would recommended the other venues i have mentioned and give this one a miss.']
title: No Respect For Artists

content: ["We were excited to try the Boisdale's Oyster bar with a bunch of friends last week.", 'The interior is truly pretty and grand looking.', 'The menus are appropriate with a good selection of steaks and seafood.', 'I would reconsider having screw-top wines in a [wannabe] upscale place though.', 'The food was very tasty and well presented, the just ordinary desserts were a let-down.', "Service has a long way to go to improve, e.g. spilt sauce, ages to bring drinks/food on not a terribly busy night, 'there you go, babe' etc.", 'We had a good time overall, but at 50% off food bill it was still just an average experience/value for money, so most likely will not be back too soon.']
title: Aspiring but quite unexceptional

content: ['Overall the venue was lovely, food excellent, service in the restaurant very good. A bit pricey. Given the prices charged i expected more in terms politeness and attentiveness of the staff in the main bar, having to ask for more bread was also a bit disappointing. I also thing they should move away from measuring glasses of wine in the bar. Given the prices charged serving a little extra above the minimum would not hurt.']
title: Review

content: ['Very good atmosphere in Canary Wharf. I hosted a business dinner and all my guests were happy with the menu, the quality of the food and the service. After dinner we retired to the bar and it was very pleasant.']
title: Good food, very good service

content: ['I like places that allows you to enjoy your stay from a reasonable amount of money and where you can spend 5000gbp/person as well. boisdale is just the place but honestly if you dont like jazz and whiskey it is just a slightly above average place.', 'pros:', '- if you manage to sit at the windows the feeling is awesome - though for date I can recommend this place only when you manage to sit to that area', '- their whiskey selection is stunning, they even have for 1500gbp+ / glass!', '- the design of the restaurant is very nice, you can feel yourself in an old saloon', '- you can keep your expenses down and still enjoy the place', 'cons:', '- at the time we were in the bar it took ages to serve our drinks. at this price tag it is unacceptable. hire more people please', '- food is average, e.g. the bone in ribeye is thin and the meat quality is average', '- live music is extremely loud, makes communication impossible', '- you need to leave before it starts because they add extra $$$ to your bill']
title: good but not that good

content: ['Live entertainment. Good Food. Went for my husbands birthday for something different and had a lovely time']
title: Boisdale Canary Wharf

content: ['Great food, great service, great atmosphere and pretty good music too. Thoroughly recommended.']
title: Top spot!

content: ["We went there for just one reason, so my husband could enjoy on his birthday smoking his cigars while having a cognac. Looking for places where he could smoke in London, we came across Boisdale, which also happens to have a restaurant and one of the biggest whiskey bar in the world (as they say). So I made reservation for dinner. I have to say what a great surprise when I actually saw the restaurant. I wasn't expecting much, actually, but decoration was nice, table setting was first class, and food was good. For the first time in months my husband got his steak just as he likes it. Waitress was very nice, excellent wine, ambience was perfect! We really had a great evening. We did not stay for the show, but what we got to hear, music was very nice too.", 'We then went to the terrace, so we could smoke our cigars, something almost inexistent in restaurants nowadays (having to smoke by the door, at the sidewalk, and cigars cannot be enjoyed like that).', 'The check, taking aside the drinks, was very good priced, for the quality and the experience we had. Drinks are expensive everywhere, and since it was a special occasion, we were prepared to spend!', "One thing though that I did realized, is that I found Boisdale on the internet described as one of the top places where cigar aficionados can go an enjoy in London. But actually, we were the only ones smoking cigars, everyone else was smoking cigarettes, not that we mind, but it seems that real cigar aficionados don't go there."]
title: Great Birthday Night!

content: ['I took some friends for dinner as we all like Jazz, and the concept sounded interesting. Our first complaint was the pricing of the wines, they were ridiculously expensive. The service was ok, but lacked warmth and the food was ok but nothing brilliant. I was so looking forward to having dinner here but left really disappointed.']
title: I was really looking forward to this place, but left disappointed

content: ['Our first visit to this venue (birthday), we booked premium seating in the restaurant, which allowed us to keep the table all night for the band. Check them out they were called The Congo faith healers, they are on You tube and have their own website. All I can say is absolutely brilliant, their music was spot on and really entertaining. The service from arrival to when we left was top class, nothing was too much trouble, there was a great atmosphere. The food was delicious and there was an amazing menu of wines should you want them, we had the house Rose, really nice.', 'To keep costs down you could dine downstairs in the Oyster bar downstairs and then see the entertainment, this still allowed a good view of the band. Not cheap but good value for the money.']
title: A great evenings entertainment

content: ['Well, it was ok. On a gorgeous London day, everyone wanted to be outside and we didn\'t care as all we wanted to do was eat so we opted to be the only ones eating on the first level indoors. The servers were otherwise focused on the throngs of people on the terrace (can\'t say as I blame them!) and we were forgotten about "a little". Not a crime but not bringing us back, either.']
title: Might look elsewhere next time

content: ['We visited for a birthday celebration and to see The Jessica Lauren 4 and Jocelyn Brown. By booking a table we not only enjoyed great live music but also had a very pleasant meal. The menu had a decent variety and the quality was very good ( try the excellent cheese board!). Our server was first rate and the overall attention to customer service was very good. If you are into whiskey there is an outstanding whiskey bar. A great place to see live music (Jools Holland is the patron) and enjoy a meal at the same time. If you are driving to the venue the Canary Wharf car park is good value after 6.00pm.']
title: Great place for live music and food

content: ["This is only really a 'good' rather than 'very good' as one or two elements were missing. Great location and wonderfully laid out seating. We were in the restaurant rather than the brasserie and were met by a very friendly lady who showed us to our table but we then had to wait 15 minutes for a pre lunch drink. Menu was good and there was also a fixed price menu which was extremely reasonable and had good options - 2 courses for £19.75. The main menu looked a bit expensive in places, eg £30 for sea bass. The wine list was a bit on the pricey side too and if you moved off the 'house' list you were straight into the £40 per bottle territory. Starter was amazing (haggis, neaps and tatties - it does have a Scottish theme after all) and portion sizes were perfect. My only real grumble was the service which was a bit average -our main courses were brought out but our starter plates were still in front of us in spite of us having finished some 15 minutes earlier."]
title: Good food

content: ["This time was launch of a Jools Holland jazz festival. Evening was amazing. Superb Food, perfect wine, great atmosphere all supported by the very professional staff. Can't wait for visit number 3. "]
title: 2nd visit even better than first - if that's possible

content: ["I normally frequent Boisdale's in Bishopsgate as it is more convenient. The service, wine and fine were excellent. The only weird aspect was that they put a abridged menu on our table first and I had to ask for the familiar menu. Maybe it was because it was Monday. There was live music starting with Piano and moving to Jazz. It did not overwhelm our conversation and created a good atmosphere for a Monday night."]
title: Modern Boisdale's

content: ["Both steaks over cooked but very tasty. Staff try and up sell relentlessly with a very overpriced wine list. No doubt their location in 'banker central' is the reason. Note Hawksmoor and Barbecoa have better wine choices to suit a range of budgets. Our waiter lost interest once the 'selling' process was complete and did not top up our water. It took ages to get the bill in an empty restaurant while staff were carrying chairs around us. Also disliked the bare tables around us at the start of our lunch. Great size room and view needs to be matched with much sharper service."]
title: Could do better

content: ['We went on a Friday evening, having booked weeks in advance to see one of our favourite jazz singers. The venue is large and impressive, with amazing views of Cabot Square. Service from the start was efficient and very friendly, I really can\'t fault it. My partner ordered from the cheaper "Jacobite" menu whilst I went a la carte. Both our starters were good - Colchester oysters and the potted mackerel. The mains less so - an indifferent burger and a very small portion of plaice in a strangely bitter sauce. We had cocktails, a bottle of wine, coffees and a cognac: £150. I\'ve definitely had better food for less. But on top of that we had paid £50 for our tickets and here came the really annoying part. Half of the room was clearly not interested in listening to the band and talked all the way through, to the frustration of those of us that did want to listen and indeed to the singer and the band themselves. Even towards the end, when we managed to get the whole room quiet , it became clear there was also a dull roar (coming up through an internal staircase in the centre of the room) from the bar down below. My advice - if you want a venue in London to watch jazz: go to Ronnie Scotts, the food is better and you can hear the music properly. If you go to Boisdales, go for the view and eat from the Jacobite menu - its better value for money.']
title: Beware of the noise!

content: ["I had been really looking forward to dining in the 2nd floor restaurant at Boisdale Canary Wharf as had heard (and read) some good things about the place. We chose from the Jacobite menu which was £19.95 a head. The starter of mackeral was ok but my main course of chicken was rather bland. Drinks were ultra expensive, e.g. small vodka and tonic in a short glass was £10 which I thought rather excessive. Staff were very well trained and polite. We were also charged £3.50 for listening to a piano player for 30 mins whilst the music in the bar was stlll playing. I probably won't visit again as I think you can get better food in Ronnie Scotts or Jazz Cafe."]
title: Average food at above average prices

content: ["Hard to express how angry I am about last night's visit to the Boisdale without descending into profanities. Not, I hasten to add, with the venue itself. We were driving, and for London the parking at Canary Wharf is surprisingly cheap. If travelling by the Docklands Light Railway one can walk off the platform, go down an escalator, and be in the Boisdale in about a minute. ", "Very swish and well appointed, the food was excellent - which it should be for the price. Starters, the potted shrimps and the crab tian, were very pleasant. My rump steak was absolutely excellent: tender, exceedingly well flavoured, and cooked spot on for the 'rare' requested. Best steak I've had anywhere since a meal at Gaucho's last year. Mrs P's langoustine main was very nice she assured me. The only fault - a minor one - was in one of the sides: the mushrooms were somewhat over-cooked.", "Drinks are on the expensive side. The House wine list is quite short, and not particularly interesting to be frank. Mark up is 300-400%. However the rest of a very lengthy list has two prices: one for members, and another with a hefty surcharge for everyone else. Doubtless the Boisdale would like to assert they are offering a 'discount' for members, but at those mark ups it just feels like a bit of additional fleecing, so we went for a bottle off the House list. It was nothing better than ok, and not worth the price charged.", "We'd missed Ruby Turner's recent sessions at Ronnie Scott's, with all three evenings sold out. But here was an opportunity to catch up with one of our favourite artists, a British R&B and Soul legend for around 35 years. And now we come to what has me seething still: the clientele. Despite having a table right by the stage, even there one could not avoid an incessant hubbub of loud conversations (which just got louder and louder as people competed with the music), people chatting on mobiles, and the man on the table behind us (who had presumably also paid £120 for him and his wife to theoretically listen to Ruby) talking at full volume non-stop throught the ENTIRETY of the first set. Twice she appealed to the audience, the first time in a light-hearted pleasant way, the second more openly clearly utterly fed up, but there was no respite from the boorish, rude, crass disrespect to a great artist. Oh well, it's money in the bank, what the hell: so understandably the second set was rushed through with as much disinterest as 80% of the audience were paying her. She could not wait to get off the stage, with several numbers curtailed from their usual length, and justifiably did not return to provide an encore.", "One might say that people, having paid their money, can do what they want; but for the life of me can't see why so many doubled the price of their meal just to talk over the act.", 'Of course it may have been a one off, but not giving it a second chance to have an evening ruined: never bothering with the Boisdale for a musical dining event again.']
title: Do NOT go here for the music

content: ['Recommend by a colleague I went there for live jazz music, but as promised the food was also excellent. Before the evening show a piano player provided a great background sound. ', 'The menu offers a great variety of steaks and fish. The steak I had was superb as well as the dessert. The wine list is also remarkable with reasonable prices. ', 'Extraordinary is the whiskey selection. I haven never seen such a variety of whiskeys in any bar in the world I have been before. I definitely will stop by again next time I will be in London.']
title: Perfect steaks associated with great music

content: ['Get a seat by the window.', 'Excellent balcony smoking area for those that indulge', 'Steaks are fantastic']
title: Exactly what you expect

content: ['Great place to go for drinks and food! Atmosphere has a nice buzz and amazing pictures on the walls.']
title: Great atmosphere!

content: ['Really enjoyed our night at Boisdales, what a wonderful restaurant and atmosphere. We had a table overlooking the fountains in Cabot Square, wow.... We are Londoners and felt very proud to be in such an exclusive area, funnily enough eating in a very nice Scottish restaurant, will definitely go back.']
title: What a treat...

content: ['Went to see a jazz quartet. Food very overpriced for its quality but staff helpful and attentive. Cool venue and atmosphere. If you want to chat during the music, take a window seat overlooking the square.']
title: Boisdale: overpriced but cool venue

content: ['My partner and I recently went to the Drifters night in Boisdale, Canary Wharf.', 'The reception from the staff was great and we were swiftly led to our table directly in front of the stage. Premier seats were £35 per person, which we thought was reasonable.', 'It was quite busy as it was 8pm on a Friday night, so we waited patiently to be served after being seated. We waited for a good 15-20 minutes before the maitre d’ noticed our growing impatience and came and took our drinks and food order.', 'The band were excellent and very entertaining, although the feed from the band itself was a little too loud and overpowered the singers voices a bit.', 'Within a couple minutes of the band starting at 9pm, a group of about 8 women got up and started dancing (badly) in front of us. The stage is quite low (about a foot off the ground) and there was approximately 5 feet of open space between our table and the front of the stage; there wasn’t a huge amount of space available, bearing in mind that about 20 feet away to the right of the stage was where the kitchen was located and where the waiting staff brought out hot food.', 'I was annoyed that these women were prancing around in front of us, and totally obscuring our view of the singers with their backsides. If I wanted to see middle-aged women dancing, I would go to a Wetherspoons, where we wouldn’t need to pay £35 per person for this “privilege”. There was a very drunk woman, who was wobbling and flailing her way around this area throughout the performance. I didn’t want to watch her, but I was distracted by her antics the entire time, especially the part where she fell over and smacked her head on the bar. These drunk women gave me the impression that I was in some low-rate, dingy pub, which I’m sure is not the image Boisdale is peddling.', 'We mentioned the drunk people to the maitre d’ and he said, “We encourage this interaction.” Interaction?! This wasn’t interaction, this was the cast of Shameless after a heavy night out. ', 'Tip to those who want to see any performances at this restaurant/venue: sit in the middle. It’s cheaper and you won’t have drunken old people falling on you, slamming back their drinks and breaking their glasses on your table.', 'Other than that, the food was brilliant, and the dessert (Bourbon cheesecake) was even better.']
title: Drifters tribute night - great food, but watch out for the drunken old people

content: ['We booked a Christmas meal for 9 people but only 8 could show up. We were charged for 9 but that was OK. Live music is played and there is a discretionary charge of £15 per head. We were charged 9 instead of 8 - we could have complained but we were entertaining clients.', 'Food is good, views are great, whisky choice is astonishing but prices are really high.']
title: Be Aware of the "Jazz Charge"

content: ['I love the idea of the venue- good music and a great meal. And that´s what we got at Boisdale. I pre-booked our table via web page for ( 2 Dec) gbp20 pp. The set menu is a little limited I had the lambs lettuce and salad cream(that´s all it was!) thena burger which was ok ! my husband had ravioli and steak with a lovely mushroom sauce (not on set menu) you have to order a side dish seperately !we enjoyed a bottle of merlot and a cheese board and cocktails to finish. The service was good and it should be! we noticed when re returned to our hotel that we paid 12.5% 16.76 for (optional) service charge !! on our 134.10 dinner. I think is a little expensive with booking fee as well. I would like to add that we loved the music but the audience didn´t pay much attention to the band due to dinner being served throughout which I thought was a little rude and a shame because it was great music. We come from Barcelona and this would go down a storm but half the price !!!']
title: lovely venue but.....

content: ['Boisdales is a brave new restaurant that I have eaten at twice, both times with great satisfaction. I say brave as it is massive , with a big jazz club restaurant laden with atmosphere and then you have a trendy oyster bar and cigar terrace.', 'The decor is fabulous -sort of Scottish chic and the food faultless.']
title: Great addition to Canary Wharf

content: ['A very good beef steak (the rest was good too), well located in the middle of Canary Wharf, an excellent service provided by Philippe and the lovely company of the Live Jazz Band made our dinner a very enjoyable one.', 'Make sure to check the schedule for the live band as I am not sure they have it every night.', 'If you are into whiskys, they have a huge selection that will most likely please you.', 'A place I would recommend.']
title: Good food, excellent service and nice Jazz live band!

content: ['If this is what you like rent your own cigar box, join and book your premium table, hear adequate always , somttimes phenomenal jazz and headliners, hear Rat Pack tribute Shows (best Frank Sinatra I have seen), stuff your face with oysters, seafood, best steaks and occasionally wagu, foi gras (if your conscious will let you) and live life to the full. If its on the menu they will alter eat or do it differently. I used to have foi gras to start, (I know I shouldnt) and will stop in the New Year. Grouse in season, ask for pink breast and crispy leg , with extra game chips, bread sauce , bacon and gravy. YUMMY. The oyster bar downstairs is great for lunch or pre show if thats all you want, and they have outside terraces and supply members rugs to use if they dont want to sit in the cigar room where you can only smoke ones bought there, but outside anything goes. Different from the one in Belgravia and like them both equally. However if I had to choose probably this rates higher. Say I sent you, Last time there I finished Jerry Springers cigar when he had only had 6 puffs of a £100 aged cuban. terrible or what, but as a kid I picked up dogends!!! Service can be variable, but if it is ask to speak to the Manager, he will be mortified and tries even harder!!!!']
title: Add this to your must do list bon viveurs.

content: ['Superb steak, and ask for Hannah the bar manager if you want any advice on which whiskey to drink and why!']
title: Great experience, and fantastic whiskey

content: ['Solid food all around -- Steak tartare, fish and chips, smoked salmon, nice wine list and excellent Scotch selection! Live Jazz music perfectly complimented dinner.']
title: Enjoy this Scottish Experience

content: ['Posh decor and great service. Food is on average just okay - steak tartare was completely bland, the fish cake however was very good. Chilled bread & butter pudding was interesting but not impressive taste-wise.']
title: A posh gentlemen's club

content: ["Very impressed with the ambiance and the wisky bar. The buena vista social club tribute was very good. Food was amazing, best burger ever and the cheesecake was heaven. Although the meet and greet was very nice, service on the other side was very poor. The sparkling wine came after we had eaten our oysters. Then we ordered teh food and just a bottle of house wine. When the starters came the wine and the bread had not been served. We told that to the food runner and the waiter came with the bread, still no wine. After we finished the starters we asked the hostess about the wine. After another wait the waiter came with a glass of white!! After another wait the bottle of white was brought , just before the mains. We ordered an espresso- whorible. No crema, over-extracted, you wouldn't expect this in a place like that. And finally when we asked for the bill we gto charged £29.50 instead of 17.50 for the wine. Lost of staff around, I think they just need to get themselves organized. Obviously we didn't pay any service charge!"]
title: Great night ruined by poor service

content: ["We went along to Boisdale CW to see if there were any tables available - they didn't actually say no, but in a very patronising manner indicated the oyster bar may have something for us. One of the staff (female)offered to go with us in the lift, and on the way pointed out that there was a cover charge for tables in the restaurant because of the music. We were so offended by a) the patronising attitude of the staff at the door and b) being spoken down to by the female member of staff that we decided we didn't really want to frequent such an establishment!"]
title: Might have been nice ......

content: ["I was for the first time at BCW last night, Had nice cocktail on the terrace before dinner and live music in the restaurant. I was very surprised about the prices. The tickets were only £20 per person and it was very compfy. Food was amazing and my wallet didn't suffer at all. Boisdale of Canary Wharf is not just for Bankers and city workers but also for a normal Bloke like me."]
title: Style and Class combined

content: ["Well, when the music is playing, you need to treat this restaurant as a club, because it is LOUD. I guess what I am saying is that you need to be going not for the food or the company or the conversation, but for the music because everything else will be drowned out. That said, it's not many places that serve such tasty nosh while you listen to music ... and the food here IS good. It's also very expensive - but that's the Canary Wharf location. The location brings other complications: everyone in the room is wearing a suit and works at Canary Wharf. If those don't bother you, we really enjoyed our meal and the wine was great too."]
title: Bring earplugs. Am I showing my age?

content: ['Great service, decoration, food looks great, very good venue and programme; get a table near the window if u can for dinner @ 2 ;)']
title: Excellent jazz club in cwharf, recommended!

content: ['When I first visited this restauarant when it first opened I was initially put off by the decor, which is all tartan and red. Psuedo Scottish highlands country house in a modern Canary Wharf building. However once it got dark the decor actually works, and the food was really good. I have been back several times for lunch and dinner since and the food has been superb everytime. ', 'For my most recent visit i had the mini haggis followed by steak. I think the steak is probably their signature dish. The mini haggis i thoroughly recommend, and the steaks are always well cooked, tender and succulent. ', 'They also have a good range of wine and of course the largest selection of whiskey in Europe. ', "I recommend it for lunch or dinner. The jazz starts at 9pm for which you are charged £30. However if you get in there around 7ish you can be in and out by 9.30 and get a bit of the jazz without paying for a whole evening. Although if you like jazz then it's worth the £30 for the whole evening. ", "There's also an oyster bar, and a cigar room. ", "For the quality of the food it is good value for money and a welcome addition to Canary Wharf. It's certainly on my list of regular haunts."]
title: Great traditional food, well cooked

content: ["We were celebrating my boy-friend's 40th birthday there. We have been given a table with a nice view of the square and fountains below. The staff was very friendly and attentive. We arrived at 6.30pm to give us plenty of time to enjoy food and drink before the show starts at 9pm. The food was really good, one of our guest ordered stake and it tasted fantastic(as we all tried a small piece)! I regretted I didn't order myself, however my food was really good as well. Scottish haggis tasted delicious.", 'The atmosphere was very vibranbt and robus. The show started at 9pm and it was a perfect addition to our night out. Everything just was spot on, tables far apart so it felt private, great food, nice view, really good service and amazing venue. Definately one of the best nights out I had for a long time and the best venue for big birthday celebrations. At the end we even danced for a bit next to the stage! ', 'Top place! Thank you for a great experience!']
title: Excellent 40th Birthday celebration venue
